THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE AND COORDINATION SUPPORT FOR THE FOLLOWING AWARDS:MARINE FISHERIES SPORT FISH AWARDS:MISSISSIPPI ARTIFICIAL REEF PROGRAM (F22AF03695) AND FUTURE SEGMENT.MISSISSIPPI COASTAL SPORT FISH STUDIES (F22AF01260) AND FUTURE SEGMENT.SPORT FISH TAG AND RELEASE IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS AND ADJACENT GULF OF MEXICO (F22AF01444) AND FUTURE SEGMENT.ASSESSMENT OF SPORT FISH SPECIES IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS (F23AF00591) AND FUTURE SEGMENT.AS WELL AS THREE NEW PROJECTS BEGINNING IN FY23.COASTAL RESTORATION AND RESILIENCY AWARDS:BIG:BAY ST LOUIS MUNICIPAL HARBOR (F18AP00531).BAY MARINA (F21AP01630).WAVELAND MARINA (F22AP01154).BLUE MOON PROPERTIES (PENDING FEDERAL APPROVAL).BOATING ACCESS: GAUTIER-SHEPARD PARK  (F21AF00274). BAY ST LOUIS BAYOU LACROIX  (F22AF0159).CVA: MAIN HARBOR STORE  (F21AP04184). CAPTAIN S WHARF MARINA  (F22AP01543).SUB-GRANT RECIPIENT TBD (F22AP01545).SUB-GRANT RECIPIENT TBD (F21AP04183).

THIS GRANT ALLOWS STAFF TO PROTECT AND ENHANCE FISHERIES RESOURCES BY PROVIDING PERMIT AND ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENT REVIEW AND PROVIDING TECHNICAL GUIDANCE REGARDING HABITAT CONSERVATION TO GOVERNMENT AND PRIVATE AGENCIES OR INDIVIDUALS. RECOMMENDATIONS WILL BE BASED UPON THE COMMISSION S POLICIES AND GUIDELINES FOR CONSERVATION FOR WETLANDS AND AQUATIC HABITATS.

THIS GRANT MAINTAINS SPORT FISHERIES IN COLD-, COOL- AND WARM WATER ENVIRONMENTS BY STOCKING FISH IN PUBLIC STREAMS AND LAKES. STOCKING IS CARRIED OUT IN STREAMS AND LAKES WHERE NATURAL POPULATIONS CANNOT BE MAINTAINED, OR WHERE A FISHERY CAN BE CREATED OR IMPROVED. TWENTY TO TWENTY-FIVE TYPES OF FISH AND AROUND 400,000 POUNDS OF FISH ARE STOCKED AT APPROXIMATELY 2,000 SITES.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO CONTINUE ANNUAL SURVEY OF JUVENILE (YOUNG-OF-YEAR) STRIPED BASS IN THE MAJOR VIRGINIA NURSERY AREAS (JAMES, YORK AND RAPPAHANNOCK DRAINAGES).  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PERFORMING TWO REPLICATE SEINE HAULS AT EACH STATION BY DEPLOYING A 100  (30.5M) LONG, 4  (1.22M) DEEP, 1 4  (0.64CM) MESH MINNOW SEINE PERPENDICULAR TO THE SHORELINE AND THEN SWEEPING THE OFFSHORE END ALONG AN ARC DOWN CURRENT AND THEN BACK TO THE BEACH. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE ENSURING THAT STRIPED BASS RECRUITMENT IS ASSESSED IN ALL THE MAJOR SPAWNING AND NURSERY AREAS OF THE VIRGINIA TRIBUTARIES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY. IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING CONTINUITY OF THE HISTORICAL RECORD OF RELATIVE ABUNDANCE OF YOUNG-OF-YEAR STRIPED BASS IN VIRGINIA WATERS, THIS SURVEY ALSO PROVIDES A VALUABLE TOOL FOR ASSESSING THE SUCCESS OF PRESENT MANAGEMENT MEASURES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE ANGLING PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE STRIPED BASS.  THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FUND STATE AGENCY RESEARCH THAT IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE FISHERIES MANAGERS WITH THE INFORMATION AND TECHNIQUES THEY NEED TO MANAGE IOWA FISHERIES TO THEIR GREATEST POTENTIAL AND TO ULTIMATELY IMPROVE FISHING EXPERIENCES FOR IOWA ANGLERS. IN FY24 (JULY 1, 2023 TO JUNE 30, 2024) THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY CONDUCTING 32 INDIVIDUAL RESEARCH PROJECTS. PROJECTS ARE CONDUCTED BY SEVEN DIFFERENT TEAMS, EACH OF WHICH IS FOCUSED ON A DIFFERENT TYPE OF RESOURCE: NATURAL LAKES, SMALL IMPOUNDMENTS, LARGE RESERVOIRS, INTERIOR STREAMS, LARGE RIVERS, FISH CULTURE, AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE DATA ON RELATIVE ABUNDANCE, LENGTH, WEIGHT, SEX RATIO, MATURITY, AGE, AND TROPHIC INTERACTIONS FOR SEVERAL RECREATIONALLY, COMMERCIALLY, AND ECOLOGICALLY IMPORTANT FISHES IN CHESAPEAKE BAY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE SAMPLING OF LATE-JUVENILE AND ADULT FISHES IN CHESAPEAKE BAY USING A BOTTOM TRAWL SURVEY THAT USES A TRAWL NET.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE GATHERING INFORMATION REQUIRED TO SUPPORT SINGLE AND MULTISPECIES ASSESSMENTS OF CHESAPEAKE BAY FISHERIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE ANGLING PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE RESOURCES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SURVEY A SELECTED GROUP OF MARINE SPECIES TO MONITOR TRENDS IN ABUNDANCE AND DISTRIBUTION, DETERMINE POPULATION AGE STRUCTURE AND DEVELOP AGE-SPECIFIC INDICES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE BOTTOM TRAWL SAMPLING OF ADULT GROUNDFISH IN THE DELAWARE BAY USING A 30-FOOT OTTER TRAWL AT 9 FIXED LOCATIONS FROM MARCH THROUGH DECEMBER AND COLLECTING SCALES AND OR OTOLITHS FROM SELECTED SPECIES TO CALCULATE AGE-BASED INDICES. BOTTOM TRAWL SAMPLING OF JUVENILE FISHES IN DELAWARE S ESTUARIES WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED USING A 16-FOOT OTTER TRAWL AT 39 STATIONS IN THE DELAWARE RIVER AND BAY AND AT 12 STATIONS IN THE INDIAN RIVER AND REHOBOTH BAYS FROM APRIL THOUGH OCTOBER. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROVIDING CRUCIAL INFORMATION FOR COASTWIDE STOCK ASSESSMENTS USED IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE NATION S MARINE RESOURCES AND DATA TO ASSIST IN THE IDENTIFICATION OF ESSENTIAL FISH HABITAT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE FISHERIES RESOURCES MANAGERS, ANGLERS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC INTERESTED IN FISHERIES CONSERVATION. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS GRANT.

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW) IS REQUESTING FEDERAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE U.S FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (FWS) SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT (SFRA) TO SUPPORT ONGOING ACTIVITIES DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION OF THE DEPARTMENT S VARIOUS SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROGRAMS IN CALIFORNIA.

FUNDS UNDER THIS AWARD WILL BE USED TO MANAGE SPORT AND RECREATIONAL FISHING ACTIVITIES AT THE BOQUERON STATE FOREST (BSF), THE GUANICA STATE FOREST (GBR), AND THE SUSUA STATE FOREST (SSF) AND TO GET A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE PRESENCE OF AQUATIC BIRDS AND THEIR HABITATS WITHIN THE BSF AND SSF BOUNDARIES. THE COMBINATION OF LOCALITIES WITHIN A SINGLE AWARD WILL ALLOW PUERTO RICO TO DEVELOP A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND DEVELOP STRATEGIES THAT WILL BENEFIT BOTH ANGLERS AND HUNTERS IN THE SOUTHWEST REGION OF PUERTO RICO.

MONITORING OF THE EXISTING STATUS OF FISH POPULATIONS IS AN ESSENTIAL ELEMENT IN EVALUATING RESTORATION PROJECTS,RIVER MANAGEMENT, AND THE ASSOCIATED FISH COMMUNITY. THIS PROJECT HAS SUPPORTED THE COLLECTION OF 38 YEARS OFDATA TO EVALUATE THE MISSOURI RIVER RESTORATION ACTIVITIES. THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO, RESTORE, PROTECT,AND MAINTAIN THE DIVERSITY OF HISTORIC MISSOURI RIVER HABITATS, RESOURCES, AND ECOSYSTEM FUNCTIONS IN ORDER THATPRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS MAY ENJOY CONSUMPTIVE AND NON-CONSUMPTIVE OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY CONTINUED MONITORING OF THE NATIVE FISH SPECIES, TO MAXIMIZE THE OPPORTUNITY FORRECREATIONAL ANGLERS TO USE THE FISHERY RESOURCES OF THE MISSOURI RIVER, AND TO ENHANCE THESE RESOURCES FOR THEBENEFIT OF FISH AND ANGLERS.

OVERVIEW: THIS GRANT AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (USFWS) AND THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DEPARTMENT) WILL BE SUB-AWARDED OUT TO THREE FISHING ORGANIZATIONS TO CONDUCT ANGLER EDUCATION PROGRAMS.BUDGET:   20K FEDERAL SHARE    51K STATE MATCHACTION AREA: WATERBODIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WISCONSIN.GOALS AND OBJECTIVES: CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND CREATE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO INCREASE ANGLER NUMBERS IN WISCONSIN.

THE FISHERY MANAGEMENT PROCESS THAT PROVIDES THE OPPORTUNITY FOR ANGLERS TO FISH FOR ANADROMOUS SPECIES IN CALIFORNIA S CENTRAL VALLEY IS DEPENDENT UPON BASE MONITORING ACTIVITIES THAT ASSESS BOTH THE RESOURCES SUPPORTING THE FISHERIES, AND PERFORMANCE OF THE FISHERIES THEMSELVES. CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW) MANAGERS ARE DEPENDENT UPON THE INFORMATION GENERATED FROM MONITORING TO MAKE SOUND DECISIONS FOR SETTING SEASONS BY TIME AND PLACE, ESTABLISHING DAILY BAG AND POSSESSION LIMITS, IMPOSING GEAR RESTRICTIONS, AND MAKING OVERALL ALLOCATIONS OF FISHERY RESOURCES.THE FISHERIES ARE DIVERSE. THEY INCLUDE MULTI-MILLION-DOLLAR-PER-YEAR FISHERIES ON NATIVE SPECIES SUCH AS CHINOOK SALMON, STEELHEAD RAINBOW TROUT, AND WHITE STURGEON. THE INTRODUCED STRIPED BASS FISHERY IS TYPICALLY THE LARGEST FISHERY IN TERMS OF TOTAL ANGLER EFFORT. THE FISHERIES SUPPORTED BY INTRODUCED SUNFISHES RANGE FROM CONSUMPTIVE  PANFISH  FISHERIES FOR SPECIES SUCH AS BLUEGILL, TO NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED LARGEMOUTH BASS TOURNAMENT FISHERIES. THERE ARE ALSO MORE LOCALIZED NICHE FISHERIES SUCH AS THAT FOR SACRAMENTO SPLITTAIL, A CALIFORNIA NATIVE SPECIES OF SPECIAL CONCERN.EFFECTIVE MONITORING OF THE FISHERIES REQUIRES ANGLER SURVEYS THAT ARE STATISTICALLY ROBUST BY BEING COMPREHENSIVE IN COVERAGE BOTH SPATIALLY AND TEMPORALLY. ANGLER SURVEYS YIELD ESSENTIAL INFORMATION ABOUT FISHERY PERFORMANCE, INCLUDING ESTIMATES OF ANGLING EFFORT, CATCH, AND HARVEST, ALL ON A SPECIES-SPECIFIC BASIS. THIS INFORMATION IS USED TO ASSESS FISHERY TRENDS OVER TIME AND SPACE, BOTH WITHIN AND ACROSS FISHING SEASONS. IT CAN ALSO BE USED FOR DESIGNING REGULATIONS THAT BALANCE UTILIZATION WITH CONSERVATION, INCLUDING THROUGH THE USE OF IN-SEASON CLOSURES.MONITORING OF THESE FISHERIES HAS OCCURRED TO VARYING DEGREES AND USING VARIOUS APPROACHES OVER TIME. EARLY MONITORING FOCUSED ON COMMERCIAL FISHERIES IN THE BAY AND DELTA PORTIONS OF THE SYSTEM (CLARK 1929). MONITORING OF RIVER SPORT FISHERIES IN THE SACRAMENTO RIVER SYSTEM DID NOT OCCUR UNTIL THE LATE 1940S WITH FOCUS ON THE UPPER BASIN FOLLOWING THE CONSTRUCTION OF SHASTA DAM (SMITH 1950). A MORE COMPREHENSIVE ANGLER SURVEY WAS CONDUCTED BY THE CDFW DURING THE MID-1960S (VAN WOERT 1965, 1966, 1968), AND THEN AGAIN DURING THE LATE 1980S   EARLY 1990S (WIXOM ET AL. 1995) AND LATE 1990S-EARLY 2000S (E.G., MURPHY ET AL. 1999  MASSA AND SHROYER 2003). THE CDFW RESUMED THE ANGLER SURVEY IN 2006 AS A SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT (SFRA) FUNDED PROJECT (TITUS 2007) THAT CONTINUES TODAY AS THE CENTRAL VALLEY ANGLER SURVEY (TITUS ET AL. 2012).IN CALIFORNIA, AS THROUGHOUT THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST, ANADROMOUS FISHERY RESOURCES ARE MANAGED IN PART THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF BROADSCALE MARKING AND TAGGING PROGRAMS. THESE PROGRAMS FACILITATE STOCK MANAGEMENT, ALLOW FOR SELECTIVE HARVEST, AND PROVIDE THE BASIS FOR ASSESSING VARIOUS ATTRIBUTES OF THE EXPLOITED RESOURCE, INCLUDING AGE AND GROWTH, FISHERY IMPACTS ON POPULATION STRUCTURE, AND HOMING FIDELITY RELATIVE TO MANAGEMENT OF GENETIC RESOURCES. IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY, MARKING AND TAGGING PROGRAMS ARE FOCUSED ON HATCHERY-PRODUCED CHINOOK SALMON AND STEELHEAD RAINBOW TROUT, AND INCLUDE THE CONSTANT FRACTIONAL MARKING PROGRAM IN WHICH 25  ( 8 MILLION) OF ANNUAL FALL-RUN CHINOOK SALMON HATCHERY PRODUCTION IS ADIPOSE-FIN CLIPPED AND CODED-WIRE TAGGED. CALIFORNIA S CODED-WIRE TAG PROGRAM IS COORDINATED ON A STATEWIDE BASIS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DOCUMENT TEMPORAL AND SPATIAL DISTRIBUTIONS OF FISH POPULATIONS IN LAKEOGALLALA, ASSESS MOVEMENT OF THE FISH COMMUNITY BETWEEN LAKE OGALLALA AND THE INTERCONNECTED CANAL AND RIVERSYSTEMS, AND DOCUMENT TEMPERATURE AND DISSOLVED OXYGEN AVAILABILITY IN RESPONSE TO VARIATIONS IN FLOW IN LAKEOGALLALA AND THE CONNECTED ROCK WEIR FISHERY. THIS STUDY WILL PROVIDE THE NEBRASKA GAME AND PARKS COMMISSION(NGPC) WITH INFORMATION TO SUPPORT ON-GOING EFFORTS TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A QUALITY FISHERY IN THESE WATERS.

THIS GRANT FUNDS THE ACQUISITION OF LAND FOR AQUATIC MANAGEMENT AREAS THROUGHOUT MINNESOTA. THESE LANDS ARE MANAGED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES TO PROTECT SENSITIVE RIPARIAN AREAS FROM ENVIRONMENTAL DEGRADATION, PROTECT NEARSHORE AQUATIC HABITAT, PROVIDE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT ACCESS, PROVIDE ANGLER ACCESS, AND PROTECT HIGHLY SENSITIVE AREAS NECESSARY IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE INTEGRITY OF IMPORTANT AQUATIC FISH COMMUNITIES.

OVERVIEW: THIS GRANT AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (USFWS) AND THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DEPARTMENT) WILL BE SUB-AWARDED OUT TO THREE WISCONSIN SCHOOL DISTRICTS TO CONDUCT ANGLER EDUCATION PROGRAMS.BUDGET:   18K FEDERAL SHARE    9K STATE MATCHACTION AREA: WATERBODIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WISCONSIN.GOALS AND OBJECTIVES: CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS TO INCREASE ANGLER NUMBERS IN WISCONSIN.

OVERVIEW: THIS GRANT AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (USFWS) AND THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DEPARTMENT) WILL BE SUB-AWARDED OUT TO THREE FISHING ORGANIZATIONS TO CONDUCT ANGLER EDUCATION PROGRAMS.BUDGET:   26K FEDERAL SHARE    17K STATE MATCHACTION AREA: WATERBODIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WISCONSIN.GOALS AND OBJECTIVES: CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS TO INCREASE ANGLER NUMBERS IN WISCONSIN.

THIS AGREEMENT HAS PROVIDED FUNDING SUPPORT FOR THE BASE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES AND SPECIFIC PROJECTS OF THE COMMISSION-S INTERSTATE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (ISFMP), FISHERIES SCIENCE PROGRAM, HABITAT PROGRAM, AND THE ATLANTIC COASTAL FISH HABITAT PARTNERSHIP (ACFHP).  THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO AIDE IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE INTERSTATE COMPACT AMONG THE 15 ATLANTIC COAST STATES FOR THE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT OF MIGRATORY ATLANTIC COASTAL SPORT FISHERY RESOURCES.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COORDINATION OF DATA COLLECTION AND RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ON RECREATIONAL FISHERIES, WITH THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF PROVIDING SOUND, ACTIONABLE SCIENTIFIC ADVICE TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DECISIONS.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE HEALTHY, ABUNDANT FISHERY RESOURCES TO SUPPORT BETTER FISHING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE ANGLING PUBLIC. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE ANGLING PUBLIC.  THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT AND INTERPRET FISHERIES INFORMATION TO MAKE INFORMED MANAGEMENTDECISIONS, ENHANCING SPORT FISH POPULATIONS AND ALLOWING ABUNDANT RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES WHILECONSERVING THE RESOURCE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ACROSS THE STATE OF NEBRASKA INCLUDE CONDUCTING FISHPOPULATION SURVEYS (I.E. NETTING, TRAPPING, ELECTROFISHING, ETC.), HUMAN DIMENSIONS SURVEYS (CREELS, PRESSURECOUNTS, QUESTIONNAIRES, ETC.), AND PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL HABITAT EVALUATIONS. THE DATA COLLECTEDDURING THESE INVESTIGATIONS WILL THEN BE UTILIZED TO DEVELOP MANAGEMENT REPORTS AND SURVEY SUMMARIES THAT WILLGUIDE FUTURE MANAGEMENT OF NEBRASKA FISHERIES.THE WORK HEREIN WILL BENEFIT NEBRASKAS AQUATIC RESOURCES BY PROVIDING NGPC FISHERIES STAFF THE ABILITY TOCOLLECT AND INTERPRET SCIENTIFIC DATA, FACILITATING APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES TO ENHANCE SPORT FISHPOPULATIONS AND THEIR HABITATS LONG TERM. THE ANGLING PUBLIC WILL DIRECTLY REAP THE BENEFITS OF IMPROVINGFISHERIES FOR LONG-TERM SUSTAINABILITY AND ULTIMATELY LOCAL ECONOMIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE POTENTIAL OFINCREASED FISHING ACTIVITY PROMPTING MORE TRAVEL AND RECREATION-RELATED EXPENDITURES. IN ADDITION TO FISHERIESAND FISHING-RELATED BENEFITS, MANAGEMENT ACTIONS THAT ULTIMATELY IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND AQUATIC HABITATCONDITIONS GREATLY BENEFIT A NUMBER OF WILDLIFE SPECIES AND CAN PROVIDE EXTENSIVE ECOSYSTEM ENHANCEMENTSPROMOTING MULTI-USE PURPOSES AT NEBRASKAS PUBLIC WATERS.

CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW) PROJECT STAFF COLLECT AND MANAGE FISHERY-DEPENDENT MARINE SPORT FISHING DATA THAT IS ESSENTIAL FOR EFFECTIVE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT WITH THE INTENT TO MAXIMIZE FISHING OPPORTUNITIES WHILE PROTECTING THE FISHERY RESOURCES. THIS INFORMATION IS NECESSARY TO MEET THE MANDATES OF THE MARINE LIFE MANAGEMENT ACT, THE MAGNUSON-STEVENS FISHERY CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT ACT AND THE MODERNIZING MARINE RECREATIONAL FISHERIES ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING MARINE RECREATIONAL FISHERIES SURVEYS, ENTERING, AND MANAGING SURVEY DATA, MANAGEMENT OF COMMERCIAL PASSENGER FISHING VESSEL (CPFV- ALSO KNOWN AS PARTY OR CHARTER BOATS) LOGBOOKS, AND PROVIDING TECHNICAL SUPPORT OF SURVEY DESIGNS FOR SPORT FISHERY STUDIES AND DATA ANALYSIS. WORK CONDUCTED UNDER THIS PROJECT ALIGNS WITH CDFW-S SEVEN STRATEGIC INITIATIVES, AND THE DATA AND ESTIMATES ARE VITAL COMPONENTS OF THE MARINE LIFE MANAGEMENT ACT MASTER PLAN.MARINE FISH PROVIDE SPORT FISHING OPPORTUNITIES IN THREE INTERLINKED ECOSYSTEMS (BAYS AND ESTUARIES, NEAR SHORE OCEAN WATERS, AND OFFSHORE WATERS) ALONG CALIFORNIA-S 1,100-MILE COASTLINE. THE FISH ARE DIVERSE, EXTENSIVE, AND COMPRISE ONE OF THE NATION-S LARGEST AND MOST HEAVILY USED FISHERY RESOURCES WITH ANGLERS TAKING APPROXIMATELY 3.4 MILLION FISHING TRIPS ANNUALLY. CALIFORNIA-S MARINE ENVIRONMENT SUPPORTS 16 MAJOR RECREATIONAL FISHERIES: CALIFORNIA AND PACIFIC HALIBUT, CALIFORNIA SCORPIONFISH, CHINOOK SALMON, FLATFISHES (FLOUNDERS AND SOLES), LINGCOD, PACIFIC MACKEREL, ROCKFISH, SHARKS, STRIPED BASS, SURFPERCHES, TRUE SEA BASSES (KELP BASS, BARRED AND SPOTTED SAND BASSES), TUNAS AND PELAGIC SPECIES, WHITE SEABASS, WHITE STURGEON, YELLOWTAIL (JACK) AND NUMEROUS NICHE FISHERIES (E.G., GRUNION, PACIFIC HERRING, NIGHT SMELT). IN 2019 MARINE RECREATIONAL ANGLERS SPENT  1.2 BILLION ON FISHING ACTIVITIES, ADDING A TOTAL OF  500 MILLION OF ECONOMIC VALUE AND SUPPORTED APPROXIMATELY 8,400 FULL AND PART-TIME JOBS IN CALIFORNIA (NMFS 2022). MANAGEMENT PROCESSES DESIGNED TO HELP SUSTAIN LONG-TERM USE OF MARINE FISH OF SPORT INTEREST HAVE, AT THEIR CORE, DATA GATHERING AND ANALYTICAL COMPONENTS. THE FISHERY DEPENDENT DATA AND ESTIMATES PROVIDED BY THIS PROJECT ARE ESSENTIAL FOR TRACKING HARVEST IN-SEASON, DEVELOPING HARVEST LIMITS, CONDUCTING STOCK ASSESSMENTS, AND EVALUATING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF FISHERY MANAGEMENT POLICIES. IF CRFS DATA AND ESTIMATES ARE NOT PROVIDED, FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DECISIONS WILL NEED TO BE BASED ON PROXIES OF EFFORT AND CATCH RESULTING IN CONSERVATIVE MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES THAT REDUCE OR ELIMINATE RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES.THE REFERENCE SECTION PROVIDES A PARTIAL LIST OF STOCK ASSESSMENTS AND MANAGEMENT PLANS THAT USE FISHERY DEPENDENT INFORMATION OBTAINED THROUGH THIS GRANT.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE CONDUCT OF THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE S (NMFS) MARINE RECREATIONAL INFORMATION PROGRAM (MRIP) ACCESS POINT ANGLER INTERCEPT SURVEY (APAIS). RECREATIONAL ANGLERS THROUGHOUT COASTAL NORTH CAROLINA WILL BE INTERCEPTED AT PUBLIC FISHING ACCESS SITES AND INTERVIEWED TO DETERMINE RECREATIONAL FINFISH CATCH, EFFORT, PARTICIPATION, FISHING MODE, AREA OF FISHING, STATE AND COUNTY OF RESIDENCE, NUMBER OF TRIPS, AND BIOLOGICAL DATA (WEIGHT AND LENGTH BY SPECIES). COLLECTED DATA WILL BE USED TO ASSESS THE HEALTH OF FISH STOCKS AND INFORM APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT MEASURES.THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION (NOAA) HAS AN ESTABLISHED MINIMUM LEVEL OF SAMPLING (ALLOCATIONS) TO ESTIMATE RECREATIONAL CATCH WITH REASONABLE PRECISION ON A REGIONAL SCALE. NOAA BASE ALLOCATIONS ARE IN UNITS OF ASSIGNMENTS (SITE-DAYS) WORKDED, WITHIN NORTH CAROLINA THIS BASE LEVEL IS APPROXIMATELY 5,000 ANGLER INTERCEPTS. FOR STATES SUCH AS NORTH CAROLINA THAT REQUIRE FISHERY MANAGEMENT PLANS (FMPS) FOR STATE MANAGED FISHERIES, LARGER SAMPLE SIZES ARE NECESSARY TO PRODUCE SUFFICIENTLY PRECISE ESTIMATES. A TWO-FOLD INCREASE IN SAMPLING ACHIEVES A 25  IMPROVEMENT IN PRECISION OF ESTIMATES. NORTH CAROLINA HAS CONTINYOUSLY DOUBLED OR TRIPLED LEVELS OF SAMPLING RELATIVE TO THE BASE IN AGREEMENT WITH ATLANTIC COASTAL COOPERATIVE STATISTICS PROGRAM (ACCSP) 2017 RECOMMENDATIONS THAT FUTURE RESOURCES BE FOCUSED ON PPTIXIZING SAMPLOING EFFORT WITH STRATEGIC ALLOCATION OF SAMPLES (AT EXISTING OR INCREASED LEVELS) TO REDUCE PERCENT STANDAR ERRORS (PSES) TO ACCEPTABLE LEVELS. UNTIL NOAA SECURES FUNDING FOR THIS INCREASE IN SAMPLE SIZE, NORTH CAROLINA WILL CONTINUTE TO SUPPLEMENT ACCESS POINT ANGLER INTERCEPT SURVEY (APAIS) SAMPLING WITH ALTERNATIVE FUNDING SOURCES INCLUDING WALLOP-BREAUX AND STATE RECREATIONAL LICESNSE MONIES. FURTHERMORE, NOAA BASE SAMPLING OCCURS DURING PERIODS OF PEAK FISHING ACTIVITY. SAMPLING OUTSIDE OF THIS PEAK TIME IS LESS EFFICIENT BUT INCREDIBLY NECESSARY TO ADEQUATELY REPRESENT FISHING ACTIVITY ANNUALLY. INCREASING SAMPLING ABOVE THE BASE AND DISTRIBUTING IT THROUGHOUT THE YEAR ALLOWS NORTH CAROLINA TO ACHIEVE MORE HOLISTIC PRECISION THROUGH TIME (E.G. WAVE ESTIMATES).

CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW) PROJECT STAFF MONITOR AND ASSESS FISHERIES AND FISH STOCKS AND PROVIDE SCIENCE-BASED RECOMMENDATIONS TO INFORM FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DECISIONS UNDER MIXED STATE AND FEDERAL JURISDICTION. FEDERAL SUPPORT OCCURS BY STAFF PERFORMING THE ANALYTICAL WORK OF ADVISORY BODIES FOR THE PACIFIC FISHERY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL (PFMC). SIMILARLY, PRODUCTS AND CONTENT PRODUCED UNDER THIS GRANT ARE USED BY THE CALIFORNIA FISH AND GAME COMMISSION (COMMISSION) IN ITS PROCESSES. WORK FOCUSES ON EFFORTS TO DEVELOP, ADOPT, AMEND AND OR IMPLEMENT FISHERY MANAGEMENT PLANS (FMPS) FOR THE PFMC AND THE COMMISSION. THIS PROJECT ALSO PARTICIPATES IN STOCK ASSESSMENTS TO INFORM MANAGERS ON THE STATUS OF FISHED POPULATIONS, INCLUDING THE LEVEL OF FISHERY REMOVALS THAT CAN BE SAFELY SUPPORTED WHILE MAXIMIZING FISHING OPPORTUNITIES. IN ADDITION, CDFW COLLABORATES WITH RESEARCHERS ON TOPICS OF BIOLOGICAL OR MANAGEMENT INTEREST.A KEY FOCAL AREA OF WORK UNDER THIS AGREEMENT SURROUNDS OUTREACH EFFORTS AND PRODUCTS TO ASSIST THE RECREATIONAL FISHING COMMUNITY WITH INFORMATION TO AID WITH COMPLIANCE AND UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT MANAGEMENT. ACTIVITIES RANGE FROM: DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF WEB CONTENT  ATTENDANCE AT CONFERENCES, PUBLIC EVENTS, AND FISHERY SEASON OPENERS  DEVELOPMENT OF INFORMATIVE HANDOUT MATERIALS  AND HOLDING PUBLIC MEETINGS.TO ACTIVELY MANAGE MIXED JURISDICTION FISHERIES IN A SUSTAINABLE, BALANCED, COLLABORATIVE, AND TIMELY MANNER, CDFW MUST BE FULLY ENGAGED IN FEDERAL AND STATE MANAGEMENT PROCESSES TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY IN ANALYSES AND PLAN DEVELOPMENT. CDFW INVOLVEMENT IS IMPERATIVE TO INFORM MANAGEMENT DECISIONS FOR A VARIETY OF SPECIES OF INTEREST TO THE MARINE RECREATIONAL FISHING COMMUNITY AND THE CALIFORNIA CURRENT ECOSYSTEM (CCE). KEY RECREATIONAL FISHERIES MANAGED UNDER THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE GROUNDFISH (E.G., ROCKFISH, LINGCOD, FLATFISH), PACIFIC HALIBUT AND HIGHLY MIGRATORY SPECIES (HMS  E.G., TUNAS, DORADO, SOME SHARKS AND BILLFISHES). ALSO INCLUDED ARE COASTAL PELAGIC SPECIES (CPS) WHICH FORM A MAJOR COMPONENT OF RECREATIONAL FISHERIES BAIT AND ARE CRITICAL TO SUCCESSFUL ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES. AS STATE AND FEDERAL MANAGEMENT DEVELOP A MORE ECOSYSTEM-BASED APPROACH, PFMC WORK ALSO INCLUDES ACTIVITIES DIRECTED TO CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THESE FISHED SPECIES AND THE GREATER CCE (E.G., PREDATORS, PREY, ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS AND INDICATORS).SUPPORTING CDFW INVOLVEMENT IN THESE PROCESSES USING SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT (SFRA) FUNDS IS JUSTIFIED BASED ON THE HIGH PROPORTION OF RECREATIONAL ANGLERS PARTICIPATING IN THESE FISHERIES, THE HIGH PROPORTION OF FISHERY MORTALITY OF KEY NEARSHORE AND SHELF ROCKFISH AND LINGCOD STOCKS BY CALIFORNIA-S RECREATIONAL FISHERY, AND IN RECOGNITION THAT ECOSYSTEM-LEVEL INFORMATION IS NEEDED TO ENSURE THE CONTINUED AVAILABILITY OF HARVESTABLE RESOURCES THAT ARE OF HIGH INTEREST TO RECREATIONAL USERS. THIS WORK PROVIDES THE SCIENTIFIC FOUNDATION FOR SUSTAINABLE USE OF GROUNDFISH, PACIFIC HALIBUT, HMS, AND CPS RESOURCES AND UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR CONNECTIONS TO THE ECOSYSTEM  CONTINUATION OF THIS WORK IS ESSENTIAL FOR EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF THESE IMPORTANT FISHERIES.

THE ALABAMA MARINE RESOURCES DIVISION (MRD) WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE SOUTHEASTERN COOPERATIVE FISH DISEASE PROJECT (SCFDP) HOSTED BY AUBURN UNIVERSITY TO SUPPORT FISHERIES PARASITE AND DISEASE INVESTIGATIONS AND DIAGNOSTICS  FISH DISEASE RESEARCH  THE EVALUATION OF DRUGS, CHEMOTHERAPEUTICS AND VACCINES FOR FISH  AND OTHER STUDIES INVOLVING FISHERIES DISEASES. AGENCIES CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF MANAGEMENT OF FISHERIES WITHIN THEIR STATES OFTEN HAVE TRAINED PERSONNEL TO INVESTIGATE MOST FISH KILLS BUT MAY NEED ASSISTANCE IN DIAGNOSING SOME PROBLEMS. CONTINUING EDUCATION ABOUT FISH DISEASES IS IMPORTANT FOR AGENCY EMPLOYEES SO THAT THEY CAN EFFECTIVELY SOLVE PROBLEMS RELATED TO FISH HEALTH. ALSO, STATE AGENCIES NEED RESULTS OF RESEARCH, WHICH CAN AFFECT MANAGEMENT OF FISHERIES AND OPERATIONS OF FISH HATCHERIES. ALTHOUGH PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE IN UNDERSTANDING SOME FISH HEALTH PROBLEMS, MANY FISH DISEASES ARE STILL POORLY UNDERSTOOD. IMPROVED METHODS ARE NEEDED TO DETECT AND IDENTIFY FISH PATHOGENS SO THAT THE COST AND TIME REQUIRED FOR DIAGNOSIS OF DISEASES CAN BE REDUCED. A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE TRANSMISSION AND PATHOGENESIS OF DISEASE AGENTS, ESPECIALLY IN FISH HATCHERIES, IS IMPORTANT FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF FISH DISEASES.

OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE FUNDS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WORK COMPLETED BY PARTNER AGENCY, OREGON STATE MARINE BOARD, IN ORDER TO HELP DEVELOP BOATING ACCESS PROJECTS TO SUPPORT OREGON RECREATIONAL BOATING. THIS GRANT HELPS TO DEVELOP DESIGNS, PLAN AND HELP ODFW AND PARTNERS GET PERMITS NEEDED TO COMPLETE BOATING ACCESS PROJECTS STATEWIDE.

THE GRAND VIEW BOATING ACCESS SITE, LOCATED IN OWYHEE COUNTY, IDAHO IS AN EXISTING BOAT RAMP AND PARKING AREA ON THE SNAKE RIVER IN GRAND VIEW, IDAHO. THE SITE, OWNED BY OWYHEE COUNTY, PROVIDES NEEDED RIVER ACCESS FORRECREATIONAL BOATERS, ANGLERS, WATERFOWL HUNTERS, AND OTHER OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL USERS. CURRENTLY THE RAMP IS NOTFULLY USEABLE PARTICULARLY DURING THE LOW WATER PERIOD FROM AUGUST THROUGH MARCH AS IT IS PLAGUED BY A SHALLOWSLOPE WHICH RESULTS IN UNDESIRABLE CONDITIONS FOR LAUNCHING AND LOADING BOATS. IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME(IDFG) RECOGNIZES THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTNER WITH OWYHEE COUNTY TO IMPROVE THE BOAT RAMP AND INCREASE ITS UTILITYFOR BOATERS, ANGLERS, WATERFOWL HUNTERS AND OTHER RECREATIONAL USERS.

RIVER IN IDAHOS SOUTHWEST REGION. THE SITE HAS PROVIDED CONVENIENT RIVER ACCESS FOR RECREATIONAL BOATERS,ANGLERS, WATERFOWL HUNTERS, AND OTHER OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL USERS SINCE THE 1950S AND WAS RECENTLY ACQUIRED BYTHE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME USING SPORT FISH RESTORATION BOATING ACCESS FUNDS. THE SITE IS HEAVILY USED ANNUALLY FROM MARCH THROUGH NOVEMBER WITH ADDITIONAL LIMITED WINTER USE, AND IT CONTINUES TO GROW IN POPULARITY. THE SITE ACQUISITION INCLUDED AN EXISTING BOAT RAMP CONSTRUCTED IN 1954 AND AN UNDER-DEVELOPED PARKING AREA. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO ADDRESS SAFETY CONCERNS WITH THE BOAT RAMP, INSTALLATION OF A CONCRETE PAD FOR PLACEMENT OF A PORTABLE RESTROOM, INSTALLATION OF AN INFORMATIONAL KIOSK AND RENOVATION OF THE PARKING AREA.

THE ARIZONA GAME AND FISH DEPARTMENT, SEEKS FUNDING FOR THE ENGINEERING DESIGN OFIMPROVEMENTS AT WILLOW SPRINGS LAKE. THESE IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE: WIDENING THE EXISTING BOAT RAMP  REPLACING THE EXISTING COURTESY DOCK AND IMPROVEMENTS TO THE PARKING AREA. THE PARKING AREA IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE A NEW PARKING LOT TO INCREASE CAPACITY AND WIDENING THE CURRENT DRIVEWAY TO ENHANCE TRAFFIC FLOW. THIS DESIGN WHEN IMPLEMENTED WOULD ALLOW FOR INCREASED RECREATION TO BOATERS AT WILLOW SPRING LAKE.

THE MARINE LIFE MANAGEMENT ACT (MLMA) IS CALIFORNIA-S PRIMARY FISHERIES MANAGEMENT LAW. IT DIRECTS THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (CDFW) TO DEVELOP A MASTER PLAN. THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THE MASTER PLAN IS TO PROVIDE GUIDANCE FOR THE SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF FISH STOCKS AND FISHERIES USING THE BEST AVAILABLE SCIENCE. AMONG THE MANY AREAS OF GUIDANCE ARE: 1) PRIORITIZATION OF MANAGEMENT EFFORTS  2) MEETING STOCK SUSTAINABILITY OBJECTIVES  3) MEETING ECOSYSTEM OBJECTIVES (INCLUDING MINIMIZING IMPACT TO HABITAT AND BYCATCH SPECIES FROM THE NORMAL PROMULGATION OF FISHERIES, 4) ADAPTING TO CLIMATE CHANGE  5) DATA COLLECTION TO ANALYZE TRENDS IN FISHERIES  AND 6) PROVIDING THE PUBLIC WITH RELEVANT SCIENTIFIC DATA SUMMARIES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR ENGAGEMENT. AS PART OF THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE MLMA, CDFW COMPLETED A FISHERY PRIORITIZATION EXERCISE FOR STATE-MANAGED FINFISH SPECIES. THOSE FISHERIES WITH HIGHEST OVERALL VULNERABILITY ARE CONSIDERED THE HIGHEST CANDIDATES FOR FUTURE ATTENTION AND MANAGEMENT ACTION, USING A SCALED MANAGEMENT APPROACH. THIS APPROACH INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING OPTIONS: ADDITIONAL DATA COLLECTION  MANAGEMENT STRATEGY EVALUATION (MSE)  DEVELOPMENT AND UPDATES OF ENHANCED STATUS REPORTS (ESR)  AND A COMBINATION OF AN ESR AND A SCALED MANAGEMENT APPROACH, WHICH MAY INCLUDE A FISHERY MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE PRIORITIZATION PROCESS IDENTIFIED THE FOLLOWING SIX FINFISH SPECIES FOR WHICH THE PROJECT HAS MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITY TO FOCUS EFFORTS: BARRED SURFPERCH (AMPHISTICUS ARGENTEUS), REDTAIL SURFPERCH (A. RHODOTERUS), CALIFORNIA HALIBUT (HALIBUT) (PARALICHTHYS CALIFORNICUS), NIGHT SMELT (SPIRINCHUS STARKSI), SURF SMELT (HYPOMESUS PRETIOSUS), AND WHITE SEABASS (ATRACTOSCION NOBILIS).ESSENTIAL FISHERY INFORMATION (EFI) COLLECTED BY FISHERY SCIENTISTS IS NEEDED TO ASSESS AND MANAGE THESE IMPORTANT SPORT FISHERIES. FISH AND GAME CODE SECTION 93 DEFINES EFI AS INFORMATION ABOUT FISH LIFE HISTORY AND HABITAT REQUIREMENTS  THE STATUS AND TRENDS OF FISH POPULATIONS, FISHING EFFORT, AND CATCH LEVELS  FISHERY EFFECTS ON AGE STRUCTURE AND ON OTHER MARINE LIVING RESOURCES AND USERS, AND ANY OTHER INFORMATION RELATED TO THE BIOLOGY OF A FISH SPECIES OR TO TAKING IN THE FISHERY THAT IS NECESSARY TO PERMIT FISHERIES TO BE MANAGED ACCORDING TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS CODE . THE PRIMARY TYPES OF EFI COLLECTED OR DETERMINED BY OUR STATE FINFISH RESEARCH AND MANAGEMENT PROJECT (PROJECT) USING SFRA FUNDS ARE AGE AND GROWTH, REPRODUCTION, AND OTHER LIFE HISTORY PARAMETERS THAT ARE IMPORTANT FOR MANAGING A SUSTAINABLE FISHERY. CDFW ALSO COLLECTS FISHERY DEPENDENT DATA ON FISHING EFFORT AND CATCH LEVELS.A KEY COMPONENT OF THE ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT MANDATED BY THE MLMA IS A PROCESS TO USE THE DATA COLLECTED TO UNDERSTAND HOW THE SYSTEM IS RESPONDING TO MANAGEMENT. MSE IS THE GENERIC TERM USED FOR A CLASS OF ANALYSES THAT TEST POTENTIAL MANAGEMENT PROCEDURES AND EXPLICITLY ADDRESS THE TRADE-OFFS AND LEVELS OF UNCERTAINTY ASSOCIATED WITH THEM. IN MSE, THE ENTIRE FISHERY MANAGEMENT CYCLE IS SIMULATED OVER A SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD TO UNDERSTAND HOW EACH ASPECT OF THE MANAGEMENT PROCEDURE IS LIKELY TO PERFORM IN BOTH THE SHORT- AND LONG-TERM. MSE REPRESENTS AN EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY TO PARTNER WITH STAKEHOLDERS, ACADEMICS, AND OTHER OUTSIDE EXPERTS TO ACCURATELY AND COMPREHENSIVELY CHARACTERIZE THE FISHERY AND ITS MANAGEMENT GOALS. MSES HAVE BEEN COMPLETED OR ARE BEING COMPLETED FOR HALIBUT AND SURFPERCH BY NON-SFRA FUNDED CDFW STAFF AND HAVE INFORMED DISCUSSIONS ABOUT MANAGEMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY.THE GOAL OF ESRS IS TO PROVIDE AN OVERVIEW OF THE SPECIES, FISHERY, CURRENT MANAGEMENT AND MONITORING EFFORTS, AND FUTURE MANAGEMENT NEEDS, AND PROVIDE TRANSPARENCY AROUND DATA AND INFORMATION THAT IS UNAVAILABLE OR UNKNOWN.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO ADMINISTER WILDLIFE AND SPORT FISH RESTORATION GRANTS FOR SCIENTIFICALLY DESIGNED AND CAREFULLY MANAGED FISHERIES AND WILDLIFE PROJECTS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE OVERSIGHT OF ALL ASPECTS OF GRANTS MANAGEMENT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH STATE AND FEDERAL REGULATIONS AND STANDARDS THROUGH ADMINISTRATIVE, TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE NATURAL RESOURCES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

THE ARIZONA GAME AND FISH SEEKS FUNDING TO PERFORM AN ANALYSIS OF THE FOOL HOLLOW DAM. THIS DAM IS CLASSIFIED AS HIGH HAZARD WITH AN UNSAFE DESIGNATION. THIS ANALYSIS WILL LOOK INTO THE DAMS INTEGRITY, STABILITY, CAPACITY AND POTENTIAL FAILURE MODES. THIS WILL BE THE FIRST PHASE OF A MULTI PHASE PROJECT TO ASSESS THE DAM, DESIGN ALTERNATIVES AND TO ULTIMATELY REHABILITATE THE DAM.

THE OVERALL PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENHANCE RECREATIONAL SPORT FISH POPULATIONS AND PROVIDE INCREASED RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MISSOURI.THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATION (DEPARTMENT) IS THE STATE AGENCY CHARGED WITH MANAGING THE STATE S RECREATIONAL SPORT FISHERIES. ALTHOUGH THE MAJORITY OF MISSOURI S FISHERIES ARE SUPPORTED BY COMPLETELY SELF SUSTAINING FISH POPULATIONS, FISH STOCKING HAS BEEN A VERY IMPORTANT METHOD OF DEVELOPING, MAINTAINING, AND IMPROVING QUALITY SPORT FISHING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE FOR A LARGE NUMBER OF PEOPLE. IT IS THE DEPARTMENT S STATUTORY RESPONSIBILITY TO OPERATE FISH HATCHERIES AND STOCK FISH TO MEET THE NEEDS OF MISSOURI S ANGLERS, IN ADDITION TO CONSERVING AND MANAGING EXISTING FISH POPULATIONS. WITHOUT SUPPLEMENTAL STOCKING EFFORTS, MANY OF THE STATE S RECREATIONALLY IMPORTANT SPORT FISH SPECIES WOULD DECLINE TO UNVIABLE LEVELS WHICH WOULD ULTIMATELY RESULT IN UNACCEPTABLY LOW ANGLER CATCH RATES. THIS GRANT INCLUDES THE STOCKING OF OVER 4 MILLION FISH IN THE STATE S STREAMS AND LAKES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THIS GRANT ALSO INCLUDES AN UPGRADE TO SEVERAL OF IT S STATE RUN FISH HATCHERIES TO IMPROVE THEIR MONITORING AND ALARM SYSTEMS TO BE MORE RELIABLE, AND ALSO SO THAT THE HATCHERIES COULD BE MONITORED REMOTELY.MISSOURI ANGLERS WILL CONTINUE TO ENJOY QUALITY FISHING AT OVER 900 PUBLIC LAKES AND ABOUT 20 STREAM AREAS FOR POPULAR SPORT FISHES THAT WOULD NOT BE PRESENT OR AS ABUNDANT WITHOUT PERIODIC MAINTENANCE FISH STOCKINGS. THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT ANGLERS THROUGH INCREASED CATCH AND SATISFACTION RATES. PARTICIPANTS OF THE SPECIAL FISHING EVENTS CONDUCTED THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT S AQUATIC RESOURCE EDUCATION PROGRAM WILL ALSO HAVE A VERY GOOD CHANGE OF CATCHING AT LEAST ONE FISH DURING THE EVENT.

THIS GRANT FUNDS ACTIVITIES CENTRAL TO THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES FISHERIES SECTION LAKE AND STREAM FISHERIES MANAGEMENT FRAMEWORK. THE MANAGEMENT FRAMEWORK CONSISTS OF A CYCLE OF PLANNING, CONDUCTING SURVEYS, EVALUATING, AND ADJUSTING MANAGEMENT ACTIONS. THIS FRAMEWORK IS SCIENCE BASED AND RELIES ON PROPERLY TRAINED EMPLOYEES, ROBUST DATA SYSTEMS, AND COORDINATION. THE FRAMEWORK IS LARGELY BUILT ON INDIVIDUAL LAKE AND STREAM MANAGEMENT BUT OPERATES WITHIN A BROADER LANDSCAPE CONTEXT AND THEREFORE ENSURES MANAGEMENT DECISIONS ARE MADE AT SUFFICIENTLY BROAD AND LONG TERM SCALES. THE MANAGEMENT FRAMEWORK OUTLINED IN THIS GRANT IS DEFINED BY SEVEN ACTIVITIES  1) MANAGEMENT PLANNING, 2) LAKE AND STREAM SURVEYS, 3) CREEL SURVEYS, 4) MANAGEMENT EVALUATIONS, 5) PROFESSIONAL TRAINING, AND 6) INTERNAL COORDINATION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE S FISHERIES DISTRICT MANAGEMENT EFFORTS THROUGHOUT THE STATE. A TOTAL OF SEVEN FISHERIES DISTRICTS AND TWO HATCHERIES TRANSPORTATION SECTIONS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THIS FUNDING. ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE DISTRICT FISH MANAGEMENT SAMPLING TECHNICAL GUIDANCE COORDINATION, FISH PROPAGATION AND STOCKING, AND ROUTINE MAINTENANCE OF THE DISTRICT OFFICES AND HATCHERY BUILDINGS GROUNDS.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT ECOLOGICALLY SOUND, SCIENCE BASED FISHERIES CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE DATA COLLECTION, RESEARCH AND MONITORING ON THE HEALTH, ABUNDANCE, DISTRIBUTION, AND HARVEST OF SALTWATER FISHES IN CONNECTICUT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE MAINTAINING HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE POPULATIONS OF FISHERIES RESOURCES WITHIN BIOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL LIMITS, WHICH SUPPORTS THE BUREAU OF NATURAL RESOURCES  MISSION OF CONSERVATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE NATURAL RESOURCES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

PORT OF BANDON WILL HANDLE ALL ADMINISTRATION, CONTRACTING,PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION AND CONSTRUCTION FOR REPLACEMENT OF BOAT RAMP, ABUTMENT, PILING, NONMOTORIZED LAUNCHINGDOCK AND INSTALLING BOARDING DOCKS.

ODFW WILL USE USFWS SPORT FISH RESTORATION FUNDS TO SUB GRANT TO OREGON PARKS AND RECREATION DEPARTMENT (OPRD) TOUPGRADE AND CONSTRUCT BOATING ACCESS FACILITY AT MAYER STATE PARK BOAT RAMP. OPRD WILL HANDLE ALL ADMINISTRATION,CONTRACTING, PLANNING,IMPLEMENTATION AND CONSTRUCTION OF BOAT RAMP, BOARDING DOCKS, PARKING LOT MANEUVER AREA,STORMWATER TREATMENT AND VAULT TOILET.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS ANNUAL GRANT IS TO IMPROVE FISH HABITAT WITHIN KENTUCKY S LAKES, PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION FOR THE FISHING IN THE NEIGHBORHOODS (FINS) PROGRAMS, AND SUPPORT THE STREAMS INVESTIGATIONS PROGRAM ALL WITHIN THE FISHERIES DIVISION OF THE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PLACEMENT OF FISH HABITAT STRUCTURES, SAMPLING AND PROGRAM OVERSIGHT OF URBAN FISHERIES (FINS), AND SAMPLING OF VARIOUS SPORTFISH POPULATIONS WITHIN WARM WATER STREAMS IN KENTUCKY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT ANGLING ACTIVITIES IN DELAWARE S PUBLIC NON TIDAL WATER BODIES BY MANAGING GAMEFISH POPULATIONS, ENHANCING FISH HABITAT, AND COLLECTING ANGLER CATCH AND EFFORT STATISTICS FOR ANALYSIS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE MONITORING FRESHWATER FISH POPULATIONS AND IMPLEMENTING MANAGEMENT ACTIONS NEEDED TO ENSURE A BALANCED FISH COMMUNITY THAT SUPPORTS RECREATIONAL ANGLING, ENHANCING IN WATER HABITAT IN KEY AREAS, COLLECTING ANGLING STATISTICS THROUGH SURVEYS AND FISHING TOURNAMENT REPORTS, AND MAINTAINING SMALL PUBLIC FISHING PONDS THAT SUPPORT SHORE ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE VIABLE FRESHWATER GAMEFISH POPULATIONS THAT SUPPORT RECREATIONAL ANGLING, PROMOTION OF BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES DURING TOURNAMENTS, AND USE OF ANGLER CATCH AND EFFORT STATISTICS TO PRIORITIZE ACCESS AND FISHERIES MANAGEMENT NEEDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RECREATIONAL ANGLERS AND FISHERIES BIOLOGISTS AND MANAGERS WORKING TO IMPROVE GAMEFISH POPULATIONS AND FISH HABITAT IN DELAWARE S NON TIDAL WATER BODIES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROJECT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MONITOR MARINE SPORT FISH HEALTH IN FLORIDA WATERS  TO IDENTIFY EMERGING DISEASE AND GEOGRAPHIC AREAS OF SPECIAL CONCERN  TO ESTABLISH BASELINE HEALTH DATA FOR A MARINE SPORT FISH TO GAUGE WHAT IS OUTSIDE OF NORMAL TO ENSURE HATCHERY FISH DO NOT NEGATIVELY IMPACT WILD POPULATIONS AND TO ESTIMATE HEALTH IMPACTS FROM STOCHASTIC EVENTS, FISHING PRESSURE, AND HABITAT DEGRADATION  AND TO CONDUCT FISH DISEASE RESEARCH TO UNDERSTAND RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN FISH, PATHOGENS, AND THE ENVIRONMENT. WE ALSO MAINTAIN AND MONITOR THE FWC MARINE FISH KILL HOTLINE TO DOCUMENT, RESPOND TO, AND TRACK FISH KILLS, AND TO PROVIDE INFORMATION TO STAKEHOLDERS AND RESOURCE MANAGERS AS NEEDED. WE PROMOTE CONSERVATION THROUGH OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS.

THE MARINE RESOURCE GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (MRGIS) PROGRAM STRIVES TO FILL SEVERAL ONGOING NEEDS FOR DATA COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND DISSEMINATION. STAFF IN THIS PROGRAM ACQUIRE UPDATED SPATIAL DATA ON THE LOCATION AND QUANTITY OF IMPORTANT SPORT FISH HABITATS, PERFORM ANALYSES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND FISH HABITAT REQUIREMENTS, AND PROVIDE THESE DATA IN EASILY ACCESSIBLE FORMS TO RESOURCE MANAGERS, FISHERMEN, AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES TO BETTER INFORM HABITAT AND FISHERIES MANAGEMENT AND RECREATIONAL USE OF COASTAL AREAS THROUGHOUT FLORIDA. HABITAT DATA AND ANALYSES FROM THE MRGIS ALSO INFORM HABITAT RESTORATION EFFORTS AND CONTRIBUTE TO EDUCATIONAL AND SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS. PROGRAM STAFF WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN AND UPGRADE THE MRGIS, WHICH IS AN ONLINE ACCESSIBLE DIGITAL PLATFORM THAT STORES CURRENT MARINE GIS DATA FOR FLORIDA. THE DATABASE CONTAINS NUMEROUS GIS DATA LAYERS THAT HAVE BEEN CAREFULLY SELECTED FOR ACQUISITION BASED ON THE REQUIREMENTS DRIVEN BY RECREATIONAL FISHING NEEDS AND MARINE RESOURCE ISSUES IN FLORIDA. THE PROGRAM S STAFF CONTINUOUSLY IMPROVE THE MARINE RESOURCES GIS WITH THE LATEST INFORMATION AS IT BECOMES AVAILABLE, INCLUDING HABITATS CRUCIAL TO ECONOMICALLY VALUABLE FISHERY SPECIES. STAFF UNDER THIS PROGRAM ALSO USE MODERN TECHNOLOGY TO UPDATE AND IMPROVE MAPS OF MARINE HABITATS. STAFF ALSO USE THE NEWEST WEB BASED TECHNOLOGY TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO THESE DATA TO THE PUBLIC, PRIVATE COMPANIES, SCIENTISTS, SCHOOLS, AS WELL AS STATE, FEDERAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL RESOURCE MANAGERS. STAFF MAINTAIN AND UPDATE WEB MAPPING APPLICATIONS ALLOWING USERS TO VIEW AND QUERY DATA, AND DIRECTLY DOWNLOAD DATA AND METADATA ONLINE. THIS PROGRAM CONTINUES TO DIRECTLY SERVE THE NEEDS OF MULTITUDES OF FISHERMAN AND BOATERS THROUGHOUT FLORIDA TO ACCESS THE NEWEST MRGIS DATA THROUGH MAPPING PRODUCTS, INCLUDING AS A SERIES OF POPULAR BOATING AND ANGLING GUIDES. THE MARINE RESOURCE GIS, AND THE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERTISE OF SPECIFIC MRGIS STAFF ARE ALSO KEY IN RESPONDING TO COASTAL AND MARINE THREATS VIA EMERGENCY CONTINGENCY PLANNING AND RESPONSE.

OVERVIEW  THE TOWN OF COLFAX WILL PROVIDE ADA ACCESS TO SHORE FISHING BY ADDING A FISHING PIER TO FERRY POND IN THE COLFAX RED CEDAR PRESERVE AND RECREATION AREA (CRCPRA).BUDGET   30,000 FEDERAL SHARE   30,000 LOCAL MATCHACTION AREA  THIS GRANT WILL TAKE PLACE ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF FERRY POND, ADJACENT TO THE VILLAGE OF COLFAX, DUNN CO.OUTCOME  THE TOWN ANTICIPATES AN IMMEDIATE INCREASE IN SHORE FISHING ACTIVITY, ESPECIALLY FOR THOSE WITH MOBILITY LIMITATIONS. THE CRCPRA COMMISSION IS PLANNING TO START A JUNIOR ANGLER PROGRAM IN 2024. THE CRCPRA IS ON FACEBOOK, THREE MUNICIPALITY WEBSITES, AND IS INVOLVED WITH THE LOCAL SPORTS CLUBS. IT CURRENTLY DRAWS VISITORS FROM OTHER WISCONSIN COUNTIES AND MINNESOTA.

THIS GRANT FUNDS MANY OF MINNESOTA S FISHERIES RESEARCH PROJECTS. THESE PROJECTS PROVIDE THE INFORMATION NEEDED TO PROTECT AND MANAGE MINNESOTA S AQUATIC RESOURCES AND FISH COMMUNITIES. RESULTS OF THIS WORK HELP AQUATIC MANAGERS IDENTIFY EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES.

THERE IS AN EXPLICIT NEED FOR THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE AND PARKS (KDWP) TO ENGAGE KANSANS IN AQUATICRESOURCE EDUCATION AND SPORT FISHING EDUCATION. BY ENGAGING THE PUBLIC, KDWP CAN HELP MAKE THEM WELL INFORMEDCITIZENS REGARDING AQUATIC RESOURCES, THEREBY INCREASING THEIR VALUATION AND APPRECIATION, AS WELL AS THEIRCONFIDENCE IN THEIR ABILITY TO UTILIZE THE RESOURCES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS FUNDING WILL BE TO AUGMENT STATE AND REGIONAL PROGRAMS THAT CONSERVE, MANAGE AND DEVELOP MARINE RECREATIONAL FISHERIES ON THE PACIFIC COAST. PSMFC WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS IN 2023 BY SUPPORTING THE RESTORATION OF FRESH WATER AND ESTUARINE ENVIRONMENTS IMPORTANT TO THE REGION S SPORT FISH SPECIES, UNDERTAKING A REGIONALLY COORDINATED AQUATIC NUISANCE SPECIES (ANS) PREVENTION PROGRAM FOR THE WEST COAST, THE REGIONAL COASTAL CUTTHROAT TROUT DATA PROJECT AND THE 2023 STEELHEAD MANAGEMENT WORKSHOP.

THIS STUDY FOCUSES ON COLLECTING DATA TO UNDERSTAND HOW MOVEMENT AND REPRODUCTIVE PROCESSES AFFECT THE VULNERABILITY AND PRODUCTIVITY OF IMPORTANT FLORIDA MARINE FISH AND THEIR ABILITY TO SUSTAIN FISHING AND OTHER STRESSORS. THIS ECOLOGICAL RISK ASSESSMENT WILL IMPROVE OUR ABILITY TO MANAGE FOR SUSTAINABILITY. STUDY PARAMETERS INCLUDE REPRODUCTIVE LIFESPAN, ANNUAL BREEDING EVENTS, SPAWNING MIGRATIONS AND SPAWNING SITE SELECTION, SPAWNING SITE DIVERSITY AND INTRA SPECIES DENSITY, LARVAL DISPERSAL DISTANCE, AND RECRUITMENT VARIABILITY. WE HAVE VERY LITTLE DATA ON MOST OF THESE TRAITS OR HOW THEY AFFECT VULNERABILITY TO SPATIAL STRESSORS LIKE RED TIDE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUSTAIN LONG TERM MONITORING OF RECREATIONALLY IMPORTANT FISHES IN SUPPORT OF ONGOING ASSESSMENT AND MANAGEMENT NEEDS. ANNUAL TRAWL AND SEINE SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED IN FLORIDA S ESTUARINE WATERS TO PROVIDE DATA ON THE ABUNDANCE, SIZE COMPOSITION, AND AGE COMPOSITION OF ESTUARINE SPORT FISH AND THEIR PREY. ANALYSES OF PROJECT DATA WILL PRODUCE CRITICAL INPUTS FOR BOTH SINGLE SPECIES AND MULTISPECIES ASSESSMENT MODELS. THESE DATA PRODUCTS AND RESULTING ASSESSMENT MODELS WILL PROVIDE NECESSARY FISHERIES INDEPENDENT INFORMATION ON THE STATUS OF RECREATIONALLY IMPORTANT ESTUARINE FISH STOCKS AND AID IN DETERMINING WHAT MANAGEMENT MEASURES ARE NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF SPORT FISH POPULATIONS FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS.

THE SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT (SFRA), AQUATIC EDUCATION RESOURCE PROGRAM, GEORGE H. W. BUSH EDUCATION FUND, VARNES A PESCAR GRANT PROVIDES MULTIPLE OPPORTUNITIES TO EDUCATE YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES TO PARTICIPATE AS ANGLERS AND PROMOTE GOOD STEWARDSHIP TOWARD THE STATE S AQUATIC RESOURCES, INCLUDING MULTIPLE HANDS ON FISHING SKILLS DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES. WHILE MOST OF PARTICIPATING FAMILIES WILL BE HISPANIC, THE PROGRAMS WILL BE OPEN TO FAMILIES OF ALL RACES ETHNICITIES.SFRA PROVIDES AQUATIC EDUCATION TO THE PUBLIC TO INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING OF WATER RESOURCES AND ASSOCIATED AQUATIC LIFE. THE GEORGE H.W. BUSH VARNES A PESCAR EDUCATION FUND WEBSITE STATES, ??OUT OF 46 MILLION TOTAL ANGLERS, ONLY 3.3 MILLION ARE HISPANIC. ENGAGING THIS AUDIENCE WILL BE CRITICAL TO THE FUTURE OF FISHING AND BOATING.  (HTTPS   WWW.TAKEMEFISHING.ORG EDUCATIONFUND )
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE RECREATIONAL SPORT FISH POPULATIONS AND PROVIDE INCREASED RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF NEBRASKA.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT NEW JERSEY FISH AND WILDLIFE S, BUREAU OF FRESHWATER FISHERIES EFFORTS TO MEET NEW JERSEY S FRESHWATER FISH MANAGEMENT GOALS AND ASSURE THE LONG TERM PROTECTION OF THE STATE S AQUATIC RESOURCES. ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED UNDER THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE FISHERY SURVEYS ON THE STATE S FRESHWATER LAKES AND STREAMS, MANAGING AND RESTORING IMPORTANT SPORT FISH SPECIES, CONDUCTING FORUMS TO INFORM THE PUBLIC OF IMPORTANT FRESHWATER FISH RESEARCH ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY THIS GRANT, AND PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON A MULTITUDE OF LAND USE, WATERSHED, AND HABITAT BASED ISSUES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE SUSTAINABLE FISHERIES AND MAXIMIZATION OF FRESH WATER ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE ANGLERS FISHING IN NEW JERSEY. THERE ARE NO SUB RECIPIENT ACTVITIES.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT STUDIES ON AGE AND GROWTH, REPRODUCTION, HABITAT USE AND MOVEMENT OF AT LEAST THREE FLORIDA COASTAL SPORT FISH SPECIES. PROJECT STAFF WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH SCIENTISTS IN STOCK ASSESSMENT AND ECOSYSTEM MODELING, AT BOTH THE FEDERAL AND STATE LEVEL, TO ADDRESS GAPS IN KNOWLEDGE, PARTICULARLY FOR PARAMETERS THAT ARE FOUND TO BE SENSITIVE IN STATISTICAL MODELING EFFORTS. AS SUCH, THE SPECIES STUDIED DURING THE REPORTING PERIOD WILL BE DRIVEN BY STATE AND FEDERAL SCHEDULES OF DATA INVENTORIES, STOCK ASSESSMENTS, AND HABITAT PROTECTION EFFORTS.

FRESHWATER FISHING IS AN IMPORTANT RECREATIONAL ACTIVITY IN NEW JERSEY. DURING ITS LATEST LICENSE CERTIFICATION PERIOD, NEW JERSEY FISH AND WILDLIFE ISSUED 255,152 FRESHWATER FISHING LICENSES. THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO SATISFY THE PUBLIC S INTEREST IN FRESHWATER ANGLING, BY OPERATING AND MAINTAINING TWO FISH CULTURE FACILITIES FOR THE PRODUCTION AND STOCKING OF FISH INTO NEW JERSEY S 400 PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE LAKES, PONDS AND RESERVOIRS AND 18,000 MILES OF PUBLIC STREAMS AND RIVERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE PRODUCTION AND STOCKING OF HYBRID STRIPED BASS, CHANNEL CATFISH, MUSKELLUNGE, NORTHERN PIKE, ATLANTIC SALMON, WALLEYE, AND RAINBOW TROUT, INTO PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE WATER BODIES, AND OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF TWO FISH HATCHERIES. EXCEPTED OUTCOMES ARE TO HELP MEET CURRENT AND FUTURE DEMANDS OF FRESHWATER ANGLERS AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF FRESHWATER ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES IN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE PEOPLE FISHING IN THE FRESHWATERS OF NEW JERSEY. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

TO FUND STATEWIDE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE AND FUTURE DEVELOPMENT OF FISHING ACCESS AREAS OWNED OR OPERATED BY SOUTH DAKOTA GAME, FISH AND PARKS WHICH WILL PROVIDE NEW SERVICES, IMPROVE USABILITY, AND ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THOSE FISHING ACCESS SITES. THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO FACILITATE THE MANAGEMENT, ENHANCEMENT, AND PROTECTION OF VIRGINIA S FRESHWATER SPORT FISH RESOURCES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE  THE MAINTENANCE OF FISHING ACCESS FACILITIES THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH  THE MAINTENANCE OF VDWR S 39 DAMS AND THE RESERVOIRS THEY PROVIDE  THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF VDWR S FOUR WARM WATER HATCHERIES  THE STOCKING OF MORE THAN 3.6M SPORT FISH (14 DIFFERENT SPECIES) INTO VIRGINIA S LAKES AND RIVERS EACH YEAR  MANAGING LAKE AND RIVER HABITATS TO IMPROVE CONDITIONS FOR SPORTFISH POPULATIONS  AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO A DIVERSITY OF PARTNERS INTERESTED IN PROVIDING ANGLER ACCESS AND IMPROVING AQUATIC HABITATS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE HEALTHY AND ROBUST POPULATIONS OF SPORT FISH THAT CAN MEET THE NEEDS AND EXPECTATIONS OF VIRGINIA S ANGLERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE VIRGINIA S ANGLERS AND OTHERS THAT APPRECIATE THESE RESOURCES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.
