TO PROVIDE STATEWIDE INSPECTIONS, TRAINING, AND ROUTINE MAINTENANCE ON 76 DAMS OWNED AND OR MANAGED BY THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF GAME, FISH AND PARKS DURING THE TIME FRAME OF 4 1 2023 TO 3 31 2024.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE ACCESS OPPORTUNITIES FOR SPORT FISHING AND RECREATIONAL BOATING INNEBRASKA.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO USE PASSIVE ACOUSTIC TELEMETRY TO CONTINUE MONITORING SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL MOVEMENT PATTERNS AND HABITAT USE OF SOUTHERN FLOUNDER WITHIN THE BILOXI BAY ESTUARY. DETECTION DATA WILL BE ANALYZED TO DETERMINE THE TIMING OF SEASONAL SPAWNING EMIGRATION AND IMMIGRATION PATTERNS. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED INFORMATION ON LIFE HISTORY ASPECTS OF ADULT SOUTHERN FLOUNDER IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS, INCLUDING TEMPORAL AND SPATIAL MOVEMENT AND HABITAT USE. MOREOVER, TRACKING THE POTENTIAL SPAWNING MIGRATION OF SOUTHERN FLOUNDER WILL PROVIDE INSIGHT ABOUT THE TIMING OF EMIGRATION TO OFFSHORE SPAWNING GROUNDS AND THE SUBSEQUENT IMMIGRATION BACK TO THE ESTUARY. THE FULFILLMENT OF THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS STUDY WILL ALLOW FOR MORE EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF THE SOUTHERN FLOUNDER POPULATION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COORDINATE, PLAN, AND ADMINISTER ALL ASPECTS OF FEDERAL ASSISTANCE FROM BEGINNING TO END OF A PROJECT. COORDINATION OF FEDERAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WILL ENSURE THAT FEDERAL FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL AND STATE LAWS, REGULATIONS AND POLICIES TO ACCOMPLISH AGENCY GOALS FOR THE CONSERVATION, RESTORATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THE STATE S MARINE FISHERIES. COORDINATION OF FEDERAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO ENSURE THAT STATE REGULATIONS OR STATUTES ARE NOT ENACTED THAT WOULD CAUSE NORTH CAROLINA TO BE INELIGIBLE FOR THE BENEFITS OF SPORT FISH RESTORATION (SFR) GRANT PROGRAMS AND THAT LICENSE REVENUES PAID BY ANGLERS OR PROPERTY ACQUIRED WITH THIS REVENUE ARE NOT DIVERTED.

THE PRIMARY GOAL FOR THIS GRANT IS TO CONSTRUCT AND ENHANCE ARTIFICIAL REEF (AR) HABITAT. FOR ALL REEF ENHANCEMENT PROJECTS, AR PROGRAM STAFF WILL (1) EVALUATE THE SELECTED MATERIALS AND OR VESSEL, (2) ENSURE SUITABILITY FOR REEF PLACEMENT, (3) AID IN DEVELOPING ENHANCEMENT PLANS AND SCHEMATICS FOR DEPLOYMENT OR SINKING WITHIN THE REEF BOUNDARIES, (4) ENSURE ENHANCEMENT OPERATIONS AND SINK PLANS ARE APPROPRIATELY PERMITTED AND COMPLIANT WITH STATE AND FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AND (5) OBSERVE THE DEPLOYMENTS AND VESSEL SINKINGS TO ENSURE CONFORMITY TO PROJECT PLANS AND COMPLIANCE WITH PERMITS. RESULTS EXPECTED ARE TO BUILD STRUCTURES ON THE SEAFLOOR THAT WILL BECOME COLONIZED BY MARINE ORGANISMS AND PLANTS THAT ATTRACT SMALL BAIT FISHES THAT PROVIDE FOOD AND REFUGE FOR LARGER PREDATORY FISH. THESE REEFS ARE CONSIDERED CRUCIAL SPAWNING AND FORAGING HABITAT FOR MANY IMPORTANT FISH SPECIES.

SINCE 1989, THE PENNSYLVANIA FISH AND BOAT COMMISSION (PFBC) HAS UTILIZED THE F 69 E GRANT TO SUPPORT EFFORTS TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF PENNSYLVANIA S AQUATIC RESOURCES AND THE SPORTFISHING OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED. FOR MORE THAN THREE DECADES, THIS PROJECT HAS PROVIDED TRAINING TO HUNDREDS OF EDUCATORS AND VOLUNTEERS, WHO IN TURN HAVE REACHED THOUSANDS OF STUDENTS.CURRICULUM AND OTHER RESOURCES DEVELOPED THROUGH THE PROJECT HAVE HELPED CLASSROOM EDUCATORS MEET CERTAIN ACADEMIC STANDARDS SET BY THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. HUNDREDS OF STAFF FROM STATE, COUNTY, AND LOCAL PARKS HAVE USED PFBC TRAINING AND CURRICULUM TO PROVIDE HANDS ON TRAINING IN BASIC FISHING SKILLS TO THOUSANDS, SOME OF WHICH MAY HAVE NEVER FISHED BEFORE. MORE RECENTLY, THE PFBC AND ITS PARTNERS HAVE BEEN PROVIDING TRAINING IN MORE SPECIALIZED SKILLS, SUCH AS FLY FISHING.EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ACTIONS HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN THE LAST FOUR AGENCY STRATEGIC PLANS, AS A TOOL TO REACH AGENCY STRATEGIC GOALS TO IDENTIFY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TACTICS AS MEANS TO TEACH AQUATIC RESOURCE CONSERVATION, SAFE AND ETHICAL BEHAVIOR, AND FISHING SKILLS. WHILE THE PFBC S USE OF PUBLIC EDUCATION AS A MANAGEMENT TOOL PRE DATES PROJECT F 69 E, WILDLIFE SPORT FISHING RESTORATION (WSFR) FUNDS HAVE PROVIDED THE CONSISTENT AND SUSTAINED FUNDING NEEDED TO IMPLEMENT EFFECTIVE LONG TERM EDUCATION. CONTINUED GRANT FUNDING IS CRITICAL TO CONTINUING EFFORTS TO TEACH, PROMOTE, AND INCREASE AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF AQUATIC RESOURCE CONSERVATION, SAFE AND ETHICAL BEHAVIOR, AND FISHING SKILLS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT PROJECT IS TO TURN THE MUNICIPAL POND AT THE BENNETT REGIONAL PARK AND OPEN SPACE (BRPOS) INTO A RECREATIONAL FISHING POND THAT WOULD BE OPEN AND FREE TO THE PUBLIC. ONCE COMPLETED, THE 193 ACRE PARK WILL INCLUDE ADA COMPLIANT PARKING AREA, ACCESS RAMP, SHADED PICNIC AREA, CORNER DOCK, TRAIL CONNECTION, NATURAL HABITATS AND OPEN SPACE.

PARTNER WITH CITIES, COUNTIES, AND PUBLIC ENTITIES TO ENHANCE RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES AND AQUATIC RESOURCES BY LEASING THE ANGLING RIGHTS, REMOVING ADDITIONAL FEES TO FISH, AND ENTERING INTO OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE AGREEMENTS WITH OVER 125 COMMUNITIES AND 15,600 ACRES OF SMALL IMPOUNDMENTS.

DEVELOP, MAINTAIN AND OR IMPROVE SPORT FISHING IN THE PUBLIC WATERS OF NORTH DAKOTA BY ESTABLISHING NATURALLY REPRODUCING FISHERIES THROUGH STOCKING AND OR USE OF A PUT   GROW   TAKE FISH STOCKING PROGRAMS.

THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE SOUTH DAKOTA WITH EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT METHODS FOR MANAGINGIT S FISHERIES AND RELATED AQUATIC RESOURCES FOR THE PERIOD JANUARY 1, 2023 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2023. THISPROJECT PROVIDES FOR THE COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND INTERPRETATION OF FISHERIES SURVEY DATA, ALLOWING THEDEVELOPMENT, EVALUATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES TO MEET THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVESLISTED IN SOUTH DAKOTA FISHERIES PLANS.

THIS GRANT WILL BE SUB AWARDED TO THE CITY OF STROUD. THE INTENT OF THIS SUB AWARD IS TO ADDRESS THE CURRENT BOATING ACCESS FACILITIES AT SOUTHERNMOST BOAT RAMP OF STROUD LAKE. THE BOAT RAMP IS IN SOUND CONDITION AND WILL NOT REQUIRE RENOVATION OR REPLACEMENT. BOATING ACCESS OPPORTUNITIES ARE CURRENTLY LIMITED BY THE ABSENCE OF A COURTESY DOCK AND NO ADA COMPLIANT PARKING OR PATHWAY. THE ENTRYWAY AND PARKING LOT ARE CURRENTLY GRAVELED. BOATING ACCESS OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE ENHANCED BY THE ADDITION OF A NEW 8 FT X 26 FT  T  DOCK WITH A 40  GANGWAY. FURTHERMORE, THIS INCLUDES THE ADDITION OF A NEW DOCK ABUTMENT, A NEW CONCRETE ADA COMPLIANT PARKING SPACE (45  X 16 ) AND PATHWAY (36  W), AN IMPROVED ASPHALT PARKING LOT (90  X 90  X 4 ) AND GRAVEL ENTRY ROADS (240  X 20  X 8 ) TO THE BOATING ACCESS AREA. THE BOATING ACCESS AREA WILL HAVE 6 LIGHTS INSTALLED ON ELECTRIC POLES TO AID IN BOATING ACTIVITIES WHETHER FISH OR RECREATIONAL BOATING. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP TO SATISFY THE CURRENT AND ANTICIPATED FUTURE DEMAND FOR BOATING ACCESS AND RECREATIONAL FISHING AT STROUD LAKE, IN THE SOUTHERNMOST BOAT RAMP AREA FOR THE EXPECTED USEFUL LIFE OF 20 YEARS. THIS GRANT WILL ALSO BENEFIT NEARBY, LOCAL ECONOMIES AS BOATERS AND ANGLERS ARE WILLING TO TRAVEL CONSIDERABLE DISTANCES TO ENJOY THESE ACTIVITIES. LOCAL ECONOMIES WILL DERIVE BENEFITS FROM INCREASED SALES OF GASOLINE, FOOD, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, AND LODGING.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO ENHANCE THE PUBLIC S UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR AQUATIC RESOURCES AS A MEANS OF CONSERVING AND SUSTAINING THE STATE S SPORT FISH HABITAT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE TEACHER AND MENTOR TRAINING AND A VARIETY OF AQUATIC RESOURCE EDUCATION AND ANGLER TRAINING FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN RHODE ISLAND. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A PUBLIC THAT HAS AN ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING OF RHODE ISLAND S AQUATIC RESOURCES AND AN THE ABILITY TO TAKE FULL ADVANTAGE OF THE STATE S FISHING OPPORTUNITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RHODE ISLAND PUBLIC OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT.

THE PENNSYLVANIA FISH AND BOAT COMMISSION (PFBC) PROVIDES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT, ACQUISITION, MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF PROPERTIES TO ENSURE ACCESS TO FISHING AND BOATING OPPORTUNITIES IN PENNSYLVANIA. THESE FACILITIES AND PROPERTIES, LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH, PROVIDE RESIDENTS AND NON RESIDENT VISITORS WITH A DIVERSITY OF RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES. SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT FUNDS HELP THE PFBC PROMOTE AND PROVIDE FOR SAFE USE OF RECREATIONAL WATERS.MANAGEMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF THESE PROPERTIES IS PROVIDED BY THE PFBC S BUREAU OF ENGINEERING. STAFF CONDUCT ROUTINE MAINTENANCE AND PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT FOR THE OPERATION OF ALL ACCESS AREAS, DAMS, PARKING LOTS, ACCESS ROADS, WASTE PUMP OUT STATIONS, BRIDGES, LAKES, STREAMS, FISHWAYS, SCREENS, CANALS AND CHANNELS. EXAMPLES OF WORK INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO LITTER PICKUP, MOWING GRASS, REGRADING AND RESURFACING PARKING LOTS AND ROADS, PAVEMENT REPAIRS, INSTALLATION OF CULVERT PIPE, CLEANING DRAINAGE DITCHES, REPAIRING LAUNCH RAMPS, THE CONSTRUCTION, INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL OF DOCKS, AND DREDGING AND INSTALLATION OF WATERWAY MARKERS. IN ADDITION, ROUTINE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE INCLUDES OPERATIONAL EXPENSES SUCH AS WATER AND SEWERAGE, UTILITIES, ETC. SOME MAINTENANCE SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES ARE PERFORMED BY CONTRACT WITH PRIVATE VENDORS SELECTED THROUGH THE COMMONWEALTH S PROCUREMENT PROCESS.SINCE 1965, THE PFBC S MAINTENANCE PROJECT (F 30 D) HAS PROVEN TO BE A VALUABLE ASSET TO THE AGENCY S CONTINUING EFFORTS TO PROVIDE SAFE AND ENJOYABLE FISHING AND BOATING OPPORTUNITIES IN PENNSYLVANIA. THE PFBC CONTINUES TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE A STATEWIDE SYSTEM OF PUBLIC BOATING AND FISHING ACCESS AREAS AND POINTS TO LAKES AND WATERWAYS THAT ARE PHYSICALLY AND BIOLOGICALLY SUITABLE FOR RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES. THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH, THE PFBC HAS A NEED TO FUND THE MAINTENANCE OF 251 PROPERTIES.

THIS GRANT WILL BE AWARDED TO ODWC. THE INTENT OF THE AWARD IS TO IMPROVE THE CURRENT BOATING ACCESS FACILITIES AT THE FLY INN 2 BOAT RAMP AT FORT COBB LAKE. THIS WILL BE A SIMPLE DOCK REPLACEMENT PROJECT. A NEW 8 FT X 26 FT DOCK WITH A 64 FOOT GANGWAY WILL BE INSTALLED TO REPLACE AN EXISTING DOCK, WHICH HAS EXHAUSTED ITS USEFUL LIFE. ALL NECESSARY ADA COMPLIANCE FOR PARKING, SIDEWALKS, AND DOCK ABUTMENTS WAS COMPLETED IN 2016. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP SATISFY THE CURRENT AND ANTICIPATED FUTURE DEMAND FOR BOATING ACCESS AND RECREATIONAL FISHING AT FT COBB LAKE FOR THE EXPECTED USEFUL LIFE OF 20 YEARS. THIS GRANT WILL ALSO BENEFIT NEARBY, LOCAL ECONOMIES AS BOATERS AND ANGLERS ARE WILLING TO TRAVEL CONSIDERABLE DISTANCES TO ENJOY THESE ACTIVITIES. LOCAL ECONOMIES WILL DERIVE BENEFITS FROM INCREASED SALES OF GASOLINE, GOOD, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, AND LODGING.

MOAB, UTAH NEEDS TO ENSURE BOATER SATISFACTION BY PROVIDING IMPROVED BOATER ACCESS AT AN EXISTING BOATER ACCESS LOCATION ALONG THE COLORADO RIVER. THE RAMP AT THIS LOCATION WAS ORIGINALLY CONSTRUCTED IN THE 1950S AND HAS FALLEN INTO DISREPAIR. RECONSTRUCTION OF THIS RAMP IS CRITICAL TO THE RESTORATION OF SITE FUNCTIONALITY AND MOAB S ABILITY TO PROVIDE SAFE LAUNCHING AND RETRIEVAL OPTIONS ALONG THE COLORADO RIVER. HOWEVER, PRIOR TO RECONSTRUCTION EFFORTS, MOAB MUST FIRST FINALIZE DESIGN AND ENGINEERING EFFORTS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A SET OF DESIGN AND ENGINEERING PLANS FOR RECONSTRUCTION OF AN EXISTING BOATER ACCESS FACILITY IN MOAB ALONG THE COLORADO RIVER. PROPER DESIGN WILL ENSURE THAT THE RECONSTRUCTED BOATER ACCESS FACILITY WILL PROVIDE SATISFYING AND SAFE ACCESS TO THE RIVER FOR USERS OF MOTORIZED WATERCRAFT AND PADDLECRAFT.

THE MISSION OF THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES (DNER) ENCOMPASSES THE PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION OF MARINE RESOURCES, BEING OUR MAIN GOAL TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO PROTECT AND MANAGE THE FISHERIES RESOURCES.FUNDS UNDER THIS AWARD WILL BE USED TO STUDY THE MATURATION AND REPRODUCTIVE SEASONALITY OF RECREATIONALLY IMPORTANT FISH SPECIES, INCLUDING GRAYSBY, BLACKFIN SNAPPER, SAND TILEFISH, DOG SNAPPER, SCHOOLMASTER, DOLPHINFISH, WAHOO AND LANE SNAPPER IN PUERTO RICO.

BEAR CANYON DAM IS CURRENTLY LISTED AS A HIGH HAZARD CLASSIFICATION AND AS BEING IN POOR CONDITION. MAJOR MAINTENANCE MUST BE PERFORMED ON THIS DAM TO PREVENT POSSIBLE LOSSES OF VARIOUS NATURES IN THE EVENT OF A PROBABLY MAXIMUM PRECIPITATION STORM EVENT. ENGINEERING PLANS WILL BE FINALIZED AND APPROVED. CONSTRUCTION WILL THEN PROCEED ON THE DAM TO REHABILITATE THE STRUCTURE.
THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO MANAGE RECREATIONAL FISH POPULATIONS AND RECREATIONAL FISHING ACTIVITIES AT THE GUAJATACA RESERVOIR AND CANO TIBURONES RESERVE.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN EXISTING FACILITIES AND INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SPORT FISHING AND RECREATIONAL BOATING IN NORTH DAKOTA.

IN 2020 KYGER OPEN SPACE OPENED FOR PUBLIC USE WITH A ONE MILE LOOP OF PAVED AND SOFT TRAIL AROUND THE RESERVOIR, PARKING LOT AND RESTROOM ENCLOSURE. FISHING IS CURRENTLY PROHIBITED BECAUSE OF THE STEEP SLIPPERY SHORELINE. IN JUNE OF 2020, THE TOWN SOLICITED PUBLIC FEEDBACK THROUGH AN ON LINE SURVEY ASKING WINDSOR RESIDENTS WHAT THEIR VISION OF KYGER OPEN SPACE WAS. NON MOTORIZED BOAT ACCESS AND FISHING WERE THE TWO HIGHEST PRIORITIES. CURRENTLY, THE ONLY ACCESSIBLE FISHING PROVIDED BY THE TOWN OF WINDSOR IS AT WINDSOR LAKE. AMENITIES THAT WILL BE ADDED INCLUDE AN ADA FISHING PIER, SHORELINE FISHING ACCESS, NON MOTORIZED PEDESTRIAN BOAT RAMP, TRAILS FOR ANGLERS AND BOATERS, AND FISH HABITAT. THE ADDED IMPROVEMENTS TO KYGER RESERVOIR WOULD ALLOW MORE PEOPLE TO ENJOY THE WATER, FISHING, AND WILDLIFE THAT THE AREA OFFERS.

PROFOUND KNOWLEDGE OF THE AQUATIC RESOURCES, ANGLER DEMAND, AND CONTRIBUTIONS TO FISHERIES FROM HATCHERY REARED FISH IS NEEDED TO EXECUTE COMPREHENSIVE STATEWIDE STRATEGIC AND OPERATIONAL FISHERIES MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES AND ASSOCIATED PLANS. THIS INFORMATION IS VITAL FOR THE PENNSYLVANIA FISH AND BOAT COMMISSION TO EFFICIENTLY PROVIDE CONTINUED AND DIVERSE ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES TO AN EQUALLY DIVERSE ANGLING PUBLIC AND TO CARRY OUT ITS RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP MISSION.THE FOUNDATION FOR MANAGEMENT OF PENNSYLVANIA S AQUATIC RESOURCES LIES IN DEVELOPMENT OF FISHERIES MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES WITH OBJECTIVES BASED ON THE CHARACTER OF INDIVIDUAL WATERS, GROUPS OF WATERS WITH LIKE ATTRIBUTES, OR INDIVIDUAL SPECIES OR GROUPS OF SPECIES AS NEED REQUIRES OR AS IS APPROPRIATE. THE BUREAUS OF FISHERIES AND HATCHERIES PLAY KEY ROLES IN THE MANAGEMENT OF AQUATIC RESOURCES THROUGH EXECUTION OF OPERATIONAL PLANS GUIDED BY FISHERIES MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES FOR PROPAGATION AND PROCUREMENT OF THOSE FISH SPECIES NECESSARY TO MEET MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES. UTILIZING FISH POPULATION ASSESSMENT RESULTS AND ANGLER SURVEY RESULTS, FISHERIES MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES DEVELOPED BY THE DIVISION OF FISHERIES MANAGEMENT (DFM) GUIDE BUREAU OF FISHERIES (FISHERIES MANAGEMENT, HABITAT MANAGEMENT, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES DIVISIONS) OPERATIONS AND THE BUREAU OF HATCHERIES IN A COORDINATED EFFORT TO DELIVER OPPORTUNITIES WHICH PROVIDE EXPECTED RECREATIONAL ANGLING EXPERIENCES IN ADDITION TO FULFILLMENT OF THE STEWARDSHIP MISSION OF THE AGENCY.THE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PROJECT (F 57 R) IS DESIGNED TO DEFINE NEEDS AND IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES TO DELIVER ANGLING EXPERIENCES BASED ON CONCISE KNOWLEDGE AND LIMITS OF EXPLOITED FISHERIES. MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES AND ASSOCIATED PLANS ARE DYNAMIC TO REFLECT CHANGES IN RESOURCE CHARACTER AND CHANGES IN THE DESIRES OF USERS. AS SUCH, MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES ARE BASED ON ASSESSMENT OF ATTRIBUTES OF AQUATIC RESOURCES AND FISHERIES AND PERIODIC SURVEY OF SELECT ATTRIBUTES DEPENDING ON THE TYPE OF FISH POPULATION, LEVEL OF ANGLER USE DIRECTED TO THOSE RESOURCES, AND CHANGES IN EXTENT OF HUMAN INFLUENCE WITHIN THE WATERSHED AND THE PROPENSITY OF THOSE INFLUENCES TO AFFECT AQUATIC RESOURCE ATTRIBUTES. PROJECT STUDIES ALSO ASSESS THE IMPACT THAT VARIOUS MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES SUCH AS STOCKING, HABITAT MODIFICATION, ANGLING REGULATIONS, AMONG OTHERS, MAY HAVE ON TARGETED FISH POPULATIONS AND FISHERIES, AS WELL AS THE NEED AND EFFECTIVENESS OF ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT TO ACCOMPLISH INDIVIDUAL PLANS OR PROGRAM OBJECTIVES.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT ECOLOGICALLY SOUND, SCIENCE BASED FISHERIES CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE  RESTORE AND ENHANCE RUNS OF DIADROMOUS FISH IN CT BY PROVIDING EFFECTIVE FISH PASSAGE AT FISH PASSAGE FACILITIES AND AT EXISTING BARRIERS TO FISH MIGRATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE MAINTAINING HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE POPULATIONS OF DIADROMOUS FISHERIES RESOURCES WITHIN BIOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL LIMITS, WHICH SUPPORTS THE BUREAU OF NATURAL RESOURCES  MISSION OF CONSERVATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE NATURAL RESOURCES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.
F-95-P-82 SFR-BA 2022 UPPER POST LAKE LANDING IMPROVEMENTS-TOWN OF ELCHO

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES IN LOVELAND BY PROVIDING ADDITIONAL PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE PONDS AT RIVERS EDGE NATURAL AREA. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED WITH THE ADDITION OF A PAVED TRAIL AND FISHING DOCK, AS WELL AS FIVE NEW FISHING ACCESS POINTS. INCREASING SHORE ACCESS POINTS FOR FISHING ALSO OFFERS OPPORTUNITIES TO PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, OUTDOOR RECREATION, FAMILY FISHING AND SPECIAL FISHING EVENTS LIKE THE LOVELAND FISHING DERBY, SENIOR FISHING DAY, AND SCOUTS LEARNING ADVENTURES.

CURRENTLY THE LOCATION OF AND EXISTING DOUBLE VAULT RESTROOM AT BIG SANDWASH RESERVOIR DOES NOT SUPPORT BOATER USE DUE TO ITS LOCATION. THE EXISTING RESTROOM IS APPROXIMATELY 1,000 LINEAR FEET AWAY FROM THE BIG SANDWASH BOAT RAMP ALONG THE ACCESS ROAD AT THE BASE OF THE DAM. IN ORDER TO ADDRESS A GROWING ISSUE WITH HUMAN WASTE NEAR THE RAMP AND SHORELINE AREAS, THE UTAH DIVISION OF WILDLIFE RESOURCES (UDWR) PROPOSES THAT THE EXISTING VAULT TOILET BE MOVED TO A LOCATION ADJACENT TO THE BOAT RAMP. RELOCATING THE EXISTING VAULT RESTROOM TO A MORE ACCESSIBLE LOCATION WILL ENHANCE BOATER ACCESS AND SATISFACTION BY PROVIDING CONVENIENT SANITARY CONDITIONS FOR BOATERS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPLEMENT THE MARINE RECREATIONAL INFORMATION PROGRAM (MRIP) ACCESS POINT ANGLER INTERCEPT SURVEYS (APAIS). MRIP ESTIMATES MARINE RECREATIONAL CATCH AND EFFORT. SUPPLEMENTING THE SAMPLING EFFORT INCREASES PRECISION OF THE SURVEY AND MORE ACCURATELY DEPICTS DELAWARE S RECREATIONAL MARINE LANDINGS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE MAIL SURVEYS TO FOR HIRE VESSELS, ANGLER INTERVIEWS AND CATCH SAMPLING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVEMENT OF THE PRECISION OF THE STATE AND COAST WIDE MARINE RECREATIONAL CATCH ESTIMATES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE FISHERY RESOURCE MANAGERS, FISHERY MANAGEMENT ASSOCIATIONS AND RECREATIONAL ANGLERS. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INVOLVED WITH THIS PROJECT.

THE MISSION OF THE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DIVISION IS TO  PROVIDE FOR A BALANCED SUPPLY AND DEMAND AMONG PRESENT AND FUTURE RESOURCES, AND PRESENT AND FUTURE ANGLERS TO THE EXTENT THAT IT MAXIMALLY BENEFITS THE CITIZENS OF NEW MEXICO.  TO MEET THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS MISSION, OUR DEPARTMENT MUST PROVIDE ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES FOR APPROXIMATELY 180,000 LICENSED ANGLERS. A MAJOR FOCUS OF OUR FISH HATCHERY SYSTEM IS TO OPTIMIZE HATCHERY PRODUCTION IN ORDER TO MEET OR EXCEED THE LEGISLATIVE MANDATE TO PRODUCE 640,000 POUNDS OF FISH ANNUALLY, MINIMIZE DISEASE THREATS TO IMPORTANT HATCHERY STOCKS AND TO MAINTAIN DATABASES AS A MEANS OF ANALYZING HATCHERY PRODUCTION AND EFFICIENCY. THIS WILL GIVE US THE OPPORTUNITY TO MANAGE HATCHERY RESOURCES EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY TO PROVIDE ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES AT A HIGH LEVEL OF SATISFACTION FOR ANGLERS WITHIN OUR STATE.
TO IMPROVE BOATER ACCESS DURING LOW WATER CONDITIONS, A LARGER BOAT DOCK WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AT BLUEWATER LAKE. THIS WILL BE INSTALLED AT THE LOW WATER BOAT RAMP.

THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO IS THE FIFTH LARGEST STATE, CONTAINS SIX OF THE SEVEN LIFE ZONES, AND IS ONE OF THE MOSTARID STATES. THE SIZE, VARIETY, AND ARIDITY OF NEW MEXICO S ENVIRONMENT CREATE A WIDE ARRAY OF FISHERIES ANDFISHING OPPORTUNITIES. SUCH VARIETY OF FISHERIES REQUIRES ACTIVE MANAGEMENT VIA A BROAD SPECTRUM OF MANAGEMENTTECHNIQUES. THE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DIVISION OF THE NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF GAME AND FISH ACTIVELY MANAGESTHESE FISHERIES TO PROVIDE RECREATIONAL ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES, CONSERVE NATIVE TROUT SPECIES, PROTECT AGAINST THEINTRODUCTION OF AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES, AND OPERATE SIX STATE FISH HATCHERIES. ALL OF THESE ACTIVITIES REQUIREPLANNING, BUDGETING, AND SUPERVISION TO ENSURE THAT THE DIVISION AND THE DEPARTMENT ARE ABLE TO MAINTAIN A HIGHLEVEL OF ANGLER SATISFACTION WITHIN THE STATE AND MEET OTHER LEGISLATIVE MANDATES.

SPORT FISHERIES ARE IMPORTANT RESOURCES THAT PROVIDE ANGLING OPPORTUNITY TO THE PUBLIC. IN ORDER TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE OUR SPORTFISH POPULATIONS, WE NEED THE ABILITY TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES SUCH AS MONITORING FISH POPULATIONS AND THEIR HABITATS, RESPONDING TO ANGLER QUESTIONS AND CONCERNS, INVESTIGATING FISH KILLS, EVALUATING FISH MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES, DEVELOPING AND EVALUATING STOCKING STRATEGIES, DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING ANGLER ACCESS, IDENTIFYING HABITAT IMPROVEMENT OPPORTUNITIES, ETC. THESE ACTIVITIES ENSURE THAT PARAMETERS IDENTIFIED IN THE 2022 STATEWIDE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PLAN ARE MET. THERE IS ALSO A NEED TO MONITOR FISH COMMUNITIES STATEWIDE TO IDENTIFY NEW SPORT FISHING OPPORTUNITIES AND THE EFFECTS OF SPORT FISH MANAGEMENT ON ALL FISH SPECIES. MONITORING FISH COMMUNITIES WILL ALLOW BIOLOGISTS TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL ISSUES, MITIGATE CONFLICTS, AND RESPOND TO THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND DROUGHT THAT MAY LIMIT OUR ABILITY TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE ANGLING OPPORTUNITY STATEWIDE.

THIS GRANT IS CRUCIAL TO THE NEW MEXICO GAME AND FISH DEPARTMENT TO PREVENT DECLINES OF, EXPAND THE DISTRIBUTION OF, AND INCREASE ANGLER OPPORTUNITIES FOR RIO GRANDE CUTTHROAT TROUT. THIS GRANT IS NEEDED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES TO RESTORE AND MANAGE RIO GRANDE CUTTHROAT TROUT POPULATIONS THROUGHOUT THEIR NATIVE DISTRIBUTION.
MN-STATEWIDE PUBLIC WATER ACCESS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE  FW-3-B-5

SPORT AND RECREATIONAL FISHING ARE A VERY IMPORTANT COMPONENT OF PUERTO RICO S OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT BETWEEN FRESHWATER AND SALTWATER, THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 200,000 RECREATIONAL FISHERS IN PUERTO RICO, THAT CONTRIBUTE WELL OVER  80,000,000 ANNUALLY TO THE LOCAL ECONOMY. THE MOST PRICED AND SOUGHT SPECIES INCLUDE, NATIVE (MAINLY IN SALT WATER AND ESTUARIES) AND EXOTIC (FRESHWATER). NOT MUCH MANAGEMENT IS CONDUCTED TO SUSTAIN NATIVE FISH SPECIES POPULATIONS BESIDES HABITAT PROTECTION AND MAINTAINING ADEQUATE WATER QUALITY. CONVERSELY, LONG LASTING AND CONSISTENT ACTIONS HAVE BEEN IN PLACE FOR ALMOST A CENTURY TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE THE POPULATION OF INTRODUCED, RECREATIONALLY IMPORTANT FRESHWATER FISHES. AND THESE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES ENCOMPASS BOTH, (1) FISH PRODUCTION AND STOCKING AND (2) MONITORING (ELECTROFISHING) COMPONENTS.

NEW MEXICO IS ONE OF SIX STATES IN THE WEST THAT DOES NOT HAVE AN ESTABLISHED ZEBRA OR QUAGGA MUSSEL POPULATION. SINCE 2013, NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF GAME AND  FISH (NMDGF) HAS STATIONED PERSONNEL AT VARIOUS NEW MEXICO WATERBODIES IN ORDER TO CONDUCT OUTREACH TO THE BOATING PUBLIC AND WATERCRAFT INSPECTIONS DECONTAMINATIONS ON HIGH RISK WATERCRAFT, CONDUCTED EARLY DETECTION MONITORING, TRAINED STAFF TO CONDUCT WATERCRAFT INSPECTIONS AND PROVIDE EDUCATION OUTREACH. AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) INTRODUCTION CONTINUES TO BE A CONCERN IN NEW MEXICO. CONTINUED PARTICIPATION IN OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, REGIONAL COMMITTEES AND PERSONNEL TRAINING FOR PREVENTION ACTIVITIES IS NEEDED IF NEW MEXICO RECREATIONAL WATERS ARE TO REMAIN FREE OF AIS.

SINCE 1989, THE NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF GAME AND FISH HAS OFFERED AN AQUATIC RESOURCES EDUCATION (ARE) PROGRAM TO ENHANCE THE PUBLIC S UNDERSTANDING OF OUR SCARCE WATER RESOURCES, OUR HEALTHY SPORT FISHERIES, AND THE AQUATIC LIFE THAT DEPENDS ON THESE RESOURCES. THE ARE PROGRAM PROVIDES PROJECTS THAT EMPHASIZE SPORT FISHING SKILLS TRAINING, UNDERSTANDING AQUATIC HABITATS, AND PROMOTING RESPONSIBLE ATTITUDES AND ETHICS TOWARD ANGLING AND THE AQUATIC ENVIRONMENT.

THE STATE OF KANSAS HAS A VERY LIMITED NUMBER OF ACRES OPEN TO PUBLIC FISHING. THIS GRANT ALLOWS AN INCREASE IN ACCESS TO PRIVATE WATERS BY LEASING 1,300 ACRES OF IMPOUNDED WATERS, 50 MILES OF STREAM AND 8 STREAM ACCESS SITES EACH YEAR OF THE AWARD.

THE TWOFOLD PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO 1) MONITOR THE ABUNDANCE, SIZE, AND SEX OF STRIPED BASS ON THE VIRGINIA SPAWNING GROUNDS DURING THE SPRING SPAWNING SEASON AND 2) TAG APPROXIMATELY 1,000 LEGAL SIZED (457MM AND LARGER) STRIPED BASS IN COORDINATION WITH THE US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (FWS) COASTAL TAGGING PROGRAM, DURING THE SAME PERIOD.MONITORING ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONCE WEEKLY SETTING AND HAULING OF STANDARD MULTI PANEL GILL NETS ON THE DEFINED SPAWNING GROUNDS OF THE RAPPAHANNOCK AND JAMES RIVERS. ALL CAPTURED STRIPED BASS WILL BE RETURNED TO VIMS FOR ANALYSIS OF INDIVIDUAL LENGTH, WEIGHT, SEX, AND SPAWNING CONDITION. OTOLITH AGES WILL BE DETERMINED FOR ALL SPECIMENS AND SCALE AGES WILL BE DETERMINED FOR A 20  SUBSAMPLE FOR COMPARISON.TAGGING ACTIVITIES WILL UTILIZE VIMS OWNED ELECTROFISHING EQUIPMENT ON AS MANY DAYS AS WEATHER CONDITIONS WILL PERMIT UNTIL EITHER THE 1,000 FISH TARGET IS MET OR THE SPAWNING SEASON ENDS. ALL TAGGED FISH WILL BE EXAMINED FOR LENGTH AND SEX (IF SEX CAN BE DETERMINED FROM EXTERNAL EXAMINATION) AND SCALES WILL BE REMOVED AND ANALYZED ACCORDING TO STANDARD PROCEDURES.BOTH TYPES OF DATA WILL BE SUPPLIED TO THE APPROPRIATE INTERSTATE COMMITTEES AS NEEDED. TAGGING DATA WILL BE SENT TO THE FWS INTERSTATE TAGGING COORDINATOR.THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE VARIOUS STRIPED BASS MANAGEMENT AGENCIES AND ULTIMATELY THE COMMERCIAL AND RECREATIONAL FISHING COMMUNITIES.THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

THERE IS A NEED TO MAINTAIN VIABLE POPULATIONS OF WILD DIADROMOUS FISHES IN MAINE, WHICH PROVIDE RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES IN FRESH AND SALTWATER HABITAT AND ARE AN IMPORTANT FORAGE BASE FOR PISCIVOROUS FISH, BIRDS, AND MAMMALS. DIADROMOUS FISHES, WHICH INCLUDES ANADROMOUS AND CATADROMOUS SPECIES, MIGRATE BETWEEN THE OCEAN AND FRESH WATER TO SPAWN. ANADROMOUS FISHES LIKE STRIPED BASS SPAWN IN FRESHWATER, BUT SPEND MOST OF THEIR LIFE IN THE SEA. THE CATADROMOUS AMERICAN EEL SPAWNS IN THE SEA, BUT SPENDS MOST OF ITS LIFE IN FRESH WATER OR ESTUARINE WATER. THE DISTRIBUTION AND ABUNDANCE OF DIADROMOUS SPECIES IN MAINE HAS BEEN SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCED BY THE PRESENCE OF DAMS. DEPENDING ON THE SPECIES, MAINE S 81 116 HYDROPOWER DAMS, HUNDREDS OF NON HYDROPOWER DAMS, AND MANY THOUSAND OF CULVERTS MAY BLOCK, IMPEDE, DELAY, KILL OR INJURE THESE FISH DURING THEIR MIGRATIONS. THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF MARINE RESOURCES (MDMR) HAS SOLE MANAGEMENT AUTHORITY FOR MANAGING THE STATE S DIADROMOUS SPECIES. MAINE S ABILITY TO SUSTAIN VIABLE POPULATIONS OF DIADROMOUS SPECIES WILL BE SIGNIFICANTLY COMPROMISED UNLESS SAFE, TIMELY, AND EFFECTIVE ACCESS TO HABITAT IS RESTORED.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INTENSIVELY MANAGE NEBRASKA S WATERS BY IMPLEMENTING A VARIETY OF MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES AIMED TO ENHANCE AQUATIC HABITAT AND IMPROVE SPORT FISH POPULATIONS.

THIS PROJECT ENTAILS WORK AT TWO BOAT RAMPS IN KENTUCKY. THE FIRST IS AT WILGREEN LAKE, WHERE KDFWR WILL WORK WITH THE MADISON COUNTY FISCAL COURT TO RECONSTRUCT THE EXISTING BOAT RAMP, PAVE THE GRAVEL PARKING, AND INSTALL A COURTESY DOCK KAYAK LAUNCH. THE SECOND PROJECT IS THE RE CONSTRUCTION OF THE WEST POINT BOAT RAMP AND PAVING OF ASSOCIATED PARKING AT THE RAMP. THIS PROJECT IS NEAR LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY. KDFWR HOPES TO HAVE BOTH PROJECTS COMPLETED BY THE END OF 2024, AS BOTH RAMPS SEE HIGH USAGE BY KENTUCKY ANGLERS AND BOATERS.

THE EDUCATION DIVISION (ED) OF THE DEPARTMENT OF MARINE RESOURCES (DMR) IS LOCATED AT THE AGENCY S WEST BOOTHBAY HARBOR LABORATORY. THE DIVISION REQUESTS FUNDING TO OFFER AQUATIC RESOURCES EDUCATION (ARE) FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC, EDUCATORS, SCHOOL GROUPS, AND OTHER AUDIENCES WITHIN THE STATE OF MAINE.THE PURPOSE OF THE EDUCATION DIVISION IS TO BUILD AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING ABOUT MAINE S MARINE ENVIRONMENT AND ITS FISHERIES. THE EDUCATION DIVISION COMPRISES THE MAINE STATE AQUARIUM (MSA), ADJACENT DISCOVERY CENTER (DC) (A PUBLIC LEARNING LAB AND CLASSROOM), FISHING PIER (FP), AND BURNT ISLAND (BI) WITH HISTORIC LIGHTHOUSE WITH EDUCATION CENTER. WHEN AUDIENCES VISIT THESE FACILITIES, THEY LEARN ABOUT MAINE S MARINE RESOURCES THROUGH EDUCATIONAL EXHIBITS AND PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON REGIONAL SPECIES, RESOURCE CONSERVATION, SPORT FISHING, CLIMATE CHANGE, MARINE DEBRIS, AND COASTAL STEWARDSHIP. EDUCATIONAL SERVICES ARE ALSO OFFERED THROUGH OUTREACH PROGRAMS ACROSS THE STATE, WITH EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AVAILABLE TO TEACHERS, STUDENTS, AND THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AND ON OUR WEBSITE. ED PROGRAMS AND FACILITIES REFLECT THE MISSION OF THE AGENCY TO PROVIDE EDUCATION ABOUT THE MAINE S MARINE RESOURCES, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND MONITORING, AND CONSERVATION PRACTICES TO PROTECT SALTWATER SPECIES AND THE MARINE ENVIRONMENT. THE EDUCATION DIRECTOR WILL COORDINATE AND SUPPORT PROJECTS TO INFORM AND COMMUNICATE WITH AUDIENCES ABOUT AQUATIC RESOURCES EDUCATION. THE EDUCATION DIVISION WILL PROVIDE OUTREACH ABOUT AQUATIC RESOURCES EDUCATION TO PARTICIPANTS, ATTENDEES, DIGITAL USERS, ETC.

DURING THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS, FOREST SERVICE BUDGETS HAVE DECLINED. THIS HAS CREATED ACHALLENGE IN BEING ABLE TO PROPERLY MAINTAIN AND OPERATE COURTESY DOCKS AT 27 BOATING ACCESS FACILITIES INSTALLED AT FLAMING GORGE DURING THE PAST DECADE. THE TREND OF BUDGET REDUCTIONS IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE. NATIONAL FOREST SERVICE FUNDS REDISTRIBUTED TO FLAMING GORGE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA HAVE NOT BEEN SUFFICIENT TO COVER THE FULL COSTS OF OPERATION AND REPAIRS OF COURTESY DOCKS REQUIRED TO ACCESS THE MORE THAN  1.6 MILLION WORTH OF BOATER ACCESS IMPROVEMENTS INSTALLED USING FEDERAL AND STATE DOLLARS AT FLAMING GORGE RESERVOIR IN UTAH.THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO ALLOW THE U.S. FOREST SERVICE TO CONTINUE TO COVER THE COSTS OF DOCK AND FLOATING INFRASTRUCTURE MAINTENANCE THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE BOATING SEASON BY AUGMENTING EXISTING FUNDING FOR SEASONAL EMPLOYEES AT FLAMING GORGE RESERVOIR.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS STUDY IS TO FURTHER THE RESEARCH CONDUCTED ON WALLEYE AND WHITE BASS POPULATION DYNAMICSDURING THE PAST FIVE YEARS ON LAKE MCCONAUGHY. ASSESSMENTS INCLUDE THE NEED TO IDENTIFY AND FOLLOW HATCHERY  ANDNATURALLY PRODUCED INDIVIDUALS OVER TIME, INCLUDING DIFFERENT SIZES OF STOCKED PRODUCTS (FRY VERSUS TWO SIZES OFFINGERLINGS) AND THE IMPACT THAT ALEWIFE MAY HAVE ON PREY RESOURCES FOR STOCKED FISH.

THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE LAKE DEPTH (BATHYMETRIC) AND FISH HABITAT ENHANCEMENT LAYERS FOR BLUESTONE LAKE, SUTTON LAKE, AND 8 ADDITIONAL SMALL LAKES, INTEGRATE LAKE DEPTH AND HABITAT LAYERS IN THE WV INTERACTIVE FISHING MAP AND AVENZA MAPS AND EDUCATE ANGLERS AND FUTURE ANGLERS ON THE USE OF THE WV INTERACTIVE FISHING MAP AND AVENZA MAPS.

THE MAINE SALTWATER RECREATIONAL FISHING AND SPECIES RESEARCH PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO MEET A NUMBER OF OBJECTIVES INCLUDING MARINE RECREATIONAL INFORMATION PROGRAM (MRIP) SUPPORT, MRIP OUTREACH, AND TAGGING AND TRACKING OF ATLANTIC HALIBUT. MEETING THESE OBJECTIVES WILL ENHANCE MANAGEMENT OF THESE KEY GULF OF MAINE SPECIES WITH LONG LASTING BENEFITS TO RECREATIONAL ANGLERS, AND FURTHER INSTITUTIONAL GOALS OF UNDERSTANDING THE IMPORTANCE OF RECREATIONAL FISHERIES, SUPPORTING STOCK ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ECOSYSTEM BASED FISHERIES MANAGEMENT IN THE REGION.

BOTTOM TRAWL SURVEYS OF THE GULF OF MAINE AND GEORGES BANK HAVE BEEN CONDUCTED BY THE NMFS SINCE FALL 1963 AND SPRING 1967 TO PROVIDE FISHERIES MANAGERS WITH INFORMATION ON THE CONDITION OF FISH POPULATIONS. HOWEVER, UNTIL THE MAINE NEW HAMPSHIRE INSHORE BOTTOM TRAWL SURVEY BEGAN, ABOUT 80  OF THE HISTORICALLY IMPORTANT INSHORE WATERS (GOODE 1884, COLLINS AND RATHBUN 1887, RICH 1929, BIGELOW AND SCHROEDER 1953) WERE NOT SURVEYED. AS A RESULT, PRIOR TO THE START OF THE ME NH INSHORE TRAWL SURVEY IN 2000, A DEARTH OF INFORMATION EXISTED FROM AREAS SHALLOWER THAN 300 FT. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE A SCIENTIFICALLY DEFENSIBLE QUANTITATIVE TIME SERIES ON THE DISTRIBUTION AND RELATIVE ABUNDANCE OF BENTHIC MARINE RESOURCES IN NEARSHORE GULF OF MAINE WATERS ALONG MAINE AND NEW HAMPSHIRE. THESE INSHORE WATERS ARE SUBSTANTIAL IN AREA AND CONTAIN KEYS HABITATS FOR SPORT FISH SPECIES AND THEIR PREY. WITHOUT THIS SURVEY, INFORMATION ON SPECIES IN THESE WATERS WOULD BE NONEXISTENT.THE MAINE NEW HAMPSHIRE INSHORE BOTTOM TRAWL SURVEY CONSISTS OF TWO SURVEYS, ONE EACH IN SPRING AND FALL. TOTAL SURVEY AREA ( 4546 NM2) IS STRATIFIED BY DEPTH AND REGION. IT INCLUDES FOUR DEPTH STRATA  4 20 FATHOMS, 21 35 FATHOMS, 36  55 FATHOMS, AND 56  FATHOMS IN FIVE GEOGRAPHIC REGIONS. THE SHALLOWEST DEPTH WAS BASED ON PRACTICAL CONSTRAINTS IMPOSED BY A 54 FOOT DRAGGER WHILE THE DEEPER BOUNDARY WAS SELECTED TO APPROXIMATELY FOLLOW THE TWELVE MILE BOUNDARY JURISDICTION OF ASMFC. EACH SURVEY TARGETS 120 STATIONS EACH SEASON AND EQUATES TO A SAMPLING DENSITY OF ABOUT 1 STATION   38 NM 2.A STANDARD TOW CONSISTS OF TOWING THE RESEARCH NET FOR TWENTY MINUTES AT 2.5 KNOTS IN AS STRAIGHT A LINE AS POSSIBLE. THE NET USED IN THIS SURVEY IS A MODIFIED VERSION OF MAINE SHRIMP TRAWL DESIGNED TO FISH EFFECTIVELY FOR A VARIETY OF BENTHIC SPECIES. AT EACH STATION, THE NET IS BROUGHT ON BOARD AND ALL FISH ARE IDENTIFIED AND SORTED BY SPECIES. COLLECTIVE WEIGHTS ARE TAKEN FOR ALL SPECIES. LENGTHS ARE TAKEN ON EACH INDIVIDUAL UNLESS THE SAMPLES FOR THAT SPECIES ARE SO LARGE THAT THEY CANNOT BE PROCESSED BEFORE THE NEXT TOW. FOR LARGE SAMPLES (E.G. HERRING) A REPRESENTATIVE SUB SAMPLE IS TAKEN OF AT LEAST ONE HUNDRED (100) INDIVIDUALS. SEX AND MATURITY STAGE OF INDIVIDUALS ARE DETERMINED FOR SELECTED GROUNDFISH SPECIES USING THE METHODS DESCRIBED IN BURNETT ET AL, (1989). A CTD PROFILER IS DEPLOYED TO COLLECT TEMPERATURE AND SALINITY DATA. AT THE END OF EACH SURVEY, CRUISE AND CATCH INFORMATION IS ENTERED DIRECTLY INTO THE DMR S ORACLE DATABASE (MARVIN), AND ARE CHECKED FOR ACCURACY BEFORE USE.THE RESULTS FROM THE FIRST TWENTY TWO YEARS OF THE INSHORE TRAWL SURVEY SHOW PATTERNS OF USE BY RECREATIONAL SPECIES SUCH AS AMERICAN SHAD, RAINBOW SMELT, MACKEREL, WINTER FLOUNDER, HADDOCK, ATLANTIC COD AND IMPORTANT PREY SPECIES FOR SPORTFISH IN AREAS THAT ARE NOT COVERED BY THE NMFS SURVEY. PRODUCTS FROM THIS PROJECT INCLUDE   YEARLY SEASONAL ABUNDANCE INDICES AND LENGTH DISTRIBUTIONS FOR REGULATED AND SPORT FISH SPECIES TO PREDICT STOCK BIOMASS TRENDS  BIOLOGICAL INFORMATION ON SELECTED SPECIES TO ASSESS STOCK SIZES AND REPRODUCTIVE POTENTIAL  ABUNDANCE, SIZE, AND SPECIES COMPOSITION DATA FOR POPULATION AND COMMUNITY STUDIES  ENVIRONMENTAL DATA TO IDENTIFY NON BIOLOGICAL FACTORS AFFECTING ABUNDANCE.

THE CITY OF GREEN RIVER IS ENGAGING IN A MULTIFACETED PROJECT TO ENHANCE THE USE OF THE RIPARIAN CORRIDOR OF THEGREEN RIVER WHERE IT BISECTS THE CITY AND ENHANCE BOATER ACCESS OPPORTUNITIES FOR RAFTERS AND PADDLERS USINGGREEN RIVER. THE FIRST PHASE OF THIS PROJECT PROPOSES CREATION OF A BOATING ACCESS PUT IN AND TAKE OUT RAMPADJACENT TO THE JOHN WESLEY POWELL RIVER HISTORY MUSEUM (MUSEUM). THE CURRENT STATE OF THE SITE PROPOSED FOR BOATRAMP CONSTRUCTION CAN BE CATEGORIZED AS A  PREVIOUSLY DISTURBED  STEEP BANK. THE PREVIOUSLY DISTURBED AREA ISLOCATED WITHIN THE HISTORICAL RIPARIAN CORRIDOR OF THE GREEN RIVER AND PRIMARILY VEGETATED WITH INVASIVE TAMARISKAND RUSSIAN OLIVE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE PADDLERS AND RAFTERS ON THE GREEN RIVER WITH ANIMPROVED RETRIEVAL AND LAUNCHING AREA IN THE TOWN OF GREEN RIVER  ENHANCING BOATER ACCESS ON ALONG THE GREENRIVER CORRIDOR. ADDITIONALLY, PREVIOUSLY DISTURBED AREAS ADJACENT TO THE RAMP WILL BE REHABILITATED USING NATIVESEED MIXES AND WILLOW PLANTINGS TO REPLACE REMOVED STANDS OF INVASIVE TAMARISK AND RUSSIAN OLIVE. TO ACHIEVETHIS, THE CITY OF GREEN RIVER, UTAH PLANS TO CONSTRUCT AN 8 FOOT WIDE AND 571 FOOT LONG CONCRETE BOAT RAMPADJACENT TO THE MUSEUM.

PROJECT ABSTRACTTHE PURPOSE OF THIS STUDY IS TO UNDERSTAND THE IMPORTANCE OF HABITAT COMPLEXITY TO SPORTFISH WITHIN A FLUCTUATINGIRRIGATION RESERVOIR. INFORMATION FROM THIS RESEARCH CAN BE USED TO INFORM OTHER HABITAT RESTORATION EFFORTS INNEBRASKA AND OTHER U.S. RESERVOIRS.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO RENOVATE THE MARINA PARK BOAT RAMP IN SOUTH KINGSTOWN, RI. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE DEMOLITION OF THE EXISTING RAMP AND CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW RAMP. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A SAFER AND IMPROVED BOAT LAUNCHING EXPERIENCE AT THIS LOCATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE BOATING PUBLIC WHO WILL USE THE RAMP. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE A SUBRECIPIENT AGREEMENT WITH THE TOWN OF SOUTH KINGSTOWN, WHO WILL PERFORM THE WORK.

THE CITY AND BOROUGH OF HAINES IS A SMALL COASTAL COMMUNITY REMOTELY LOCATED ON THE MAINLAND AT THE NORTHERN END OF LYNN CANAL IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA. HAINES IS APPROXIMATELY 70 MILES NORTHWEST OF JUNEAU AND HAS A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 2,000 RESIDENTS. HAINES IS ONE OF ONLY THREE COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA WITH DIRECT ROAD ACCESS TO THE REMAINDER OF ALASKA, CANADA, AND THE LOWER 48 STATES. THE HAINES HIGHWAY IS AN IMPORTANT TRAVEL CORRIDOR FOR BOTH ALASKA RESIDENTS AND INDEPENDENT VISITORS, CONNECTING MAINLAND ALASKA WITH THE REST OF SOUTHEAST ALASKA VIA THE ALASKA MARINE HIGHWAY FERRY SYSTEM.SALTWATER FISHING NEAR HAINES IS PRODUCTIVE FOR KING SALMON, SOCKEYE SALMON, DUNGENESS CRAB, SHRIMP, AND HALIBUT. FRESHWATER FISHING IN THE CHILKOOT RIVER AND CHILKOOT LAKE CAN BE PRODUCTIVE FOR SOCKEYE AND PINK SALMON IN SUMMER, COHO SALMON IN THE FALL, AND DOLLY VARDEN YEAR ROUND. FISHING IN THE CHILKAT RIVER CAN BE PRODUCTIVE IN OCTOBER THROUGH APRIL, WHEN THE WATERS ARE CLEAR OF GLACIAL SILT. DURING THE GLACIAL MELT SEASON, MAY THROUGH SEPTEMBER, SPORT FISHING IN THE CHILKAT RIVER DRAINAGE IS LIMITED TO CLEAR WATER TRIBUTARIES SUCH AS MOSQUITO LAKE AND CHILKAT LAKE. MOSQUITO LAKE PROVIDES THE BEST ROAD ACCESSIBLE CLEAR WATER FISHING OPPORTUNITY IN THE HAINES AREA. MOSQUITO LAKE ALSO PROVIDES THE ONLY ROAD ACCESSIBLE ICE FISHING IN THE WINTER. MOSQUITO LAKE AND CHILKAT LAKE ARE BOTH MANAGED AS HIGH USE CUTTHROAT TROUT WATERS WITH A BAIT PROHIBITION AND A TIGHTER SLOT LIMIT FOR RAINBOW CUTTHROAT TROUT RETENTION. ANGLER ACCESS TO CHILKAT LAKE REQUIRES SKILLED JET BOAT DRIVING IN THE SUMMER AND TRAVERSING A 4 MILE TRAIL IN THE WINTER.THE BOAT LAUNCH AT MOSQUITO LAKE IS SUITABLE FOR SMALLER CRAFT DUE TO THE STEEPNESS OF THE ACCESS ROAD. SPORT ANGLERS WITH BOATS CAN FISH ON MOSQUITO LAKE OR THEY CAN USE A CONNECTING SLOUGH TO ACCESS FISHING SPOTS IN THE UPPER CHILKAT RIVER DRAINAGE.THE MOSQUITO LAKE STATE RECREATION SITE, OWNED BY THE STATE OF ALASKA, IS AN ATTRACTIVE ROAD ACCESSIBLE CLEARWATER FISHING SITE WITH PICNIC TABLES, FIRE RINGS, AND SIX CAMPING SITES. THE LAND MANAGER, ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES, DIVISION OF PARKS AND OUTDOOR RECREATION (DPOR), PUT THE SITE IN PASSIVE MANAGEMENT MODE IN 2008 DUE TO BUDGET CUTS. TWO PIT PRIVIES THAT WERE IN USE AT THE SITE FROM THE 1960 S WERE DEEMED A SAFETY HAZARD AND DECOMMISSIONED IN 2013. THE LACK OF A SANITARY LATRINE AT THE MOSQUITO LAKE STATE RECREATION SITE HAS CREATED A HUMAN WASTE MANAGEMENT PROBLEM AND HAS DISCOURAGED ANGLER USE OF THE SITE. DPOR LAND MANAGERS HAVE RECENTLY ASSERTED INTEREST IN COOPERATING ON THE DESIGN OF A MODERN VAULT LATRINE AND DPOR HAS COMMITTED TO MAINTAINING THE FACILITY ONCE IT IS CONSTRUCTED.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO GAIN AN UNDERSTANDING OF PARTICIPATION LEVELS OF ANGLERS ON URBAN WATERBODIESIN NEBRASKA, IN GENERAL AND FOR SPECIFIC FISHERIES, AND ASSOCIATED INFLUENCES ON FISH POPULATIONS. THERE AREMANY FACTORS THAT INTERACT TO DETERMINE WHERE AND WHEN AN INDIVIDUAL PARTICIPATES IN FISHING. LIKEWISE, THEREARE MANY FACTORS THAT DETERMINE WHETHER AN ANGLER WILL HARVEST A CAPTURED FISH. WE ARE INTERESTED IN EVALUATINGTHE INFLUENCES OF SOME OF THESE FACTORS TO ANGLERS  CHOICES IN THE MIDWEST.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO IMPROVE THE EAST BOAT RAMPS AT HICKORY POINT ON LITTLE LAKE HARRIS INCLUDING THEREPLACEMENT OF SIX (6) EASTERN BOAT RAMPS AND ASSOCIATED ACCESS DOCKS.THE PROJECT ENHANCES THE EAST BOAT RAMPS AT HICKORY POINT BRINGING THEM INTO ADA COMPLIANCE.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO DEVELOP RECREATIONAL BOATING ACCESS AT THE BAY OF SARASOTA, INCLUDING TWO (2) CONCRETE FLOATING DOCKS AND A RECONSTRUCTED SEAWALL.

CURRENTLY THERE IS NOWHERE TO DOCK A BOAT AFTER LAUNCHING AT LOST CREEK RESERVOIR STATE PARK. BOATERS AT LOST CREEK RESERVOIR STATE PARK MUST SECURE THEIR BOAT TO THE BANK AFTER LAUNCHING WHILE THEY PARK THEIR VEHICLE. THE LACK OF A COURTESY DOCK MAKES ACCESSIBILITY FOR OLDER BOATERS EXTREMELY DIFFICULT WHEN LAUNCHING AND RETRIEVING. ADDITIONALLY, THE EXISTING VAULT RESTROOM AT THE LOST CREEK RESERVOIR STATE PARK BOAT RAMP HAS EXCEEDED ITS USEFUL LIFE AND IS IN NEED OF REPLACEMENT.INSTALLATION OF A NEW COURTESY DOCK AND RESTROOM WILL ALLOW BOATERS TO HAVE SAFE DOCKING OPTIONS DURING LAUNCHING AND RETRIEVAL OF BOATS DURING SEASONAL RESERVOIR ELEVATION CHANGES AND SATISFYING SANITARY BOATING EXPERIENCES.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC OF NORTH DAKOTA ABOUT FISHERIES MANAGEMENT, FISHING OPPORTUNITIES, WATER QUALITY, AQUATIC HABITAT, AND WATER SAFETY EDUCATION.

THE PURPOSE IS TO DEVELOP RESPONSIBLE PUBLIC BEHAVIOR THROUGH INCREASED AWARENESS OF ANS AND THE THREATS THEY POSE TO NORTH DAKOTA AQUATIC RESOURCES IN ORDER TO PREVENT THE INTRODUCTION AND SPREAD OF ANS INTO AND WITHIN NORTH DAKOTA, WHILE MITIGATING IMPACTS WHERE FEASIBLE.

THIS GRANT ALLOWS THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION S AQUATIC EDUCATION   R3 FISHING PROGRAM TO PROVIDE ANGLERS AND POTENTIAL ANGLERS A MULTITUDE OF LEARNING PLATFORMS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, IN-PERSON TRAININGS, FISHING CLINICS, FISHING RESOURCES WEBPAGE, HOW-TO VIDEOS AND VIRTUAL LEARNING COURSES, TO ASSIST THEM IN BECOMING SELF-SUFFICIENT, CONFIDENT AND ETHICAL IN THE SPORT OF FISHING.

CONTINUING STUDY TO ESTIMATE THE RELATIVE ABUNDANCE AND ASSESS THE STATUS OF AMERICAN SHAD AND RIVER HERRING STOCKS IN VIRGINIA BY MONITORING THE SPAWNING RUNS IN VARIOUS VIRGINIA RIVERS. ADDITIONALLY, TO MONITOR BYCATCH OF AMERICAN SHAD IN A PERMITTED GILL NET FISHERY AND BOTH AMERICAN SHAD AND RIVER HERRING IN POUND NET FISHERIES, AND REPORT THE JUVENILE ABUNDANCE INDICES FOR THESE SPECIES DERIVED FROM OTHER MONITORING PROGRAMS, THEREBY SATISFYING MANDATED REPORTING.

FEDERAL AID IN SPORTFISH RESTORATION STUDIES PROVIDE NECESSARY INFORMATION FOR MANAGING SPORT FISH POPULATIONS IN NORTH DAKOTA. ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE SAMPLING ACTIVITIES  FISH, HABITAT AND USERS  THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, DATA ENTRY AND PROOFING, DATA ANALYSIS AND SUMMARIZING, DEVELOPING STOCKING REQUESTS, PREPARING MANAGEMENT PLANS, DRAFTING WORK PLANS AND PERFORMANCE REPORTS, MAINTAINING AND REPAIRING EQUIPMENT, AND MANAGING STAFF.DELIVERABLES CONSIST OF SUSTAINABLE SPORT FISHING OPPORTUNITIES IN OVER 400 WATERS ACROSS NORTH DAKOTA, FOR THE BENEFIT OF RESIDENT AND NONRESIDENT ANGLERS TO HARVEST FOR FOOD AND RECREATION.SUB-RECIPIENTS WILL ASSIST WITH STREAM SURVEYS, PADDLEFISH POPULATION MONITORING, AND RESEARCH ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT IN NORTH DAKOTA.
MAHNOMEN PUBLIC WATER ACCESS SITE DEVELOPMENT   PHASE ONE BOATING CHANNEL PROJECT STATEMENT  FW-4-D-86

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE FOR THE DESIGN AND RECONSTRUCTION OF THE CANDLEWOOD LAKE  SQUANTZ COVE  STATE BOAT LAUNCH IN NEW FAIRFIELD, CT. RENOVATION OF THIS SITE WILL PROVIDE A STATE-OF-THE-ART ADA ACCESSIBLE LAUNCHING FACILITY. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ENGINEERING DESIGN, PERMITTING AND CONSTRUCTION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE BOATING AND FISHING PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE RECREATIONAL RESOURCES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE COORDINATION AND ADMINISTRATION OF ALL MARINE SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROJECTS IN FLORIDA FOR EFFECTIVE PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE REGARDING APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING, REPORTING, ELIGIBILITY, FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS. THIS INCLUDES PROVIDING PROJECT LEADERS WITH CURRENT INFORMATION REGARDING FEDERAL ASSISTANCE REGULATIONS AND USFWS GUIDELINES AND POLICIES. A MINIMUM OF 12 GRANTS WILL BE INCLUDED ANNUALLY.

THE CITY AND BOROUGH OF YAKUTAT IS A SMALL COASTAL COMMUNITY REMOTELY LOCATED AT THE NORTHERN EXTENT OF SOUTHEAST ALASKA, APPROXIMATELY 200 MILES NORTH OF JUNEAU AND 220 MILES SOUTH OF CORDOVA. LIKE MOST OF SOUTHEAST ALASKA, YAKUTAT IS NOT CONNECTED TO OTHER COMMUNITIES BY A ROAD SYSTEM, BUT INSTEAD RECEIVES DAILY PASSENGER JET SERVICE AND MONTHLY FERRY SERVICE. THE APPROXIMATE 600 YEAR-ROUND RESIDENTS OF YAKUTAT PRIMARILY RELY ON FRESHWATER AND MARINE FISHERIES RESOURCES TO SUPPORT THE COMMERCIAL AND SPORT FISHERIES THAT ARE THE FOUNDATION OF YAKUTAT S ECONOMY.YAKUTAT BAY IS ONE OF THE FEW BREAKS IN A 300-MILE STRETCH OF GULF OF ALASKA COASTLINE RUNNING NORTH FROM CROSS SOUND IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA TO CAPE SUCKLING NEAR CORDOVA. THE PRODUCTIVE WATERS OF YAKUTAT PROVIDE OUTSTANDING RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES FOR A VARIETY OF FRESHWATER, MARINE, AND ANADROMOUS FISH SPECIES, AND EASILY ARE ACCESSIBLE FROM THE HARBOR AND ROAD SYSTEM OF YAKUTAT.YAKUTAT IS ALSO HOME TO THE SITUK RIVER, WHICH IS A WORLD-CLASS FRESHWATER SPORT FISHING DESTINATION. ORIGINATING FROM TWO LAKES  SITUK LAKE AND MOUNTAIN LAKE , THE SITUK FLOWS APPROXIMATELY 18 MILES THROUGH OLD GROWTH SITKA SPRUCE FORESTS AND MUSKEG MEADOWS TO THE GULF OF ALASKA  FIGURE 1 . FROM ITS HEAD-WATER LAKES TO THE OCEAN, THE SITUK DROPS APPROXIMATELY 500 METERS IN ELEVATION, CREATING SLOW MEANDERING RIFLE AND POOL HABITAT THAT PROVIDES EXCELLENT SPAWNING AND REARING HABITAT FOR ANADROMOUS AND RESIDENT FISH SPECIES.THERE ARE TWO ESTABLISHED PUBLIC ACCESS POINTS ON THE SITUK RIVER  NINE MILE BRIDGE IS THE PRIMARY ACCESS POINT FOR THE UPPER RIVER, AND THE LOWER LANDING IS THE PRIMARY ACCESS FOR THE LOWER RIVER  FIGURE 1 . THE NINE MILE BRIDGE SITE IS MANAGED BY THE UNITED STATES FOREST SERVICE  USFS  AND HAS A BOAT LAUNCH, CAMPING FACILITIES, AND MULTIPLE TRAIL HEADS FOR ANGLERS ON FOOT TO ACCESS THE RIVER. THE LOWER LANDING IS OWNED BY THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME  ADFAND G , IS THE ONLY ACCESS POINT ON THE LOWER RIVER, AND PROVIDES PARKING, A BOAT LAUNCH, AND A VAULT LATRINE FOR ANGLERS AND RECREATIONAL BOATERS.IN 2007, ADFAND G, DIVISION OF SPORT FISH  DSF  PROVIDED FEDERAL AID IN SPORT FISH RESTORATION GRANT FUNDING  VIA PROJECT F-13-L-32  TO PURCHASE THE 0.75-ACRE PARCEL AT THE LOWER SITUK LANDING TO MAINTAIN PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE RIVER FOR RECREATIONAL BOATING AND SPORT FISHING. THE EXISTING VAULT LATRINE AT THE SITE PRE-DATED THAT ACQUISITION AND HAS BEEN IN PLACE FOR OVER 20 YEARS, EXCEEDING THE ENGINEERED USEFUL LIFE OF THE FACILITY.

OVER THE PAST THREE YEARS, CLEGHORN SPRINGS STATE FISH HATCHERY IN RAPID CITY, SOUTH DAKOTA HAS RECEIVED SUBSTANTIAL INVESTMENTS IN RECIRCULATING AQUACULTURE SYSTEM (RAS) TECHNOLOGY. THE HATCHERY PREVIOUSLY ONLY PRODUCED COLD WATER FISH (TROUT AND SALMON) BUT IS USING RAS TO EXPAND INTO COOL WATER AND WARM WATER FISHREARING. ONE BUILDING ON THE HATCHERY CAMPUS WAS RENOVATED AND CURRENTLY HOLDS SEVERAL RAS UNITS FOR THEPRODUCTION OF WALLEYE, LARGEMOUTH BASS, MUSKELLUNGE, AND SUNFISH. IN THE SPRING OF 2022, A NEW BUILDING WAS CONSTRUCTED AND WILL EVENTUALLY HOLD ADDITIONAL RAS UNITS. THE PUMPS, HEATER CHILLERS, STERILIZERS, AND FILTERS USED BY THE RAS UNITS ALL REQUIRE A CONTINUOUS SUPPLY OF ELECTRICITY. THE TWO RAS BUILDINGS ARE ON SEPARATE ELECTRICAL SUPPLY LINES FROM THE REST OF THE HATCHERY. ELECTRICAL POWER OUTAGES REGULARLY OCCUR BECAUSE OF THUNDERSTORMS, ICE, BLIZZARDS, FOREST FIRES, AND OTHER REASONS. ANY LOSS OF POWER WOULD LEAD TO CATASTROPHIC FISHLOSS. THUS, A BACK UP ELECTRICAL GENERATOR CAPABLE OF MEETING THE RAS UNIT ELECTRICAL NEEDS IS REQUIRED.
THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE PUBLIC S UNDERSTANDING OF WATER RESOURCES, AQUATIC LIFE FORMS, SPORT FISHING, AND DEVELOP RESPONSIBLE ATTITUDES AND ETHICS TOWARD THE AQUATIC ENVIRONMENT.

THIS GRANT WILL BE SUB-AWARDED TO THE CITY OF LAWTON. THE INTENT OF THIS SUB-AWARD IS TO ADDRESS THE CURRENT BOATING ACCESS FACILITIES AT COLLIER S LANDING ESTABLISHED IN 1990. CURRENT FACILITIES ARE AGED PAST THEIR EXPECTED LIFE SPAN OF 20 YEARS AND ARE IN NEED OF RENOVATION. THUS, THE PURPOSE THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECREATIONAL BOATING AND SPORT FISHING AT LAKE ELLSWORTH IN OKLAHOMA, AT THE COLLIER S LANDING AREA BY ENHANCING THE FACILITY WITH THE ADDITION OF A NEW DOCK AND GANGWAY. FURTHERMORE, THIS INCLUDES THE ADDITION OF A NEW DOCK ABUTMENT, A NEW CONCRETE ADA COMPLIANT PARKING SPACE AND PATHWAY, AN IMPROVED ASPHALT PARKING LOT AND ASPHALT ENTRY ROAD TO THE BOATING ACCESS AREA. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP TO SATISFY THE CURRENT AND ANTICIPATED FUTURE DEMAND FOR BOATING ACCESS AND RECREATIONAL FISHING AT LAKE ELLSWORTH, IN THE COLLIER S LANDING AREA FOR THE EXPECTED USEFUL LIFE OF 20 YEARS. THIS GRANT WILL ALSO BENEFIT NEARBY, LOCAL ECONOMIES AS BOATERS AND ANGLERS ARE WILLING TO TRAVEL CONSIDERABLE DISTANCES TO ENJOY THESE ACTIVITIES. LOCAL ECONOMIES WILL DERIVE BENEFITS FROM INCREASED SALES OF GASOLINE, FOOD, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, AND LODGING.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SURVEY MARINE RECREATIONAL FINFISH TO ESTIMATE CHANGES IN FISH ABUNDANCE WHICH WILL ASSIST FISHERIES MANAGERS IN DEVELOPING SOUND MANAGEMENT MEASURES TO ENSURE SUSTAINABLE POPULATIONS OF FISH. DATA REGARDING THE ABUNDANCE AND SIZE AND AGE DISTRIBUTIONS ARE NEEDED TO ASSESS THE STATUS OF POPULATIONS OF A VARIETY OF FINFISH THROUGH INFORMAL AND FORMAL  I.E. STOCK ASSESSMENTS  USE OF THE DATA. COLLECTION OF THIS TYPE OF DATA, PARTICULARLY DATA THAT IS ADDED TO SIMILARLY COLLECTED DATA OVER PERIODS OF TIME, ARE CRITICAL TO DEVELOPMENT OF ASSESSMENTS THAT ARE USEFUL AND INFORMATIVE TO FISHERIES MANAGERS.AGENCY STAFF WILL SAMPLE INSHORE FAUNA USING A VARIETY OF SAMPLING GEARS INCLUDING GILL NETS, OTTER TRAWLS AND SEINES. MULTIPLE GEARS ARE NEEDED TO SAMPLE RECREATIONALLY HARVESTED MARINE FINFISH AT KEY STAGES OF ONTOGENY  JUVENILE, SUB-ADULT AND ADULT. SAMPLES WILL BE SORTED TO SPECIES OR FAMILY LEVEL, QUANTIFIED, AND GROUPED WEIGHTS WILL BE OBTAINED PER SAMPLING PROTOCOLS. A SUMMARY OF CATCH PER UNIT EFFORT AND BIOLOGICAL INFORMATION FOR KEY SPECIES WILL BE PROVIDED IN AN ANNUAL REPORT WITH COMPARISONS TO RECENT CATCH AND BIOLOGICAL INFORMATION. SPECIFIC DETAILS ABOUT THE SAMPLING GEARS INCLUDING MESH SIZES, LOCATIONS OF SAMPLING STATIONS, SOAK TIMES AND FREQUENCY OF SAMPLING ARE IDENTIFIED IN THE STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE GUIDES PROVIDED AS SEPARATE DOCUMENTS TO THIS DOCUMENT.

THE NEED FOR A LONG TERM DATABASE OF ESSENTIAL POPULATION PARAMETERS, HARVEST AND DISCARD AMOUNTS, AND ABUNDANCE DATA IS AN INCREASINGLY CRITICAL COMPONENT OF STATE AND REGIONAL STOCK ASSESSMENTS  QUANTITATIVE STOCK ASSESSMENTS ARE IMPORTANT COMPONENTS OF DEVELOPMENT AND REVIEW  THEY ARE USED TO DETERMINE THE STATUS OF STOCKS AND IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE HARVEST CONTROL STRATEGIES  DATA NECESSARY TO PREPARE STOCK ASSESSMENTS INCLUDE AGE LENGTH DATA, GROWTH INFORMATION, CATCH AT AGE MATRICES, AND INDICES OF ABUNDANCE  COLLECTIVELY THIS GRANT PROJECT IS ESSENTIAL TO MONITOR THE STATUS OF NORTH CAROLINA S STRIPED BASS STOCKS ABUNDANCE INDICES, AGE, LENGTH, MATURITY, AND HABITAT DATA CAN BE SUCCESSFULLY COLLECTED THROUGH PROPERLY DESIGNED, MULTI FACETED FISHERIES INDEPENDENT SURVEYS, AND DAWR STAFF WILL CONDUCT VISUAL SURVEYS IN MPAS AND CONTROL SITES  THE FOLLOWING METHODS WILL BE USED WHENCONDUCTING THESE SURVEYS 1  50M X 5M BELT TRANSECTS WILL BE CONDUCTED ON REEF FLATS AND FORE REEF SLOPES OF BOTH CONTROL SITES  PAGO BAY,COCOS LAGOON, ASAN, AND EAST HAGATNA , AND MPAS  PITI BOMBHOLES, ACHANG REEF FLAT, AND TUMON BAY   THESETRANSECTS ARE USED TO ASSESS SPECIES SIZE AND NUMBERS 2  THIRTY MINUTE TIMED SWIM COUNTS WILL BE CONDUCTED OVER DIFFERENT SUBSTRATES  CORAL RUBBLE, SEAGRASS, SAND  ONREEF FLATS  THESE SURVEYS ASSESS SPECIES DIVERSITY 3  50M X 5M BELT TRANSECTS WILL BE CONDUCTED AT 20, 30, 40, AND 50 FOOT DEPTH CONTOURS IN CONTROL SITES AND MPAS THESE TRANSECTS ARE USED TO ASSESS SPECIES SIZE AND NUMBERS 4  THIRTY MINUTE TIMED SWIM COUNTS WILL BE CONDUCTED  ONE AT THE 20 30 FOOT DEPTH, AND ONE AT THE 40 50 FOOTDEPTH  THESE SURVEYS ASSESS SPECIES DIVERSITY

THE GOVERNMENT OF GUAM IN COORDINATION WITH THE GUAM ORGANIZATION OF SALTWATER ANGLERS  GOSA , A NON PROFIT RECREATIONAL FISHING ORGANIZATION, CONSTRUCTED A FISHING PLATFORM OVER THE WAVE ABSORBER UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF THE U S  ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS  USACE  AT THE HAGATNA MARINA CHANNEL, PASEO DE SUSANA PARK, GUAM  THE FISHING PLATFORM IS USED FOR RECREATIONAL FISHING, ADDRESSES ISSUES OF SAFETY, AND ENHANCES HOOK AND LINE FISHING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY, ESPECIALLY FOR SEASONAL FISHING OF ATULAI  BIG EYE SCAD  THE USACE CONDUCTS ANNUAL INSPECTIONS, ROUTINE MAINTENANCE, AND EMERGENCY REPAIRS TO THE WAVE ABSORBER AND WOULD NEED ACCESS TO IT  AS PART OF THE USACE SECTION 408 APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS, THE FISHING PLATFORM NEEDS TO BE REMOVED IN THE EVENT USACE CONDUCTS ANNUALINSPECTIONS, ROUTINE MAINTENANCE, AND OR EMERGENCY REPAIRS A PLATFORM REMOVAL AND REPLACEMENT PLAN  PRRP  OUTLINES THE REMOVAL PROCESS  THE PRRP INCLUDES A TIME SCHEDULE FOR REMOVAL BEGINNING WITH RECEIPT OF USACE S FORMAL REQUEST FOR INSPECTIONS, ROUTINE MAINTENANCE, AND OR EMERGENCY REPAIRS, KEY MILESTONES OF REMOVAL, AND REMOVAL TARGET WITH A BUFFER PERIOD PRIOR TO MOBILIZATION OF THE MAINTENANCE OR REPAIRS

SHALLOW WATER MOORING SYSTEMS OR SWMS ARE CRITICAL TO THE WELLBEING OF GUAM S REEF HABITAT, AS THEY PROVIDE ASAFE ALTERNATIVE TO ANCHORING  SWMS ARE PERMANENT MOORING SYSTEMS PLACED IN FREQUENTLY UTILIZED AREAS CONSISTINGOF A STAINLESS STEEL EYE BOLT FIXED INTO THE HARD REEF FLOOR ATTACHED TO A BUOY AND LINE TO SECURE THE VESSEL TO A VARIETY OF VESSEL TYPES AND SIZES UP TO 50  AND 35 TONS UTILIZE SWMS FOR UP TO 3 HOURS AT A TIME PARTAKING INVARIOUS ACTIVITIES SUCH AS FISHING, COMMERCIAL AND RECREATIONAL DIVING, SNORKELING, RESEARCH AND TRAINING TO NAMEA FEW  THE DIVISION OF AQUATIC AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES HAVE MAINTAINED THE GUAM  SHALLOW WATER MOORING SYSTEMSINCE 1999 WHEN 34 INDIVIDUAL SITES WHERE APPROVED

REEF FISH STOCKS ON GUAM HAVE BEEN DECLINING FOR THE PAST 30 YEARS  MARINE PROTECTED AREAS  MPAS  WEREIMPLEMENTED IN 1997 TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE  AN IMPROVEMENT IN FISH STOCKS WAS DETECTED IN THE FOLLOWING YEARS BEGINNING IN 2007, HOWEVER, GUAM EXPERIENCED AN INCREASE IN THE COMMERCIAL HARVEST OF REEF FISH  THE LEVEL OFACTIVITY AND THE AMOUNT OF FISH TAKEN WERE MUCH GREATER THAN IN PREVIOUS YEARS, AND REEF FISH STOCKS AGAIN BEGANTO DECLINE  MUCH OF THIS ACTIVITY INVOLVED FISHING WITH SCUBA, OR OTHER ASSISTED BREATHING METHODS  IN RESPONSETO CONCERNS EXPRESSED BY FISHING GROUPS AND OTHERS TO DECLINING FISH STOCKS, THE GUAM LEGISLATURE PASSED PUBLICLAW  53 35 , BANNING FISHING WITH SCUBA AND OTHER ARTIFICIAL BREATHING ASSISTANCE  MONITORING OF FISH STOCKSSHOULD TAKE PLACE TO SEE IF THERE IS A MEASUREABLE RESPONSE TO THE SCUBA FISHING BAN  DAWR PROPOSES TO DO THISBY PERFORMING TRANSECTS IN CONTROL SITES  MPAS , WHERE NO SCUBA FISHING IS ALLOWED, AS WELL AS EXPERIMENTAL SITESWHERE SCUBA FISHING HAD BEEN OCCURRING

THE MASSO RESERVOIR RESTORATION PROJECT WAS COMPLETED IN FY2011, AND PROVIDES A SAFE AND EASILY ACCESSIBLEFRESHWATER FISHING EXPERIENCE FOR THE PEOPLE OF GUAM  THE OPPORTUNITIES FOR FRESHWATER FISHING ON GUAM ARELIMITED  FENA LAKE, THE ISLAND S LARGEST RESERVOIR, IS ON NAVY PROPERTY, AND ACCESS TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC ISRESTRICTED OR NOT AVAILABLE  THE MASSO RESERVOIR WILL REQUIRE PERIODIC RESTOCKING OF NATIVE SPORT FISH, AS THEKUHLIA ARE UNABLE TO COMPLETE THEIR LIFE HISTORY IN A CLOSED SYSTEM SUCH AS THE MASSO RESERVOIR  MONITORING OFTHE MASSO RESERVOIR WILL CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES 1  DAWR STAFF WILL MONITOR THE STATUS OF THE FISHERY MONTHLY IN THE MASSO RESERVOIR BY COLLECTING LENGTH WEIGHTDATA, TAGGING FISH, AND SURVEYING THE FISHING ACTIVITY IN THE RESERVOIR 2  DAWR STAFF WILL RESTOCK THE RESERVOIR WITH THE NATIVE SPORT FISH KUHLIA RUPESTRIS, AS FISHING LEVELS DICTATE 3  INSTALL TRAIL CAMERAS TO MONITOR ACTIVITY LEVELS AT THE RESERVOIR WHEN STAFF ARE NOT PRESENT

TO MEET ITS RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT OF GUAM S NATURAL RESOURCES, THERE IS A NEED FORTHE GUAM DIVISION OF AQUATIC AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES  DAWR  TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL GUIDANCE AND CONDUCTENVIRONMENTAL REVIEWS TO AVOID OR MINIMIZE IMPACTS TO POPULATIONS OF WILD BIRDS AND MAMMALS, FINNED FISH ANDTHEIR HABITATS  THE VOLUME AND COMPLEXITY OF THE RAPID DEVELOPMENT OF GUAM S ECONOMY HAS RESULTED IN INCREASINGDEMANDS UPON GUAM S NATURAL RESOURCES  THE TREND TOWARD URBANIZATION HAS BROUGHT AN INCREASE IN THE CONSTRUCTIONOF RECREATIONAL, COMMERCIAL, MILITARY, AND PUBLIC UTILITY FACILITIES, ALL OF WHICH HAVE SOME IMPACT UPON THEENVIRONMENT  TO HELP MINIMIZE LONG TERM ADVERSE IMPACTS OF SUCH DEVELOPMENTS, THE DIVISION OF AQUATIC ANDWILDLIFE RESOURCES HAS TAKEN AN INCREASINGLY ACTIVE ROLE IN THE AREA OF TECHNICAL GUIDANCE  THESERESPONSIBILITIES ARE INCREASING RAPIDLY BECAUSE REVIEW IS NOW LEGALLY REQUIRED FOR MANY DEVELOPMENT PLANS, PERMITAPPLICATIONS, AND IMPACT STATEMENTS

THE FISH LIFE HISTORY ANALYSIS PROGRAM OBJECTIE IS TO GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF CRITICAL LIFE HISTORY PARAMETERS OF CORAL REEF FISH HARVESTED IN THE COMMON WEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS  CNMI   LIFE HISTORY PARAMETERS SUCH AS AGE AND REPRODUCTION OF FISH WILL BE COLLECTED FROM FISH OTOLITHS AND GONADS FROM SELECT CORAL REEF FISH IN THE CNMI TO INFORM FISHERIES MANAGERS ABOUT THE LIFE SPAN, AGE AT MATURITY, AND SIZE AT MATURITY OF FISH THAT ARE STUDIED  THIS DATA COULD THEN BE APPLIED TO FISH STOCK ASSESSMENTS, WHICH IS NECESSARY FOR THE SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF FISH SPECIES

THIS FISH HABITAT SURVEYS AND MONITORING PROGRAM WILL COLLECT AND MONITOR ESSENTIAL FISH HABITAT INFORMATION SUCH AS ENVIRONMENTAL VARIABLES  I E , TEMPERATURE, PH, DISSOLVED OXYGEN, CONDUCTANCE, AND WEATHER  AND BENTHIC INFORMATION IN ALL HABITATS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS WHERE FISH SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED  CORAL REEF, SEAGRASS, ETC    ADDITIONALLY, TEMPERATURE LOGGERS WILL BE STATIONED INSIDE AND OUTSIDE OF THE SAIPAN LAGOON TO ASSESS DIFFERENCES IN TEMPERATURE AMONG THE DIFFERENT HABITATS  THIS INFORMATION WILL BE USEFUL FOR FUTURE DFW FISH HABITAT RESTORATION PROJECTS  E G , CORAL NURSERIES , WHICH WILL BE LOCATED IN THE SAIPAN LAGOON

THE COMMON WEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS  CNMI  FISH AGREGATTING DEVICE  FAD  PROGRAM PROVIDES RECREATIONAL FISHING OPPORTUNITIES IN CNMI THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF FAD SYSTEMS AROUND THE POPULATED ISLANDS OF SAIPAN, TINIAN, AND ROTA  FAD SYSTEMS HELP FISHERIES BY PROMOTING PELAGIC FISH AGGREGATIONS AT FIXED SITES AROUND THE PULATED ISLANDS  FISHERMEN BENEFIT FROM THESE FADS AS IT IMPROVES THEIR CHANCES OF HOOKING A FISH AND REDUCES FUEL CONSUMPTION WHEN SEARCH OF SCHOOLS OF FISH  CNMI CURRENTLY MAINTAINS 11 FAD SITES IN THE WATERS SURROUNDING THE ISLANDS OF SAIPAN, TINIAN, AGUIJAN, AND ROTA  RECENTLY THERE HAVE BEEN REQUESTS BY THE FISHING COMMUNITY TO LOCATE POSSIBLE ALTERNATE FAD SITES WHICH ARE CLOSER TO THE ISLANDS  THE MAIN FACTOR BEHIND THIS REQUEST WAS THE INCREASE IN COST OF FUEL ON THE ISLANDS  IT WOULD BE BENEFICIAL TO THE FISHING COMMUNITY IF THE DIVISION MADE THE INITIAL STEPS IN LOCATING POSSIBLE FAD SITES WHICH ARE EASILY ACCESSIBLE

RANDOM SAMPLING WILL BE CONDUCTED THROUGH THE NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE WESTERN PORTION OF SAIPAN WHERE IT IS MORE EASILY ACCESSIBLE FOR FISHERMEN AND S URVEYORS ALONG THE MAJOR ROADS OF THE ISLAND  THIS WILL INCLUDE ESTABLISHED OR ENHANCED CREEL SURVEYS THAT MEASURE FISHING EFFORT AND FISHER INTERVIEWS THAT MEASURE CATCH SIZE FREQUENCY, SPECIES COMPOSITION AND CATCH PER UNIT EFFORT FOR NEAR SHORE FISHERIES WILL BE PERFORMED  OPPORTUNISTIC DATA WILL ALSO BE COLLECTED IN AREAS OF SAIPAN THAT ARE LESS ACCESSIBLE SURVEY AREAS TO FILL GAPS IN DATA COLLECTION  CONTINUED EFFORT TO COLLECT RELIABLE DATA ENABLES MANAGEMENT TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS WHEN ADDRESSING FISHERY CONCERNS

THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME S  DEPARTMENT  MISSION IS TO PRESERVE, PROTECT, PERPETUATE, AND MANAGEIDAHO S FISH AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES FOR THE PUBLIC INTEREST  IDAHO CODE   36 103   WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT S 2015STRATEGIC PLAN, THE IDAHO FISH AND GAME COMMISSION ESTABLISHES AN OVERARCHING GOAL TO SUSTAIN IDAHO S FISH ANDWILDLIFE AND THE HABITATS UPON WHICH THEY DEPEND  A KEY OBJECTIVE OF THIS GOAL IS TO OBTAIN MITIGATION FORHABITATS AFFECTED BY INFRASTRUCTURE AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS ANNUALLY, THE DEPARTMENT RECEIVES NUMEROUS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE REQUESTS FROM THE PUBLIC AND LOCAL, STATE, ANDFEDERAL AGENCIES ADDRESSING AN ARRAY OF FISH AND WILDLIFE TOPICS  THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THEDEPARTMENT S TECHNICAL SERVICES BUREAU  COMPOSED OF THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AND IDAHO FISH AND WILDLIFEINFORMATION SYSTEM  TO ACCOMPLISH ANNUAL ACTIVITIES RESPONDING TO TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE REQUESTS, INCLUDING THEFOLLOWING COMMON EXAMPLES   PARTICIPATION IN LAND USE AND TRAVEL MANAGEMENT PLANNING WITH STATE AND FEDERAL RESOURCE AGENCIES   PARTICIPATION IN WATER APPROPRIATION AND INSTREAM FLOW PROCEEDINGS   REVIEWING APPLICATIONS FOR STREAM, LAKE AND WETLAND ALTERATION PERMITS   ANALYZING POTENTIAL EFFECTS ON FISH AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES FROM AGRICULTURE, FOREST, AND RANGE MANAGEMENTPROJECTS   REVIEWING PROJECT PROPOSALS AND RECOMMENDING MEASURES TO AVOID, MINIMIZE, AND MITIGATE ADVERSE EFFECTS TO FISHAND WILDLIFE RESOURCES FROM TRANSPORTATION, ENERGY, MINING, INFRASTRUCTURE, AND WATER DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS   RESPONDING TO REQUESTS FOR DATA STORED WITHIN THE IDAHO FISH AND WILDLIFE INFORMATION SYSTEM

THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME FISH HATCHERY PROGRAM HAS PROVIDED A DIVERSITY OF ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES TOMEET THE STATE S RECREATIONAL FISHERIES DEMANDS SINCE 1907  THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR HAGERMAN AND HENRYSLAKE STATE FISH HATCHERIES TO CONTINUE TO HELP MEET THOSE NEEDS OVER 4 4 MILLION ANGLER DAYS PER YEAR ARE EXPENDED ON WATERS LARGELY SUPPORTED BY IDAHO S FISH STOCKING PROGRAM ABOUT 23  OF THOSE ANGLER DAYS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY FISH PRODUCED AND STOCKED UNDER THIS GRANT  RETURNS TO THEANGLER ARE EXPECTED TO BE SIGNIFICANTLY GREATER THAN THE POUNDAGE STOCKED  THE SPECIES DIVERSITY AND FISHINGOPPORTUNITY GENERATED BY THIS PROGRAM ARE EXPECTED TO MAINTAIN ANGLER SATISFACTION AND PROVIDE A MINIMUM CATCHRATE OF 0 5 FISH PER HOUR  AS ANGLING PRESSURE CONTINUES TO INCREASE, THE BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM ARE EXPECTEDTO ALSO INCREASE  OVERALL PERFORMANCE OF THIS PROGRAM IS EXPECTED TO YIELD INCREASING RETURNS TO THE ANGLER, ASTHE STOCKING REGIME IS FINE TUNED TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE NATURAL PRODUCTIVITY OF THE WATER

VERMONT S AQUATIC RESOURCE EDUCATION PROGRAM  ARE  BEGAN IN 1990 UNDER A FEDERAL AID GRANT FROM THE U  S  FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE  VERMONT S ARE PROGRAM FOCUSES ON YOUTH AND ADULT EDUCATION IN A VARIETY OF CAPACITIES ALL WHILE FOLLOWING BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES FOR NONFORMAL EDUCATION  ARE YOUTH EDUCATION OCCURS AT THE DEPARTMENT S GREEN MOUNTAIN CONSERVATION CAMPS, SCHOOL PROGRAMS, AND EDUCATIONAL ORGANIZATION PROGRAMS  ADULT EDUCATION OCCURS AT THE NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT FOR EDUCATORS AND OUTDOOR EDUCATION TECHNIQUES COURSE AS WELL AS THE PROJECT AQUATIC WILD CURRICULUM GUIDE AND TRAINING FOR EDUCATORS  LASTLY, A COMBINATION OF ADULT AND YOUTH EDUCATION OCCURS IN THE LET S GO FISHING PROGRAM AS WELL AS INTERPRETATION THROUGH MOBILE EXHIBITS AND A STATE VISITORS  CENTER AT A FISH CULTURE STATION  I E  ED WEED FISH CULTURE STATION IN GRAND ISLE   THIS NEW FIVE YEAR PLAN INTENDS TO BUILD UPON THE PREVIOUS ACCOMPLISHMENTS BY EXPLORING, IMPLEMENTING, AND EVALUATING NEW WAYS OF EDUCATOR TRAINING, REVISING, AND ENRICHING EDUCATIONAL CURRICULA, STREAMLINING THE PROCESS OF CERTIFYING VOLUNTEER INSTRUCTORS, IMPROVING VOLUNTEER INSTRUCTOR TRAINING, AND CREATING MORE EDUCATIONAL FISHING CLINICS FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES WITH A FOCUS ON UNDERSERVED AUDIENCES IN OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES, SPECIFICALLY FISHING  DURING THIS NEXT FIVE YEAR PLAN, AN EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON ADVANCED AQUATIC EDUCATION CURRICULUM AND EVALUATION METHODS FOR THE LET S GO FISHING PROGRAM AS WELL AS REACHING UNDERSERVED AUDIENCES  THIS NEW FIVE YEAR GRANT WILL SUPPORT TOPIC PROGRAMMING AND EVALUATIONS FOR THE LGF PROGRAM THAT WILL HOPEFULLY LEAD TO RETENTION OF PARTICIPANTS IN THE PROGRAM, AS WELL AS THE REACTIVATION OF LAPSED ANGLERS  ALL OF WHICH WILL LEAD TO A GREATER AWARENESS OF VERMONT S AQUATIC RESOURCES AND PARTICIPATION IN ANGLING

FISH AND FISHING IS INTEGRAL TO THE  FA ASAMOA  OR SAMOAN CULTURE  FISHES AND INVERTEBRATES ASSOCIATED WITHCORAL REEFS HAVE PROVIDED FOOD, LIVELIHOOD AND CULTURAL USE  WEDDINGS, FUNERALS, BIRTHDAYS, SOCIAL TITLECONFERMENT  FOR THE SAMOAN PEOPLE FOR THOUSANDS OF YEARS  FOR A TERRITORY DEPENDENT ON CORAL REEF RESOURCES, WESTILL LACK VARIOUS BASIC INFORMATION OF THE BIOLOGY OF EXPLOITED SPORT FISHES  THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO DETERMINETHE POPULATION GENETIC CONNECTIVITY OF THREE SELECTED MODEL FISHES IN THE SAMOAN ARCHIPELAGO

IN THE CNMI, WHERE POPULATION GROWTH HAS INCREASED AT A TREMENDOUS RATE DUE TO THE INCREASE OF IMMIGRANTS SETTLING HERE, THERE IS A NEED TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO THE CNMI STAKEHOLDERS TO INCREASE THE PARTICPATION, AWARENESS AND APPRECIATION OF RECREATIONAL FISHING AND OUR MARINE RESOURCES  WITH THE STAKEHOLDERS  KNOWLEDGE OF THE IMPACTS OF THEIR ACTIONS, AS WELL AS EDUCATING THE YOUNGER GENERATION OF THE VARIOUS FISHING METHODS AVAILABLE AND THE VARIETY OF FISH SPECIES THE CNMI HAS TO OFFER, THE GOAL OF MAINTAINING SUSTAINABLE RECREATIONAL FISHING AS WELL AS PRESERVING OUR NATURAL AQUATIC RESOURCES WILL EVENTUALLY BE MET  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH VARIOUS OUTREACH METHODS SUCH AS  CONDUCT FISHING CLINICS MINI WORKSHOPS AT VARIOUS EVENTS  THESE CLINICS WILL EDUCATE STUDENTS ON VARIOUS FISHING METHODS SUCH ROD AND REEL, SPEAR AND NETCASTING, SAFE FISHING PRACTICES AS WELL AS DIFFERENT KNOTS USED FOR FISHING, DISTRIBUTION OF VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, COLLABORATE WITH VARIOUS GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND VOLUNTEER GROUPS  411, DPS BOATING SAFETY  TO ASSIST INPROVING DEMONSTRATIONS AS WELL AS HANDS ON EXPERIENCE FOR PARTICIPANTS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS ON THE VARIOUS FISHING METHODS, SAFE FISHING PRACTLCES, KNOTS USED FOR  1SH1NG OY EDUCATING CHILDREN ABOUT PROPER FISHING METHODS AND PRACTICES AT AN EARLY AGE WLLL BE FUNDAMENTAL FOR ESTABLISHING A COMMUNITY OF SUSTAINABLE FISHERMEN AND WOMEN IN THE FUTURE  THE KNOWLEDG, IF RETAINED AND PRACTICED BY THE CHILDREN, COULD POSSIBLY BE PASSED ON TO FUTURE GENERATIONS

FISHING HAS ALWAYS BEEN AN IMPORTANT CULTURAL AND ECONOMIC ACTIVITY FOR THE RESIDENTS OF GUAM  RECENT DEVELOPMENTS IN GUAM S TOURISM INDUSTRY, ECONOMY, AND ANTICIPATED MILITARY BUILD UP HAVE ADVERSELY AFFECTED THE HEALTH OF OUR CORAL REEFS IN ADDITION TO PLACING A GREATER DEMAND ON LOCAL MARINE RESOURCES  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ON GOING UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THESE CHANGES ARE AFFECTING GUAM S SPORT FISHERY IN ORDER TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE THIS FRAGILE, YET PRODUCTIVE ECOSYSTEM  INSHORE CREEL SURVEYS HAVE IDENTIFIED THE RECENT INCREASE IN FISHING PARTICIPATION ON GUAM S REEFS  FISHING ACTIVITIES, COUPLED WITH THE BOOMING TOURISM INDUSTRY, HAVE CREATED MORE RESOURCE CONFLICTS AND PROBLEMS  ABANDONED GILL NETS, POOR WATER QUALITY, JET SKIING, AND SILTATION ARE ONLY SOME OF THE ISSUES AFFECTING THE HEALTH OF GUAM S REEFS, WHICH HAS ALSO RESULTED IN DECREASED ABILITY TO CATCH REEF FISH  HARVEST COMPOSITIONS OF POPULAR REEF FISH IN THE LAST DECADE HAVE SHIFTED TO SMALLER AND LESS DESIRABLE SPECIES, ESPECIALLY WITH GILL NETS AND SPEARFISHING  LARGER SPECIES OF FISH, E G , GROUPERS AND PARROTFISH, HAVE BECOME SCARCE TO ABSENT FROM POPULAR REEFS AROUND GUAM  GROUPERS AND PARROTFISH WITH HIGHER TURN OVER RATES SUCH AS EPINEPHELUS MERRA AND CHLORURUS SPILURUS, HAVE BECOME THE DOMINANT CATCH IN RECENT YEARS  MONITORING OF INSHORE FISHERIES WILL BE ACHIEVED IN THE FOLLOWING WAYS  1  CONDUCT 192 INSHORE SURVEYS EACH YEAR ALONG THE COASTLINE OF GUAM  2  CONTINUE GATHERING LIMITED BIOLOGICAL DATA THAT WILL ADD TO A LONG TERM HISTORICAL DATABASE ON GUAM S FISH SPECIES BY CONDUCTING 192 INSHORE SURVEYS EACH YEAR ALONG THE COASTLINE OF GUAM  3  CONDUCT 24 AERIAL SURVEYS EACH YEAR ALONG THE COASTLINE OF GUAM

THE DEPARTMENT OF MARINE AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES  DMWR  RECEIVES FEDERAL GRANTS TO OPERATE AND ACCOMPLISH ITS MISSION TO PROTECT AND MANAGE THE MARINE AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES IN AMERICAN SAMOA  THE COORDINATION, MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS GRANT IS TO FACILITATE, MANAGE AND MONITOR ALL GRANT RELATED ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORTS THIS MISSION  THIS IS PERFORMED BY WORKING WITH USFWS WSFR GRANTORS THROUGH TRAINING, SITE VISITS, REVIEW, EVALUATION AND APPROVAL OF ALL GRANT DOCUMENTS TO ENSURE OPTIMAL COMPLIANCE  ADDITIONALLY, ESTABLISHING ALL APPROPRIATE MECHANISMS THAT REFLECT THE EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF THESE GRANTS THROUGH TIMELY REPORTING AND GRANT SUBMISSIONS  THE SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS GRANT WILL YIELD HIGH COMPLIANCE WITH LEGAL FRAMEWORKS THAT GUIDE THE PROCESS AND UTILIZATION OF FEDERAL FUNDS AND ALLOW DMWR TO SUSTAIN THE MARINE AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES IN THE TERRITORY

IDAHO CONTAINS NEARLY ONE HALF MILLION ACRES OF LAKES AND RESERVOIRS AND OVER ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND ACRES OFRIVERS AND STREAMS STRETCHING NEARLY THIRTY THOUSAND MILES  THESE DIVERSE WATER RESOURCES PROVIDE IDAHO ANGLINGOPPORTUNITIES FOR ABOUT 40 SPECIES OF GAME FISH WHICH ARE PURSUED BY OVER 425,000 LICENSED ANGLERS ANNUALLY  THEIDAHO DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME FISHERIES PROGRAM IS OBLIGATED TO ENSURE THE STATE S FISHERIES RESOURCES AREPRESERVED, PROTECTED, PERPETUATED AND MANAGED TO PROVIDE ANGLING OPPORTUNITIES AS APPROPRIATE BASED ON ANGLERPREFERENCES AND THE BIOLOGICAL CAPABILITIES OF THE HABITAT  IT IS ALSO COMMITTED TO CONTINUALLY IMPROVING THEPUBLIC S AWARENESS OF SPORT FISHING OPPORTUNITIES AS WELL AS THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF AND INVOLVEMENT IN FISHMANAGEMENT  THIS GRANT PROVIDES THE FUNDING NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE THESE OBJECTIVES AND OBLIGATIONS

THE SMITH RIVER IS CALIFORNIA S LARGEST FREE FLOWING RIVER AND PROVIDES A FLAGSHIP FISHING DESTINATION FOR THOUSANDS OF ANGLERS ANNUALLY FISHING FOR STEELHEAD TROUT, RESIDENT RAINBOW TROUT, COASTAL CUTTHROAT TROUT, AND CHINOOK SALMON  THERE ARE A TOTAL OF SEVEN INDIVIDUAL FISHERY REGULATION ZONES AND 18 INDIVIDUAL SPECIES  ZONE SPECIFIC REGULATIONS RESULTING IN 25 UNIQUE FISHERIES THROUGHOUT THE BASIN  SECTION 180  2018 CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE  CDFW  REGULATIONS   MOST OF THE BASIN IS WITHIN THE SMITH RIVER NATIONAL RECREATION AREA WITH DOZENS OF DEVELOPED RIVER ACCESS POINTS USED FOR FISHING AND OTHER RECREATION ACTIVITIES  PRIOR TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT  SFRA  PROJECT, LITTLE WAS KNOWN ABOUT THE SMITH RIVER CATCHABLE SALMONID POPULATIONS DESPITE THE RIVER BEING ONE OF THE MOST POPULAR SALMONID SPORT FISHERIES IN CALIFORNIA WITH OVER 300 MILES OF ANADROMOUS WATERS OPEN TO SPORT FISHING ESTIMATING ANNUAL CHINOOK SALMON AND STEELHEAD TROUT ESCAPEMENT AND IDENTIFYING CRITICAL AREAS FOR JUVENILE REARING WILL AID IN DEFINING FUTURE SALMONID HABITAT RESTORATION PRIORITIES AND FISHERIES MANAGEMENT DECISIONS  FISHERIES ASSESSMENT AND MANAGEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS PRODUCED IN TECHNICAL REPORTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SFRA PROJECT ARE THE PRIMARY CATALYST FOR RESTORATION ACTIONS TARGETED AT INCREASING SPORTFISH POPULATION NUMBERS  THESE DATA ARE NECESSARY AS THE BASIS TO INFORM AND EVALUATE FISHERIES EXPLOITATION AND MANAGEMENT  LASTLY, STAFF ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SFRA PROJECT REGULARLY PARTICIPATE WITH SMITH RIVER STAKEHOLDER GROUPS, INCLUDING THE MILL CREEK ADVISORY GROUP AND SMITH RIVER ADVISORY COUNCIL, TO COMMUNICATE MONITORING ASSESSMENTS, MAINTAIN A COORDINATED SALMONID MONITORING STRATEGY, AND INFORM SPORT FISH RESTORATION IN THE SMITH RIVER BASIN THE SCALE ARCHIVE COMPONENT OF THIS PROJECT HAS INVENTORIED ADULT ANADROMOUS SALMONID SCALES SAMPLED DURING THE COURSE OF ITS OWN AND OTHER CDFW STUDIES IN THE KLAMATH TRINITY BASIN SINCE 1984  IN 1993, WE BEGAN CATALOGING AND INVENTORYING SOME 50,000  SCALE SAMPLES COLLECTED THROUGHOUT NORTHERN AND CENTRAL CALIFORNIA FROM 1913 THROUGH 1933  BOTH THE CURRENT AND HISTORIC COLLECTIONS ARE VALUABLE REFERENCE MATERIAL FOR RESOURCE ASSESSMENT AND RESEARCH WHICH SHOULD BE ADDED TO AND MAINTAINED FROM YEAR TO YEAR  GENETICISTS WORKING WITH UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA DAVIS, HUMBOLDT STATE UNIVERSITY, THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE, AND SEVERAL GRADUATE STUDENTS HAVE REQUESTED SCALES FOR THEIR STUDIES

STEELHEAD STOCKS SALMON AND STEELHEAD POPULATIONS IN THE SJR BASIN APPEAR TO RISE AND FALL IN CONNECTION WITH WET AND DRY YEARCYCLES  SINCE THE SJR BASIN, IN RECENT HISTORY, CAN PRODUCE TENS OF THOUSANDS OF ADULT SALMON, IT IS BELIEVEDTHAT GREATER, AND MORE FREQUENT, PRODUCTION OF LARGE NUMBERS OF ADULT SALMON AND STEELHEAD IS POSSIBLE SUBSTANTIAL OPPORTUNITY FOR RESTORATION OF INLAND AND SIGNIFICANTLYALTERED HYDROLOGIC PATTERNS AND THE AMPLITUDE OF CHANNEL FORMING STREAM FLOW  CUMULATIVELY PRIVATE, STATE, ANDFEDERAL WATER DIVERSIONS ALONG THE RIVERS AND IN THE SACRAMENTO SAN JOAQUIN ESTUARY INCREASE MORTALITY RATES FORVARIOUS SALMONID LIFE STAGES RESULTING IN LOWERED ADULT SALMON AND STEELHEAD PRODUCTION  THESE WATER PROJECTSALSO BLOCKED THE NATURAL DOWNSTREAM MOVEMENT OF SEDIMENT, WHICH FORM SPAWNING AND REARING HABITAT FOR ANADROMOUSFISHES  SALMON, STEELHEAD, LAMPREY AND STURGEON  FALL SPAWNING FLOWS ARE INADEQUATE TO MAINTAIN GOOD WATER QUALITY AND TO SAFELY GUIDE THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF FISHING OPPORTUNITIES AND FISH HABITATS IN DELAWARE S FRESHWATER AREAS BY MANAGING INVASIVE AQUATIC PLANTS, ANIMALS, AND ALGAE THAT EFFECT NATIVE SPECIES AND FISH ACCESS  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE MONITORING AS WELL AS CHEMICAL AND MECHANICAL CONTROL OF AQUATIC PLANTS AND ALGAE ON DELAWARE STATE OWNED PONDS  ENTERING REPORTS OF AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES INTO A DATABASE, INVESTIGATING REPORTS, IF WARRANTED, TO TRACK THE OCCURRENCE OF THESE SPECIES AND TO OBTAIN BIOLOGICAL DATA  AND CONDUCTING RESEARCH ON VARIOUS POPULATIONS OF INVASIVE FISH SPECIES TO DETERMINE THEIR EXPANSION AND IMPACT ON NATIVE SPECIES  EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE LIMITED THE EFFECTS OF INVASIVE SPECIES ON NATIVE AQUATIC SPECIES AND IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF RECREATIONAL FISHING IN DELAWARE  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE FISHERIES RESOURCES MANAGERS AND RECREATIONAL ANGLERS  THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROJECT

GUNNISON BEND RESERVOIR IN MILLARD COUNTY UTAH CONTINUES TO SEE INCREASED GROWTH IN BOATING AND PRESSURE ON ITS AGING BOATING ACCESS INFRASTRUCTURE  THE EXISTING FLUSH RESTROOM BUILDING WAS BUILT IN THE 1960 S  THIS RESTROOM DOES NOT MEET ADA CODE AND REQUIRES FREQUENT MAINTENANCE DUE TO ITS INABILITY TO HANDLE THE AMOUNT OF USE IT ALREADY RECEIVES  THE PROPOSED PROJECT WOULD INVOLVE REMOVAL OF THE OLD RESTROOM AND CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW ADA ACCESSIBLE RESTROOM ON THE EXISTING RESTROOM FOOTPRINT  THE NEW RESTROOM WILL BE BUILT WITH MORE STALLS AND A LARGER SEPTIC SYSTEM TO HANDLE INCREASED FUTURE DEMANDS  PROVIDING BOATERS THAT USE THIS FACILITY WITH ACCESS TO A MODERN FLUSH RESTROOMWILL PROVIDE THEM WITH A BETTER OVERALL BOATING EXPERIENCE  ADDITIONALLY, INSTALLATION OF A NEW RESTROOM WILL REDUCE MAINTENANCE NEEDS THROUGHOUT THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE INSTALL

THE UPPER ROGUE RIVER BASIN SPRING CHINOOK INVENTORY PROJECT PROVIDES THE ONLY ESTIMATE OF ABUNDANCE FOR SPRING CHINOOK SALMON IN THE ROGUE RIVER  THE PROJECT FUNDS SURVEYS OF SPAWNED OUT CARCASSES COUNTED BETWEEN SEPTEMBER 1 AND NOVEMBER 15 OF EACH YEAR IN THE SPAWNING HABITAT THAT REMAINS BELOW WILLIAM JESS DAM AND LOST CREEK RESERVOIR  HISTORICALLY ROGUE SPRING CHINOOK WERE COUNTED AS THEY PASSED GOLD RAY DAM  THE ABILITY TO MONITOR NATURALLY PRODUCED SPRING CHINOOK SALMON CHANGED SIGNIFICANTLY WITH THE REMOVAL OF GOLD RAY DAM IN 2010 AND THE ALLIED LOSS OF THE FISH COUNTING STATION  BEGINNING IN 2011, ALL MONITORING HAS BEEN BASED ON COUNTS OF SPRING CHINOOK SALMON CARCASSES FOUND  1  IN THE ROGUE RIVER BETWEEN COLE M  RIVERS HATCHERY AND THE HISTORICAL POOL UPSTREAM OF GOLD RAY DAM AND  2  IN THE LOWER MILE OF BIG BUTTE CREEK  THESE LOCATIONS ARE THE PRIMARY SPAWNING AREAS OF NATURALLY PRODUCED SPRING CHINOOK SALMON IN THE ROGUE RIVER BASIN  ODFW USES RESULTS FROM THE SPAWNER SURVEYS TO HINDCAST THE NUMBER OF NATURALLY PRODUCED SPRING CHINOOK SALMON THAT WOULD HAVE PASSED GOLD RAY DAM IN EACH YEAR  HAD NOT THE DAM AND FISH COUNTING STATION BEEN REMOVED  DURINGTHE 2004 2010 SURVEYS OF FISH THAT SPAWNED IN SEPTEMBER, CARCASS COUNTS OF NATURALLY PRODUCED FISH AVERAGED 15   95  CONFIDENCE INTERVAL    2   OF THE NUMBER OF LIVE COUNTERPARTS THAT PASSED GOLD RAY DAM  THIS RELATIONSHIP WILL BE USED TO ESTIMATE THE NUMBER OF LIVE FISH THAT PASSED THE HISTORICAL SITE OF GOLD RAY DAM, UNTIL SOME BETTER ESTIMATION METHODS CAN BE DEVELOPED THROUGH FUTURE ANALYSES OR RESEARCH  ODFW IS EXPLORING THE USE OF JAWTAGS ON CARCASSES AND SUBSEQUENT RECOVERY DURING THE CARCASS SURVEY AS AN ALTERNATIVE METHOD TO ESTIMATE AND TRACK ABUNDANCE OVER TIME THE DATA COLLECTED DURING THIS PROJECT ARE USED BY ODFW TO TRACK THE HEALTH OF THE POPULATION AGAINST OBJECTIVES OUTLINED IN THE ROGUE RIVER SPRING CHINOOK CONSERVATION PLAN  MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES FOR THE DESIRED STATUS OF THE POPULATION, AND MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES THAT TRIGGER CONSERVATION CONCERN  THE PROJECT ALSO MONITORS PHOS RELATIVE TO STATUS METRICS IN THE PLAN
