THE NC WILDLIFE RESOURCES COMMISSION HAS A NEED FOR COORDINATION OF GRANT MANAGEMENT PROCESSES AND MAINTENANCE OF OUR SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROGRAM ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. NORTH CAROLINA IS APPORTIONED APPROXIMATELY $8,000,000 EACH YEAR UNDER THE DINGELL-JOHNSON SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT. THESE FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE WILDLIFE AND SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROGRAM (WSFR)OF THE U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE AND USED BY THE STATE THROUGH APPROVED GRANT AGREEMENTS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS.APPROVED PROJECTS MUST HAVE AS THEIR OBJECTIVE THE RESTORATION, CONSERVATION, MANAGEMENT, OR ENHANCEMENT OF SPORT FISH, OR PROVIDE FOR PUBLIC USE AND BENEFIT FROM THESE RESOURCES. THE USE OF THESE FUNDS THROUGH NUMEROUS AND VARIED GRANT AGREEMENTS REQUIRES CONSIDERABLE COORDINATION AND ADMINISTRATION, FROM THE APPLICATION PROCESS THROUGH POST-CLOSEOUT.TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY FOR THE PROGRAMS, THE COMMISSION MUST ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN MANAGEMENT CONTROL SYSTEMS ADEQUATE TO MEET REQUIREMENTS FOR PARTICIPATION IN THESE FEDERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AND MUST COMPLY WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL LAWS AND REGULATIONS.TO RESPONSIBLY COORDINATE AND ADMINISTER THE SPORT FISH RESTORATION FUNDS FOR NORTH CAROLINA

FISH RESEARCH FINDINGS WILL ASSIST MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL IN MORE FULLY UNDERSTANDING THE ECOLOGY OF AQUATIC SPECIES. METHODS TO IMPROVE FISHERIES HABITATS AND INCREASE SPECIES DIVERSITY AND ABUNDANCE WILL ALSO BE IDENTIFIED THOUGH RESEARCH EFFORTS. IMPLEMENTATION OF NEW AND IMPROVED TECHNIQUES WILL AID MANAGEMENT BY IMPROVING MONITORING OF FISH POPULATIONS AND THEREFORE, ALLOW SOUND MANAGEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS TO BE MADE.

THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT NEBRASKA'S AQUATIC RESOURCES BY PROVIDING NGPC FISHERIES STAFF THE ABILITY TO COLLECT ANDINTERPRET SCIENTIFIC DATA, FACILITATING APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES TO ENHANCE SPORT FISH POPULATIONSAND THEIR HABITATS LONG TERM. THE ANGLING PUBLIC WILL DIRECTLY REAP THE BENEFITS OF IMPROVING FISHERIES FOR LONGTERMSUSTAINABILITY AND ULTIMATELY LOCAL ECONOMIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE POTENTIAL OF INCREASED FISHING ACTIVITYPROMPTING MORE TRAVEL AND RECREATION-RELATED EXPENDITURES. IN ADDITION TO FISHERIES AND FISHING-RELATEDBENEFITS, MANAGEMENT ACTIONS THAT ULTIMATELY IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND AQUATIC HABITAT CONDITIONS GREATLYBENEFIT A NUMBER OF WILDLIFE SPECIES AND CAN PROVIDE EXTENSIVE ECOSYSTEM ENHANCEMENTS PROMOTING MULTIUSEPURPOSES AT NEBRASKA'S PUBLIC WATERS.

THE GOAL OF THIS STUDY IS TO CONTINUE THE DIRECT ENGAGEMENT OF VOLUNTEER ANGLERS IN THE COOPERATIVE TAG-RELEASE OF COBIA, TRIPLETAIL, SPOTTED SEATROUT AND RED DRUM IN ORDER TO DESCRIBE THE SEASONAL MOVEMENTS AND MIGRATORY PATTERNS OF THESE HIGHLY VALUED SPORT FISHES. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES TO MEET THIS GOAL INCLUDE: RECRUITING VOLUNTEER ANGLERS TO JOIN THE PROJECT'S EXISTING PARTICIPANTS, TAG-RELEASE COBIA AND TRIPLETAIL IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS AND THE ADJACENT GULF OF MEXICO, TAG-RELEASE SPOTTED SEATROUT (E13 INCHES IN TOTAL LENGTH) AND RED DRUM (13-30 INCHES IN TOTAL LENGTH) IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS ONLY, ANALYZE TAG-RELEASE DATA FOR THE FOUR SPECIES LISTED, AND PREPARE AND SUBMIT THE ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REPORT.RECOGNIZING THAT ANGLING EFFORT VARIES INTER-ANNUALLY BASED ON A NUMBER OF FACTORS (E.G., WEATHER CONDITIONS, FUEL PRICES, UNANTICIPATED ENVIRONMENTAL AND ECONOMIC ISSUES, AND THE RECENT COVID SITUATION), DEFINING RIGID EXPECTED RESULTS FOR THIS STUDY ARE NOT ALWAYS SO STRAIGHT-FORWARD, HOWEVER, WE PROPOSE TO DIRECT AND COORDINATE EFFORTS BY LOCAL AND REGIONAL VOLUNTEER ANGLERS TO TAG AND RELEASE UP TO 1,000 TRIPLETAIL, 600 COBIA, 600 SPOTTED SEATROUT AND 600 RED DRUM DURING THE PROJECT PERIOD.THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SCIENTIFIC INFORMATION ON THE SEASONAL MOVEMENTS AND MIGRATORY PATTERNS OF THESE FOUR FISH SPECIES THAT SUPPORT MISSISSIPPI'S ECONOMICALLY IMPORTANT SALTWATER RECREATIONAL FISHERY. SCIENTIFIC INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THIS RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF MARINE RESOURCES IN THE ASSESSMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF MISSISSIPPI'S MARINE FISHERIES RESOURCES AND SERVE TO INFORM OTHER MARINE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AGENCIES HAVING SCIENTIFIC INTEREST IN THESE FISHES. THE RECREATIONAL FISHING COMMUNITY THAT TARGETS THESE FOUR SPECIES IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE CFRD COLLABORATIVE SPORT FISH TAG-RELEASE RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT FROM STUDY RESULTS AS WELL.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE BOATING ACCESS PROGRAM MANAGER AND AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL TO COORDINATE MULTIPLE BOATING ACCESS PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE EXISTING FACILITIES AND/OR CONSTRUCT NEW INFRASTRUCTURE FOR THE RECREATIONAL BOATING PUBLIC. THE DEVELOPMENT AND COORDINATION OF SUCH PROJECTS IS NECESSARY TO FULFILL THE NEVADA DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE'S OBLIGATION TO PROVIDE PUBLIC BOATING ACCESS, AND TO MAINTAIN OUR ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE WILDLIFE AND SPORTFISH RESTORATION PROGRAM.

NEVADA PLAYS A PIVOTAL ROLE IN PREVENTING WIDESPREAD IMPACTS FROM SOME OF THE MOST DAMAGING AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES (AIS) AFFECTING THE WESTERN UNITED STATES. AIS CAN HARM NEVADA'S WATERS, DESTROY ECONOMIES, RESTRICT RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, RESULT IN LOSS OF PROPERTY VALUES AND THREATEN PUBLIC HEALTH. IF QUAGGA AND/OR ZEBRA MUSSELS INVADE THE COLUMBIA RIVER, THEY COULD COST HYDROELECTRIC FACILITIES ALONE UP TO $250 - 300 MILLION ANNUALLY. IN 2007, WHEN QUAGGA MUSSELS WERE DETECTED AT LAKE MEAD NATIONAL RECREATION AREA (LMNRA) AND THE COLORADO RIVER SYSTEM, WESTERN STATES REALIZED THEIR FRESHWATER RESOURCES WERE AT RISK. IN 2011, QUAGGA MUSSEL VELIGERS WERE DETECTED IN RYE PATCH AND LAHONTAN RESERVOIRS IN NORTHERN NEVADA. ALTHOUGH UNSUCCESSFUL AT ESTABLISHING POPULATIONS, THE PRESENCE OF VELIGERS AT THE TWO RESERVOIRS ILLUSTRATED THE NEED FOR QUAGGA MUSSEL PREVENTION AND CONTAINMENT ACTIVITIES TO BE IMPLEMENTED. AN AGREEMENT WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) FUNDS FOUR PERMANENT WATERCRAFT INSPECTION AND DECONTAMINATION (WID) STATIONS THAT INSPECT AND DECONTAMINATE VESSELS LEAVING LMNRA.THROUGH THIS PROJECT THE NEVADA DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE (NDOW) PROVIDES NO-CHARGE WID AT TWO HIGH USE RESERVOIRS IN NORTHERN NEVADA, RYE PATCH AND SOUTH FORK RESERVOIRS. A THIRD ROVER STATION PRIMARILY SERVICES TOPAZ LAKE BUT WILL ALSO BE PRESENT AT SPARKS MARINA FOR SPECIAL EVENTS. ADDITIONALLY, NDOW OPERATES TWO ROADSIDE WID STATIONS, ONE IN ALAMO, NEVADA ON U.S. HWY. 93 AND ONE NORTH OF ELKO, NEVADA AT THE INTERSECTION OF STATE ROUTE 225 AND STATE ROUTE 226. THE ROLE OF THE ROADSIDE WID STATIONS IS TO INTERCEPT ANY NORTHBOUND QUAGGA INFESTED VESSELS THAT MAY HAVE BEEN MISSED BY WID STATIONS AT LMNRA. THE STATION NORTH OF ELKO ALSO INTERCEPTS VESSELS ON THEIR WAY TO WILDHORSE AND WILSON RESERVOIRS.ADDITIONAL STATIONS ARE PRESENT AT LAHONTAN RESERVOIR NEAR FALLON, NEVADA AND ON THE COLORADO RIVER NEAR LAUGHLIN, NEVADA AND ARE FUNDING THROUGH AN AGREEMENT WITH BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (BOR).DURING EVERY BOATER CONTACT NDOW PERSONNEL DISTRIBUTE EDUCATIONAL EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND EXPLAINS THE RISK OF AIS AND THE NEED FOR THE CLEAN, DRAIN, DRY (CDD) METHODOLOGY. THIS IS IN ADDITION TO ONGOING EDUCATIONAL CAMPAIGNS THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THESE CAMPAIGNS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TOO, ATTENDING BOATING, FISHING AND OUTDOOR EVENTS TO COMMUNICATE WITH BOATERS AND OTHER OUTDOOR ENTHUSIAST TO SPREAD THE NEED TO PROTECT NEVADA'S WATERWAYS FROM AIS. NDOW STAFF WILL FOLLOW ALL COVID-19 SAFETY GUIDELINES WHILE ATTENDING PUBLIC EVENTS AND SPEAKING WITH MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC.

THE SHEPHERD LAKE ACCESS SITE IS LOCATED IN BONNER COUNTY, IDAHO APPROXIMATELY THREE MILES FROMSAGLE, IDAHO IN IDAHO'S PANHANDLE REGION. IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME, UTILIZING SPORT FISHRESTORATION FUNDING, ACQUIRED THE SHEPHERD LAKE PROPERTY IN 1955 FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING PUBLICACCESS TO THE LAKE. DUE TO A CONTINUING INCREASE IN USE AT THE SITE, THE DEPARTMENT WILL IMPROVE THE AREAUTILIZING SPORT FISH RESTORATION (BOATING ACCESS) FUNDS. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES WIDENING THE EXISTING ENTRANCE OF THE ACCESS SITE ROAD FROM TALACHE ROAD AND IMPROVING THE INITIAL 250 FT +/- OF THE ACCESS ROAD; REPLACING A DAMAGED CULVERT; EXPANDING THE EXISTING PARKING AREA; REMOVING THE EXISTING WOOD STRUCTURE RESTROOM ANDREPLACING IT WITH A VAULT RESTROOM; AND INSTALLATION OF A NEW ADA PARKING PAD. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP SATISFY A PORTION OF THE CURRENT AND ANTICIPATED FUTURE (15-20 YEAR) DEMAND FOR IMPROVED ADA COMPLIANT FACILITIES AND A SAFER,MORE USER FRIENDLY ACCESS SITE OVERALL.

WE PROPOSE CONTINUATION OF THE ANNUAL SURVEY OF JUVENILE (YOUNG-OF-YEAR) STRIPED BASS IN THE MAJOR VIRGINIA NURSERY AREAS (JAMES, YORK AND RAPPAHANNOCK DRAINAGES) USING THE METHODS AND SAMPLING DESIGN ESTABLISHED BY COLVOCORESSES (1986). TWO REPLICATE SEINE HAULS ARE MADE AT EACH STATION BY DEPLOYING A 100' (30.5M) LONG, 4' (1.22M) DEEP, 1/4" (0.64CM) MESH MINNOW SEINE PERPENDICULAR TO THE SHORELINE AND THEN SWEEPING THE OFFSHORE END ALONG AN ARC DOWN CURRENT AND THEN BACK TO THE BEACH. FISH ARE REMOVED FROM THE NET AND PLACED IN WATER-FILLED BUCKETS. ALL FISH ARE IDENTIFIED AND COUNTED; ALL STRIPED BASS AND ALL INDIVIDUALS (OR A SUBSAMPLE OF AT LEAST 25 INDIVIDUALS) OF OTHER SPECIES ARE MEASURED TO THE NEAREST MM FORK LENGTH (OR TOTAL LENGTH IF APPROPRIATE). FISH TAKEN DURING THE FIRST HAUL ARE HELD UNTIL THE SECOND HAUL IS COMPLETED. SALINITY, AIR AND WATER TEMPERATURES, AND DISSOLVED OXYGEN CONCENTRATIONS ARE MEASURED AFTER THE FIRST SEINE HAUL USING A YSI WATER-QUALITY INSTRUMENT. SAMPLING TIME, TIDAL STAGE, AND WEATHER CONDITIONS ARE RECORDED AT THE TIME OF EACH HAUL. ALL FISHES CAPTURED ARE RETURNED TO THE WATER AT THE CONCLUSION OF SAMPLING, EXCEPT THAT A FEW MAY BE PRESERVED FOR LIFE HISTORY STUDIES (DAILY GROWTH, FOOD HABITS, CONDITION, ETC.). THE PRESENT STUDY WILL INSURE THAT STRIPED BASS RECRUITMENT IS ASSESSED IN ALL THE MAJOR SPAWNING AND NURSERY AREAS OF THE VIRGINIA TRIBUTARIES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY. IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING CONTINUITY OF THE HISTORICAL RECORD OF RELATIVE ABUNDANCE OF YOUNG-OF-YEAR STRIPED BASS IN VIRGINIA WATERS, THIS SURVEY ALSO PROVIDES A VALUABLE TOOL FOR ASSESSING THE SUCCESS OF PRESENT MANAGEMENT MEASURES. THE STANDARDIZATION OF METHODOLOGY WITH THE MARYLAND SURVEY HAS ALLOWED RESULTS OF THIS SURVEY TO BECOME INCORPORATED INTO A BAY-WIDE INDEX OF STRIPED BASS RECRUITMENT. CONSEQUENTLY, THE VIRGINIA INDEX IS A KEY ELEMENT IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE STOCK. THE SURVEY ALSO PROVIDES A VALUABLE MEASURE FOR THE STUDY OF STOCK/RECRUITMENT RELATIONSHIPS (THROUGH COMPARISONS WITH EGG/LARVAL AND ADULT SPAWNING STOCK ASSESSMENTS) AND A PRIMARY SOURCE OF DATA AND SPECIMENS FOR CONCURRENT INVESTIGATIONS OF THE EARLY LIFE HISTORY OF THE SPECIES.

THIS GRANT AND SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS OBLIGATE 15% OF WYOMING'S SPORT FISH RESTORATION APPORTIONMENTS FORIMPLEMENTATION AND OPERATION OF IT'S COMPREHENSIVE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM AS DEFINED IN 50 CFR 80.2 AND 50 CFR80.81. THIS GRANT IS SPECIFIC TO BOATING ACCESS PROJECTS. WYOMING'S LAKES AND RESERVOIRS NEED NEW, UPDATED ANDPROPERLY MAINTAINED MOTORBOAT ACCESS RAMPS, DOCKS, PARKING AREAS, CONVENIENCE STATIONS, AND SAFETY FEATURES ASWELL AS OTHER ITEMS TO MAXIMIZE THE ACCESS AND SAFE USE OF THESE FACILITIES BY BOATING ENTHUSIASTS. ALL OF WYOMING'S BOATING ACCESS FACILITIES REQUIRE CONTINUED MAINTENANCE TO ENSURE THEIR SAFE OPERATION FORRECREATIONAL USERS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO OBLIGATE FUNDS FOR THE PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2022, THROUGH JUNE 30, 2023, FOR SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF GAME, FISH AND PARKS (SDGFP) HATCHERY OPERATIONS, MAINTENANCE, AND DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES.

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SCIENTIFIC INFORMATION NECESSARY FOR THE SOUND MANAGEMENT OF SELECTED RECREATIONAL SPECIES OCCUPYING MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS AND TO AUGMENT EXISTING SAMPLES NECESSARY FOR THE DETERMINATION OF LENGTH-AT-AGE RELATIONSHIPS OF SELECTED SPORT FISH IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES TO FULFILL IDENTIFIED NEEDS ARE:1) ASSESS AND MONITOR THE POPULATION OF SPORT FISH IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS USING PROTOCOLS ESTABLISHED IN PREVIOUSLY COMPLETED WORK.2) ASSESS MOVEMENT PATTERNS OF SOUTHERN FLOUNDER IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS TO HELP ELUCIDATE THE SPAWNING MIGRATION PATHWAYS AND HABITAT USE.3) ASSESS THE SUCCESS OF ELECTROFISHING GEAR IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS AS A MEANS OF COLLECTING TARGET FINFISH.BASED ON THE APPROACH IDENTIFIED HEREIN, WE EXPECT TO:" SAMPLE EIGHT INSHORE GILLNET STATIONS IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS ON A MONTHLY BASIS, FOR A TOTAL OF 160 STATIONS DURING THE PROJECT PERIOD;" SAMPLE TWO OFFSHORE GILLNET STATIONS IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS ON A SEASONAL BASIS (MARCH THROUGH OCTOBER), FOR A TOTAL OF 28 STATIONS DURING THE PROJECT PERIOD;" ACOUSTICALLY TAG 30 FLOUNDER WITHIN THE ESTABLISHED ARRAY, DOWNLOAD AND MAINTAIN ARRAY RECEIVERS, AND ASSESS FLOUNDER DETECTIONS TO IDENTIFY BEHAVIOR PATTERNS OR MOVEMENT PATHWAYS." EXAMINE THE EFFICACY OF ELECTROFISHING TO SAMPLE SPORT FISH IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS.THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE THE MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT OF ADULT AND SUB-ADULT FINFISH POPULATIONS IN MISSISSIPPI IN ORDER TO ACQUIRE STANDARDIZED INFORMATION AND PROVIDE FISHERY-INDEPENDENT INDICES OF ABUNDANCE. ADDITIONALLY, THE COLLECTION OF SELECTED SPORT FISH SPECIES IN PROJECT SAMPLING WILL ALLOW FOR THE CONTINUED EVALUATION OF AGE-LENGTH RELATIONSHIPS OF SPECIES IMPORTANT TO THE MISSISSIPPI RECREATIONAL FISHERY (AS IDENTIFIED BY MDMR).BENEFITS OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE 1) TO PROVIDE AN ASSESSMENT OF THE POPULATION DYNAMICS AND AN ANNUAL INDEX OF ABUNDANCE FOR COASTAL SPORT FISH AND OTHER IMPORTANT FISHERY SPECIES IN THOSE SAME WATERS 2) WILL PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE MIGRATIONS, RESIDENCY PATTERNS, AND SURVIVAL OF SOUTHERN FLOUNDER IN ST. LOUIS BAY. DATA PROVIDED BY THIS STUDY WILL ALLOW FOR POPULATION PARAMETER ASSESSMENTS TO BE MADE SPECIFICALLY FOR MISSISSIPPI WATERS. THE FULFILLMENT OF THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS STUDY WILL HELP PROVIDE FOR MORE EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF MISSISSIPPI'S MARINE FINFISH RESOURCES AND WILL BE USED IN FUTURE STOCK ASSESSMENTS, WHICH IN TURN WILL PROVIDE OPTIMUM BENEFITS TO STAKEHOLDERS.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO CONSERVE, RESTORE AND ENHANCE THE FISHERIES RESOURCES OF CONNECTICUT THROUGH IMPROVED MANAGEMENT AND RESTORATION OF ESTUARINE AND FRESHWATER HABITATS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REVIEWING PROPOSED PROJECTS THAT MAY IMPACT FISHERIES RESOURCES, REVIEW OF RE-LICENSING OF FEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION (FERC) PROJECTS, REVIEW APPLICATIONS FOR THE RELEASE OF GRASS CARP INTO PONDS, AND FISH KILL INVESTIGATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE MAINTAINING HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE POPULATIONS OF FISHERIES RESOURCES WITHIN BIOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL LIMITS, WHICH SUPPORTS THE BUREAU OF NATURAL RESOURCES' MISSION OF CONSERVATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE NATURAL RESOURCES.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE CONDUCT OF THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE'S (NMFS) MARINE RECREATIONAL INFORMATION PROGRAM (MRIP) ACCESS POINT ANGLER INTERCEPT SURVEY (APAIS). RECREATIONAL ANGLERS THROUGHOUT COASTAL NORTH CAROLINA WILL BE INTERCEPTED AT PUBLIC FISHING ACCESS SITES AND INTERVIEWED TO DETERMINE RECREATIONAL FINFISH CATCH, EFFORT, PARTICIPATION, FISHING MODE, AREA OF FISHING, STATE AND COUNTY OF RESIDENCE, NUMBER OF TRIPS, AND BIOLOGICAL DATA (WEIGHT AND LENGTH BY SPECIES). COLLECTED DATA WILL BE USED TO ASSESS THE HEALTH OF FISH STOCKS AND INFORM APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT MEASURES.

THE SHEM CREEK BOAT LANDING PARKING HAS OUTLIVED ITS USEFUL DESIGN LIFE AND IS IN CRITICAL NEED OF REPLACEMENT. THE AREA IS ALSO EXPERIENCING STORM DRAINAGE ISSUES AS WELL AS LACKING APPROPRIATE ADA ACCESS.THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO RESURFACE THE EXISTING PARKING LOT, IMPROVE THE STORM DRAINAGE SYSTEM AND RECONSTRUCT THE SIDEWALK SYSTEM TO COMPLY WITH ADA

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECREATIONAL BOATING BY RECONSTRUCTION CAVE CREEK DAM. THIS PROJECT IS PART OF A LARGER CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECT ADMINISTERED BY THE NEVADA STATE PUBLIC WORKS DIVISION, AND THIS GRANT WILL HELP FUND A PORTION OF THE RECONSTRUCTION. THE SCOPE OF WORK WILL INCLUDE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION AND INITIAL CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES. THE CONSTRUCTION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES REPLACEMENT OF THE LOW-LEVEL OUTLET, CONSTRUCTION OF A BUTTRESS EMBANKMENT, HEIGHT INCREASE OF THE DAM, SPILLWAY ENLARGEMENT AND ARMORING.COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL MAINTAIN EXISTING BOATING ACCESS FACILITIES AND ALLOW BOATERS TO SAFELY USE THE RESERVOIR FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. LOCAL ECONOMIES ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT FROM INCREASED SALES OF GASOLINE, FOOD, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, AND LODGING.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES THE ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION OF ALL SPORT FISH RESTORATION (SFR) PROJECTS IN OREGON.THIS PROJECT WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PREPARATION AND SUBMISSION OF GRANT APPLICATIONS, ASSISTING FIELD STAFFTO OBTAIN NECESSARY PERMITS FOR GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITIES FROM LOCAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS, AND THE REVIEW ANDEDITING OF PROGRESS REPORTS. THE STAFF FUNDED BY THESE PROJECTS WORK AT A STATEWIDE LEVEL, COORDINATINGMANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, PROVIDING BIOLOGICAL INFORMATION AND MANAGING OREGON'S SPORT FISHERIES. MS - SFR COORDINATION AND ADMINISTRATION IN COASTAL MISSISSIPPI

AMONG THE RESEARCH AGENCIES IN THE BAY REGION, ONLY VIMS HAS A RESEARCH PROGRAM DEALING WITH MULTISPECIES ISSUES AND FOCUSED ON THE ADULT/HARVESTED COMPONENTS FOR THE EXPLOITED FISH SPECIES THAT UTILIZE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY. THE MULTISPECIES RESEARCH GROUP (MRF) AT VIMS IS COMPRISED OF THREE MAIN BRANCHES: FIELD DATA COLLECTION, LABORATORY SAMPLE PROCESSING, AND DATA ANALYSIS/MULTISPECIES MODELING.CHESMMAP WAS INITIATED IN 2002 BY THE VIMS MRG AND IS PROSECUTED IN DIRECT SUPPORT OF SINGLE AND MULTISPECIES MODELING AND MANAGEMENT EFFORTS. IN GENERAL, CHESMMAP IS A BOTTOM TRAWL SURVEY THAT USES A TRAWL NET DESIGNED TO SAMPLE LATE-JUVENILE AND ADULT FISHES IN CHESAPEAKE BAY. THIS SURVEY CURRENTLY PROVIDES DATA ON RELATIVE ABUNDANCE, LENGTH, WEIGHT, SEC RATIO, MATURITY, AGE, AND TROPHIC INTERACTIONS FOR SEVERAL RECREATIONALLY, COMMERCIALLY, AND ECOLOGICALLY IMPORTANT FISHES IN THE BAY.VIMS ACQUISITION IN LATE 2018 OF THE RV VIRGINIA AFFORDS THE OPPORTUNITY TO EXPAND THE TYPES OF SAMPLING CONDUCTED DURING CHESMMAP CRUISES. SPECIFICALLY, ADDITIONAL VESSEL SPACE AND EQUIPMENT ALONG WITH 24-HOUR OPERATIONS PROVIDES THE ABILITY TO COLLECT SYNOPTIC SAMPLES OF THE ENTIRE WATER COLUMN UTILIZING A SUITE OF SAMPLING GEARS. N 2020 CHESMMAP COMMENCED COLLECTING BENTHIC GRANS AT A SUBSET OF STRATIFIED RANDOM LOCATIONS. IN 2021 MRG BEGAN PERFECTING THE CONFIGURATION AS WELL AS THE SETTING AND HAULING PROCEDURES FOR THE MIDWATER TRAWLING GEAR.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT ECOLOGICALLY SOUND, SCIENCE-BASED FISHERIES CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE DATA COLLECTION, RESEARCH AND MONITORING ON THE HEALTH, ABUNDANCE, DISTRIBUTION, AND HARVEST OF FRESHWATER FISHES IN CONNECTICUT AS WELL AS FISH STOCKING AND MINOR REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE OF FISHING AND FISH STOCKING LOCATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE MAINTAINING HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE POPULATIONS OF FISHERIES RESOURCES WITHIN BIOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL LIMITS, WHICH SUPPORTS THE BUREAU OF NATURAL RESOURCES' MISSION OF CONSERVATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE NATURAL RESOURCES. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

F-111-R-19 4/1/2022 TO 3/31/2027THE PROJECT PURPOSE IS TO FACILITATE THE MANAGEMENT, ENHANCEMENT, AND PROTECTION OF VIRGINIA'S FRESHWATER SPORT FISH RESOURCES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: COLLECTION, MANAGEMENT, AND ANALYSIS OF BIOLOGICAL, PHYSICAL, AND CHEMICAL DATA RELATED TO FRESHWATER SPORT FISHES AND THEIR HABITATS; IMPLEMENTATION OF SOCIAL SCIENCE TECHNIQUES (SUCH AS CREEL, POSTAL, OR INTERNET SURVEYS) TO TRACK ANGLER BEHAVIOR, SATISFACTION, AND EXPECTATIONS; DEVELOPMENT AND EVALUATION OF FISHERY AND HABITAT MANAGEMENT PLANS AND STRATEGIES; CONTRIBUTION OF FISHERIES DATA TO ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEWS, RESOURCE EVALUATIONS, REGULATORY PROCEEDINGS*, AND OTHER FORMS OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; IDENTIFICATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF SPECIFIC SPECIES AND/OR HABITAT RESEARCH NEEDED TO ENHANCE THE MANAGEMENT OF SPORT FISHERIES; DISSEMINATION OF AQUATIC RESOURCE AND FISHING INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC VIA DIVERSE MEDIA; AND PLANNING EFFORTS TO ENSURE THE EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF VIRGINIA'S SPORT FISHERIES. *NOTE: SPORT FISH RESTORATION FUNDS ARE NOT USED TO DEVELOP OR ENFORCE REGULATIONS. RATHER, DATA COLLECTED VIA THIS AWARD ARE PROVIDED TO POLICY MAKERS AND LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS SO THEY MAY CONDUCT THEIR WORK WITH THE BEST AVAILABLE INFORMATION.)EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE HEALTHY AND ROBUST POPULATIONS OF SPORT FISH. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE VIRGINIA'S ANGLERS AND OTHERS THAT APPRECIATE THESE RESOURCES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SPECIES-SPECIFIC RESEARCH THAT WILL HELP VDWR MANAGE VIRGINIA'S SPORT FISH RESOURCES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPROVE/CREATE TWO NEW BOATING ACCESS FACILITIES IN KENTUCKY. THE FIRST PROJECT INVOLVES THE CONSTRUCTION OF A COURTESY DOCK AT AN EXISTING RAMP ON THE LITTLE SANDY RIVER IN GREENUP COUNTY, KENTUCKY. THE SECOND PROJECT IS THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW BOAT RAMP AND ASSOCIATED PARKING (10-12 VEHICLES/TRAILERS) ON THE POND RIVER IN HOPKINS COUNTY, KENTUCKY. THIS NEW RAMP IS WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE HARRIS-DICKERSON WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT AREA.

THE SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACT (SFRA), AQUATIC EDUCATION RESOURCE PROGRAM, GEORGE H. W. BUSH EDUCATION FUND, VAMOS A PESCAR GRANT PROVIDES MULTIPLE OPPORTUNITIES TO EDUCATE YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES TO PARTICIPATE AS ANGLERS AND PROMOTE GOOD STEWARDSHIP TOWARD THE STATE'S AQUATIC RESOURCES, INCLUDING MULTIPLE HANDS-ON FISHING SKILLS DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES. WHILE MOST OF PARTICIPATING FAMILIES WILL BE HISPANIC, THE PROGRAMS WILL BE OPEN TO FAMILIES OF ALL RACES/ETHNICITIES
FL - REPRODUCTIVE RESILIENCE AND MOVEMENT ECOLOGY OF FLORIDA SPORT FISHES

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND STATEWIDE INSPECTIONS, TRAINING, AND ROUTINE MAINTENANCE ON DAMS OWNED AND OR MANAGED BY THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF GAME, FISH AND PARKS WHICH WILL ALLOW THE DEPARTMENT TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE IMPORTANT FISHERIES AND ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THOSE FISHING SITES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THE GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE ROUTINE MAINTENANCE AND FUTURE CYCLICAL MAINTENANCE OF 76 SMALL DAMS TO INCLUDE VEGETATION MANAGEMENT AND MINOR REPAIRS TO DAM STRUCTURES. THE DEPARTMENT EXPECTS THE PROPOSED PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES TO EXTEND THE LIFE OF MOST OF THE DAM STRUCTURES BY AT LEAST 20 YEARS. MAINTAINING THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF SMALL DAMS WILL BENEFIT THE PRODUCTION OF FISH, WILDLIFE, AND RECREATION THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
MS - ASSESSMENT OF SPORT FISH SPECIES IN MISSISSIPPI COASTAL WATERS

DURING THIS SEGMENT (2022-2023) THE PROJECT WILL MAINLY FOCUS ON PROTECTING, RESTORING, ENHANCING AND CREATING HABITATS FOR THE FISH SPECIES TARGETED BY RECREATIONAL ANGLERS.TO CREATE FISH HABITATS, ARTIFICIAL REEF STRUCTURES WILL BE DEPLOYED IN AREAS LACKING HABITAT (BARREN), BUT WITH POTENTIAL FOR CORAL RECRUITMENT. THIS WILL PROVIDE THE NECESSARY HABITAT STRUCTURE FOR CORAL TO SETTLE, SURVIVE AND TO THRIVE.

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND STATEWIDE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE AND FUTURE DEVELOPMENT OF FISHING ACCESS AREAS OWNED AND OR MANAGED BY THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF GAME, FISH AND PARKS WHICH WILL PROVIDE NEW SERVICES, IMPROVE USABILITY, AND ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THOSE FISHING ACCESS SITES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF EIGHTY-FOUR PUBLIC ACCESS RECREATIONAL FISHING FACILITIES TO INCLUDE FISHING PIERS/PLATFORMS, PARKING AREAS, RESTROOMS, FISH CLEANING STATIONS, ROADS, AND TRAILS TO ACCESS THE FISHING FACILITIES. IMPROVED AND MAINTAINED FISHING ACCESS WILL BENEFIT ALL TYPES OF ANGLERS AS WELL AS PROVIDING ACCESS FOR FAMILY-ORIENTED WATER RECREATIONAL SPORTS. AREAS THAT ARE MAINTAINED, THROUGH WRITTEN AGREEMENTS BY OTHER ENTITIES; SUCH AS MUNICIPALITIES, LAKE ASSOCIATIONS, ETC. WILL BE VISITED BY SUPERVISORY STAFF A MINIMUM OF THREE TIMES PER YEAR IN ADDITION TO THE SITE VISITS PROVIDED BY THE COOPERATOR. THESE PERIODIC SITE VISITS ARE NEEDED TO INSPECT THE OVERALL CONDITION OF THE DEPARTMENT FACILITIES, SIGNING, AND COOPERATOR PERFORMANCE.

TO PLAN AND COORDINATE GRANT ADMINISTRATION FOR ALL WILDLIFE AND SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROGRAMS AND STATE WILDLIFE GRANT PROGRAMS. TO PREPARE AND DISTRIBUTE INFORMATION TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND MEDIA WHICH HIGHLIGHTS THE WORK BEING ACCOMPLISHED IN CONNECTICUT WITH WILDLIFE AND SPORT FISH RESTORATION PROGRAM FUNDING; PROVIDE GRANT ADMINISTRATION OF NATIONAL AND REGIONAL COOPERATIVE GRANTS AND SURVEYS.

THERE IS A NEED FOR SAFE, ACCESSIBLE, AND FUNCTIONAL BOATING FACILITIES IN ARIZONA. SHOW LOW LAKE BOATING FACILITY NEEDS ACCESSIBLE ACCESS FROM THE PARKING AREA TO THE BOAT LAUNCH AND COURTESY DOCK. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW ACCESS THE LAKE FOR THOSE WITH LIMITED MOBILITY. CONSTRUCTING ADA COMPLIANT PARKING SPACES IN THE PARKING LOT WITH AN ADA COMPLIANT SIDEWALK TO CONNECT THE PARKING LOT TO THE RECREATION AREA WILL PROVIDE GREATER ACCESS FOR ALL TO UTILIZE TO THE LAKE.

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND STATEWIDE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE AND FUTURE DEVELOPMENT OF FISHING ACCESS AREAS OWNED AND OR MANAGED BY THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF GAME, FISH AND PARKS WHICH WILL PROVIDE NEW SERVICES, IMPROVE USABILITY, AND ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THOSE FISHING ACCESS SITES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF 229 PUBLIC ACCESS RECREATIONAL BOATING FACILITIES TO INCLUDE BOAT DOCKS, LAUNCH RAMPS, PARKING AREAS, RESTROOMS, FISH CLEANING STATIONS, ROADS, AND TRAILS TO ACCESS BOATING FACILITIES. IMPROVED AND MAINTAINED FISHING ACCESS WILL BENEFIT ALL TYPES OF ANGLERS AS WELL AS PROVIDING ACCESS FOR FAMILY-ORIENTED WATER RECREATIONAL SPORTS. AREAS THAT ARE MAINTAINED, THROUGH WRITTEN AGREEMENTS BY OTHER ENTITIES; SUCH AS MUNICIPALITIES, LAKE ASSOCIATIONS, ETC. WILL BE VISITED BY SUPERVISORY STAFF A MINIMUM OF THREE TIMES PER YEAR IN ADDITION TO THE SITE VISITS PROVIDED BY THE COOPERATOR. THESE PERIODIC SITE VISITS ARE NEEDED TO INSPECT THE OVERALL CONDITION OF THE DEPARTMENT FACILITIES, SINGING, AND COOPERATOR PERFORMANCE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE'S FISHERIES DISTRICT MANAGEMENT EFFORTS THROUGHOUT THE STATE. A TOTAL OF SEVEN FISHERIES DISTRICTS AND TWO HATCHERIES/TRANSPORTATION SECTIONS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THIS FUNDING. ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE DISTRICT FISH MANAGEMENT SAMPLING/TECHNICAL GUIDANCE/COORDINATION, FISH PROPAGATION AND STOCKING, AND ROUTINE MAINTENANCE OF THE DISTRICT OFFICES AND HATCHERY BUILDINGS/GROUNDS.

THIS GRANT SUPPORTS THE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF RHODE ISLAND'S FOUR FISH HATCHERIES. ADDITIONALLY, THIS GRANT SUPPORTS THE FISH HUSBANDRY THAT OCCURS WITHIN THE HATCHERIES AND SUPPORTS THE REARING AND STOCKING OF OVER 100,000 FISH PER YEAR THROUGH OUT THE STATE FOR A PUT-AND-TAKE FRESHWATER FISHERY. THE FISH SPECIES INCLUDE BROWN TROUT, BROOK TROUT, RAINBOW TROUT, GOLDEN RAINBOW TROUT, NORTHERN PIKE AND HYBRID TIGER TROUT.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF WV AQUATIC RESOURCES THROUGH DIGITAL MAPPING AND OUTREACHEFFORTS. BUILDING ON PAST SUCCESSFUL LAKE DEPTH (55 IMPOUNDMENTS COMPLETED) AND FISH HABITAT ENHANCEMENT MAPPINGAND OUTREACH EFFORTS, THIS PROJECT WILL MAP STONEWALL JACKSON LAKE. SPECIFICALLY, THE ENTIRE SHORELINE OF THELAKE WILL BE NAVIGATED TO OBTAIN DEPTH DATA FROM NEAR-SHORE AREAS. MAPPING WILL BE CONDUCTED DOWN THE LEFTCENTER,CENTER, AND RIGHT-CENTER OF THE MAIN BODY OF THE LAKE AND MAJOR COVES. THESE VARIOUS TRANSECT PATHS WILLPROVIDE REPRESENTATIVE DEPTH DATA TO CREATE MAPS FOR THE LAKE.THE BATHYMETRY AND HABITAT ENHANCEMENT LAYERS WILL BE FURTHER PROCESSED IN GIS SOFTWARE TO CREATE VISUALLYAPPEALING SYMBOLOGY AND PDF MAP LAYOUTS. THE LAYERS WILL BE ADDED TO THE WV INTERACTIVE FISHING MAP, PROFESSIONALPDF MAP LAYOUTS, ADDED TO AVENZA MAPS AND BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR DOWNLOAD FROM THE WVDNR WEBSITE.ADDITIONALLY, ANGLERS WILL BE EDUCATED ON THE USE OF THE DIGITAL MAPPING TECHNOLOGIES THAT WILL ENHANCE THEIRENJOYMENT, KNOWLEDGE, AND SAFETY WHILE PARTICIPATING IN ASSOCIATED RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SPORT FISHING AND RECREATIONAL BOATING ON ANNABESSACOOK LAKE THROUGH THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW WATER ACCESS FACILITY ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF INLAND FISHERIES AND WILDLIFE. THE FACILITY WILL INCLUDE AN ACCESS ROAD, PAVED PARKING AREA, ADA COMPLIANT PATHWAY, CONCRETE PLANK RAMP, AND FLOAT SYSTEM.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS ANNUAL GRANT IS TO IMPROVE FISH HABITAT WITHIN KENTUCKY'S LAKES, PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION FOR THE FISHING-IN-THE-NEIGHBORHOODS (FINS) PROGRAMS, AND SUPPORT THE STREAMS INVESTIGATIONS PROGRAM ALL WITHIN THE FISHERIES DIVISION OF THE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PLACEMENT OF FISH HABITAT STRUCTURES, SAMPLING AND PROGRAM OVERSIGHT OF URBAN FISHERIES (FINS), AND SAMPLING OF VARIOUS SPORTFISH POPULATIONS WITHIN WARMWATER STREAMS IN KENTUCKY.
SC - CASHUA FERRY LANDING REHABILITATION - DARLINGTON COUNTY

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FISH & WILDLIFE (CDFW) AQUATIC RESOURCE EDUCATION PROGRAM (AE) IS ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE OFFICE OF COMMUNICATIONS, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH. AE IS DIVIDED INTO FOUR PROJECTS: CONSERVATION EDUCATION, CLASSROOM AQUARIUM EDUCATION PROGRAM (CAEP), FISHING-IN-THE-CITY (FIC) AND INTERPRETIVE SERVICES.  THESE PROGRAMS WORK TOGETHER TO ACCOMPLISH THE OVERALL GOALS AND MISSION OF THE DEPARTMENT. CDFW'S AE PROGRAM BROADENS PUBLIC AWARENESS, ENCOURAGES EDUCATORS TO INCLUDE CONSERVATION EDUCATION TOPICS INTO THEIR INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS AND CREATE STEWARDS OF CALIFORNIA'S VITAL AQUATIC ECOSYSTEMS. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY PROMOTING BOTH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERSHIPS IN EDUCATION, RECREATION AND CONSERVATION. THE AE PROGRAM PROVIDES THE DEPARTMENT WITH A CRITICAL TOOL THAT PROMOTES THE WISE USE AND ENJOYMENT OF CALIFORNIA'S AQUATIC NATURAL RESOURCES.

ODFW WILL USE USFWS SPORT FISH RESTORATION FUNDS TO SUBGRANT CLACKAMAS COUNTY TO REPLACE DOCKS AND CANTILEVER CONNECTION AT BOONE'S FERRY BOAT RAMP ON THE WILLAMETTE RIVER. THE COUNTY WILL HANDLE ALL ADMINISTRATION, CONTRACTING, PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, AND CONSTRUCTION TO REMOVE AND DISPOSE OF OLD DOCKS AND REPLACE WITH NEW ALUMINUM DOCKS.

ODFW WILL USE USFWS SPORT FISH RESTORATION FUNDS TO SUB GRANT CITY OF WEST LINN TO UPGRADE AND MAINTAIN THE PARKING LOT AT CEDAROAK BOAT RAMP ON THE WILLAMETTE RIVER. CITY OF WEST LINN WILL HANDLE ALL ADMINISTRATION, CONTRACTING, PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, AND CONSTRUCTION TO REPLACE THE BROKEN EXTRUDED CURBING WITH CAST IN PLACE CURB, OVERLAY ASPHALT, INSTALL SEASONALLY REMOVABLE BOLLARD SYSTEM TO CHANGE TRAILER VS SINGLE CAR PARKING AS NEEDED FOR BOAT USE, AND RESTRIPE THE PARKING LOT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SPORT FISHING AND RECREATIONAL BOATING ON LONG POND THROUGH THE RECONSTRUCTION OF THE WATER ACCESS FACILITY ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF INLAND FISHERIES AND WILDLIFE. THE FACILITY WILL INCLUDE AN ACCESS ROAD, PAVED PARKING AREA, CONCRETE PLANK RAMP, AND FLOAT SYSTEM.

MARYLAND DNR PARTNERS WITH NATIONAL PARK SERVICE - C&O CANAL NHP TO RENOVATE AND IMPROVE FOUR LOCKS BOATING ACCESS FACILITY. THE PROPOSED CONSTRUCTION PLANS PROVIDE FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK THAT COMPLIES WITH ABAAS STANDARDS BETWEEN THE EXISTING PARKING AREA AND A NEW FLOATING BOAT DOCK. THE BOAT DOCK WILL BE ANCHORED TO THE SHORELINE USING THREE CONCRETE BULKHEADS, EACH WITH A SERIES OF STRONG ARM SUPPORTS. THE EXISTING BOAT RAMP WILL BE DEMOLISHED ALONG THE LOWER EXTENT AND REPLACED WITH AN ARTICULATED CONCRETE BLOCK WEARING SURFACE. THE NEW RAMP SURFACE WILL BE SECURED IN PLACE USING RIP RAP. TWO STAIRWELLS WILL PROVIDE ACCESS BETWEEN THE BOAT RAMP AND THE BOAT DOCK. WHILE RAILINGS WILL BE PROVIDED ALONG THE STAIRS, NO RAILINGS ARE ANTICIPATED ELSEWHERE ALONG THE RAMPS SINCE THEIR GRADES ARE LOWER THAN THE THRESHOLDS DEFINED BY ABAAS. NEW HANDICAPPED PARKING SPOTS WILL BE STRIPED IN THE EXISTING PAVED PARKING LOT. TWO DRAINAGE SWALES WILL BE INCLUDED BETWEEN THE EXISTING PARKING AREA AND RIVER PER MARYLAND REGULATIONS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A SECURE PERMANENT DOCK AND ASSOCIATED SUPPORT FACILITIES FOR THE 65-FOOT R/V FIRST STATE, A FISHERIES RESEARCH VESSEL OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL, DIVISION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE. THE DOCK AND ASSOCIATED FACILITIES WILL BE CONSTRUCTED IN LEIPSIC, KENT COUNTY, DELAWARE. THE R/V FIRST STATE IS CRITICAL TO THE DIVISION'S FISHERIES RESEARCH, ESPECIALLY FOR TWO FEDERAL SPORT FISH RESTORATION-FUNDED TRAWL SURVEYS. LEIPSIC PROVIDES AN IDEAL LOCATION FOR DOCKING THE R/V FIRST STATE BECAUSE THIS LOCATION IS: 1) CENTRALLY LOCATED ON DELAWARE BAY, 2) FAR ENOUGH FROM THE BAY TO PROTECT THE BOAT FROM STORMS, 3) THE ONLY INLAND PORT IN THE AREA WITH DEEP WATER ACCESS TO DELAWARE BAY, AND 4) THERE IS A DRY DOCK FACILITY IN THE TOWN OF LEIPSIC. THE R/V FIRST STATE IS CURRENTLY DOCKED IN LEIPSIC AT A RENTED DOCK LOCATION THAT MAY NOT BE AVAILABLE TO THE DIVISION IN THE FUTURE. IN ADDITION TO A DOCK, THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE RELATED FACILITIES REQUIRED TO SUPPORT THE R/V FIRST STATE'S OPERATION, INCLUDING ELECTRIC, FUEL, WATER, ICE, SECURITY AND A SMALL SHOP FOR MAINTENANCE AND EQUIPMENT STORAGE. DESIGN, ENGINEERING. PERMITTING AND BID AND CONSTRUCTION SUPPORT WILL BE PERFORMED BY A QUALIFIED ENGINEERING FIRM. CONSTRUCTION WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY A QUALIFIED CONTRACTOR SELECTED THROUGH A BID ADVERTISEMENT PROCESS CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATE LAW, REGULATIONS, AND POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

THE PURPOSED OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO COORDINATE AND ADMINISTER SPORT FISH RESTORATION ACTIVITIES IN COASTAL MISSISSIPPI.

SCDNR WILL CONTINUE TO MEET AND DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS WITH INDUSTRY REPRESENTATIVES. INITIALLY,
WE ARE FOCUSING OUR ACTIVITIES ON INDUSTRIES LOCATED WITHIN SOUTH CAROLINA BUT WILL ALSO BUILD
RELATIONSHIPS WITH INDUSTRIES OUTSIDE OF THE STATE, WHERE FEASIBLE.

CA SFR - AQUATIC RESOURCE EDUCATION PROGRAM GEORGE H.W. BUSH EDUCATION FUND VAMOS A PESCAR

PROVIDE AQUATIC RESOURCE AND FRESHWATER FISHING EDUCATIONAL AND OUTREACH OPPORTUNITIES
WITHIN SOUTH CAROLINA.
MANAGE THE GENETICS OF HATCHERY STRIPED BASS IN SOUTH CAROLINA TO REDUCE IMPACTS ON NATURAL POPULATIONS.
OPERATE AND MAINTAIN HATCHERIES TO PRODUCE AND STOCK FRESHWATER SPORT FISH IN THE PUBLIC WATERS OF SOUTH CAROLINA.
MAINTAIN PARKING FACILITIES, BOAT RAMP FACILITIES, ANGLER ACCESS, WATER QUALITY, PRODUCTIVITY, LAKE FACILITIES AND HABITAT TO ENHANCE FISHING OPPORTUNITIES AT STATE PUBLIC FISHING LAKES.
CONDUCT AND COORDINATE ALL FRESHWATER FISHERIES MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN SOUTH CAROLINA, INCLUDING SURVEY AND INVENTORY, FISH HABITAT ENHANCEMENT, TECHNICAL GUIDANCE, AND COORDINATION.
CONDUCT PATHOGENIC INVESTIGATIONS FOR FRESHWATER FISHERIES ISSUES IN SOUTH CAROLINA THROUGH THE SOUTHEASTERN COOPERATIVE FISH DISEASE PROJECT.

IL LONG-TERM AND TARGETED ASSESSMENTS OF LOTIC FISHES IN ILLINOIS F-197-R-02
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE CRITICAL ECOLOGICAL DATA AND ANALYSES TO IDNR NEEDED FOR THE EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF SPORT FISH POPULATIONS IN THE MACKINAW, KANKAKEE, AND IROQUOIS RIVER SYSTEMS. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO PROVIDE INFORMATION NEEDED TO ADDRESS LOW ABUNDANCES OF SMALLMOUTH BASS AND ASSESS THE SUCCESS OF THEIR STOCKING IN MACKINAW RIVER, TO ASSESS THE STATUS OF NORTHERN PIKE IN KANKAKEE RIVER, AND TO CONTINUE THE ESTABLISHED LONG-TERM SPORT FISH MONITORING PROGRAM IN THE KANKAKEE AND IROQUOIS RIVERS.

IL SPORT FISHING SURVEYS AND FISH COMMUNITY INVESTIGATIONS IN THE ILLINOIS WATERS OF LAKE MICHIGAN
F-196-R-3
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO OBTAIN SPORT HARVEST SURVEY INFORMATION TO ASSESS IMPACTS OF HARVEST ON FISH POPULATIONS AND DELIVER INFORMATION FOR EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT SERVES TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE FACTORS INFLUENCING EARLY LIFE HISTORY OF YELLOW PERCH, INCLUDING POPULATION SIZE AND STRUCTURE, YEAR-CLASS STRENGTH, AND POTENTIAL CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE SPORT FISHERY. FURTHERMORE, THIS PROJECT PROVIDES INFORMATION ON THE ABUNDANCE AND SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION OF POTENTIAL LAKE TROUT SPAWNING REEF HABITAT.

IL UPPER MISSISSIPPI RIVER FISH POPULATION MONITORING AND SPORT FISH ASSESSMENT IN WEST CENTRAL
ILLINOIS F-193-R-06
THE PURPOSE OF THE STUDY IS TO MONITOR FISH POPULATIONS IN A DATA LACKING REGION OF ILLINOIS (POOLS 19, 20, AND 21) TO DETECT TRENDS IN FISH COMMUNITY COMPOSITION AND STRUCTURE AND PROVIDE ILLINOIS SPORT FISHERMEN WITH INFORMATION TO BENEFIT THEIR ANGLING EXPERIENCE IN THESE UNDER-REPRESENTED REACHES OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND PROVIDE MANAGERS WITH INFORMATION TO BETTER MANAGE THE FISHERY RESOURCE AND HABITAT. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS SURVEY IS TO COMPLEMENT AND ENHANCE CURRENT EFFORTS BY THE IDNR TO MONITOR FISH COMMUNITY COMPOSITION AND STRUCTURE IN THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI RIVER. WE WILL ALSO PROVIDE A RELATIVE ASSESSMENT OF FISH POPULATION HEALTH THROUGHOUT THE ILLINOIS PORTIONS OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.

IL RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS OF FISHERIES IN ILLINOIS F-69-R-33
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PERFORM RESEARCH, SURVEYS AND INVESTIGATIONS THAT WILL ASSIST IN
THE MANAGEMENT AND ENHANCEMENT OF SPORT FISH POPULATIONS THROUGHOUT ILLINOIS. THIS PROJECT WILL
CONTINUE TO MANAGE LONG-TERM FISHERIES DATA SETS DERIVED FROM POPULATION ASSESSMENTS WHILE
CREATING MORE EFFICIENT DATA ENTRY PROCESSES AND PROVIDING EASILY ACCESSIBLE STATE-WIDE FISHERIES
DATA TO USERS IN SUPPORT OF OTHER STATE AND FEDERAL RESEARCH PROJECTS. THE INFORMATION GATHERED
FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE ILLINOIS' SPORT FISHING INFORMATION TO THE ANGLING PUBLIC
IN A READILY AVAILABLE, EASY TO UNDERSTAND FORMAT.

IL FISH PRODUCTION AND STOCKING, F-121-D-29, 15.605
THE PURPOSE OF F-121-D IS 'TO ANNUALLY MAINTAIN ILLINOIS FISH HATCHERY OPERATIONS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE FOR THE PROPAGATION AND REARING OF VARIOUS FISH SPECIES TO BE DISTRIBUTED STATEWIDE TO STATE AND PUBLIC WATERS OPEN TO PUBLIC ANGLING.' FISH PRODUCED BY THE HATCHERY SYSTEM ARE UTILIZED IN THREE TYPES OF STOCKINGS: STOCKING OF NEWLY IMPOUNDED OR CHEMICALLY REHABILITATED PUBLIC WATERS, SUPPLEMENTAL STOCKING OF EXISTING FISH POPULATIONS WITH POOR RECRUITMENT, AND ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF SPORT FISHERIES IN EXISTING WATERS.  THESE STOCKINGS CAN BE USED AS A TOOL TO CREATE NEW OR ENHANCE EXISTING FISHING OPPORTUNITIES AND INCREASE THE SUPPLY OF QUALITY FISHING DAYS.

IL - R3 SPORT FISH RESTORATION GRANT PROGRAM (TO STATE F&G AGENCIES ONLY)
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO HELP DEVELOP MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES THAT MAXIMIZE RECRUITMENT, GROWTH, POPULATION SIZE STRUCTURE, AND ANGLER HARVEST OF SPORTFISH IN ILLINOIS. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT CONTAINS STUDIES DIRECTED AT IMPROVING THE METHODOLOGY EMPLOYED BY ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES FISHERIES BIOLOGISTS. THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THIS WORK IS TO CONDUCT ANNUAL SURVEYS AND INVESTIGATIONS BENEFITTING SPORTFISH MANAGEMENT IN ILLINOIS LAKES AND RIVERS TO MEET GOALS OF THE DIVISION OF FISHERIES 2017-2022 STRATEGIC PLAN FOR THE CONSERVATION OF ILLINOIS FISHERIES RESOURCES. THIS BROADER OBJECTIVE INCLUDES STUDIES FOCUSED WITHIN FOUR RESEARCH AREAS DESIGNATED AS PRIORITIES BY THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES INCLUDING SPORT FISH ENHANCEMENT, HARVEST REGULATIONS, HABITAT ENHANCEMENT, AND SAMPLING METHODOLOGY. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES WITHIN EACH OF THESE AREAS ARE DESCRIBED WITHIN EACH PROPOSED STUDY.
